lEgdVd021tEGj0JzWaIoEg.text: Restaurant had nice decor and polite wait staff but the food was VERY disappointing. We went there for breakfast and were excited  to finally get a good meal but instead were greeted with burnt coffee and barely edible eggs benedict. The Hollindaise sauce tasted like mayonnaise, the ham was dry and the cost was high. I wouldn't dine here again.

2vgDiiEMqUxkQVS0TNmlXA.text: We ate here in April for lunch.  I prefer the dinner menu to the lunch menu for the appetizer selection.  I ordered a burger with a side of fries.  The burger was great and worth every cent.  The fries fell a little short for $10.  Jardin is still one of my favorite restaurants at the Wynn/Encore and I definitely plan to go back.

7OvIxF2VN5xr2yr0syRo-A.text: Bad service at the bar 5/17/16 shortly after noon from the older gentlemen bartender. Stood there for 5 mins before I was greeted by another younger bartender who showed up from the back room who then said the older gentleman would help me. And even then, the older gentleman ignored me and just shuffled things around in the counter.  Left as I was in a hit of a hurry.

eVDLDbvr4sa2h9NvgOvxmg.text: Forgettable food but unmatched ambiance.  The Buffalo cauliflower was pretty good.  The service timing was exceptionally poor. They did not bring the app before the meal but then accidentally brought an extra entree we had to return.  Then we went through the meal with no attention and wanted a round of drinks. We ordered but the drinks did not come for 10+ minutes and arrived with the check.

m3PmQ_CEfLxRpLKDsnB3og.text: We came to Le Jardin at The Wynn on Monday night for a business event - dinner with 30 clients - and we were truly amazed by the quality of the service, from the decor to the food without forgetting the friendliness of the waiters and waitresses. We had to add a few people last minute and change the seating plan and the staff was very helpful, accommodating each of our request. We had a memorable night there and would definitely recommend / go back.

nkE_y79C-bNEQkRCdmK59g.text: Terrible seating and wait service. Seems like a training ground for new Vegas wait staff. Food was decent and beautiful atmosphere but I would stay away.

tDB_rUXnUgaXXa3j_otqPQ.text: The Service was excellent. I ordered chicken and my wife ordered salmon. They give you soft pretzels which are amazing , the pizza is awesome. I really didn't like the chicken but that's my fault, I also ordered a flower pot cake for my wife's birthday and she loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken breast

-DWf44AfteEtx_O-aJ9yVA.text: So let me start off by saying that out host was polite and go us seated right away. Mind you it was 10pm on a saturday night so the restaurants only had 3 other tables filled. Before we ordered he was very attentive asking everyone in our table whether they had allergies or not. The problems comes after we order, I understand we had a party of about 10 people so the service would be delayed a bit however we did not expect to be waiting over 1hour and a half for our food. Now the food seemed to be reasonably priced (I ordered a filet minon medium rare $49). So not only did we wait what seemed an eternity but the food was  mediocre to say the least and that might even be shooting a tad too high. My filet mignon wasn't evenly cooked and even worse more than half of it was rare! When I brought it up to the hostess attention he said they can only try to cook what ever portion was left. Any and every place I have been they will serrve a new portion. The jardin burger my GF ordered was overcooked  and dry.  This was a birthday dinner for a good friend of mine that pretty much ruined our night.

9wQBdw_D8qDlN_ae3_nlkw.text: A great restaurant. I really appreciate their delicious healthy options. The kale salad on the dinner menu was fabulous. Also excellent: their Buffalo Cauliflower appetizer. Fabulous, unusual, and I will order these items again and again!!   A beautiful atmosphere: flowers everywhere.  Service was attentive, professional, warm, and knowledgeable.   I would have liked a more extensive cocktail menu. And their whiskey pours were pretty short.  Not cheap, but I thought a reasonable price for the high quality.    We also had breakfast here: the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't very good: they were super bland, and came with fake chemical maple syrup instead of the real stuff. Make sure to specify to get the real!   I'll be back!! Hoping they continue to improve this already great place.

jAUzYqM_KOO61L9QXPqdxA.text: Came here for a friend's b day dinner. Currently writing this review as I wait for my server to pick up the payment for my check... it that's any hint as to how bad the service was, considering I have time to write it.  The food was DECENT, at that. The vibe and environment is beautiful. But NOT worth the prices at all. And not to mention, our service was incredibly SLOW, when our server was NOT busy. It's a Tuesday night. We had to ask for things several times before receiving. The whole table was almost finished eating before the birthday guy's food came out because our server never came back to check on us to know it was missing. We were here for TWO hours. 1 person ordered a drink, the rest of us has water, no appetizers or desert and this still took this long. It sucks when you pay a large amount for crappy service and sub par food..... Don't waste your time!

p0J-2dDnTuWjF6Ak4_ffUA.text: Nothing on the menu really appealed to me. Got the chilled shrimp. Would NOT recommend unless you want to feel like super salty.

nKe4Ap7_TkFaUGY3LqZK4A.text: Horrible. Where do I start? I dutifully let the hostess know when I made my reservation that I would be needing the vegan menu. When I came and she was whisking me to my table, she pointed at a tray of desserts and said "You don't want to know about the desserts, do you?" Um, I guess not. It was several minutes before someone cane to take my drink order. Apparently, my waiter Roger was busy so this fella was going to fill in for a sec. Ok. I ordered the Dandelion cocktail and some water. After about 20 minutes, same fella came back and said "Roger is really backed up so I'll take your order." Mkay. I ordered the Buffalo cauliflower as an appetizer and the "red curry braised tempeh" for my entree. The cauliflower was really good. Then I sat there for an interminablr amount of time with an empty water glass, a crappy cocktail, and no breadsticks and watched a guy spend 30 minutes setting a table for 6 like he was Mr Carson and the Queen was coming to dinner. Did I mention the tables around me had bread? Then some guy with a ridiculous cart of copper cups asked me if I wanted a Moscow mule. No, but I'd like some water. At somepoint in this mess, my tempeh arrived and it was horrible.  When the person I assume was roger dropped the dessert menu on my table, I was Visibly ticked off. A manager of some kind came around to make nice since I was fuming. His excuse was that Mr Wynn was going to coming in for dinner. He comped my tempeh and I stormed out 37 dollars poorer. I hope for their sake Mr Wynn did not show up to that poor excuse for a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horrible unseasoned tempeh
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only bright spot. The cauliflower.
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of empty tables. And the music was bizarre. The Eagles? Huh?

opBp_-DYiFNJS4bd93qtNw.text: Wait!!! They need to be in business a little longer. One star because the servers were wonderful but the food was awful. 27.00 for a lobster roll which basically had 2 small pieces of lobster. Mainly 2 square pieces of bread. Cubano  sandwich was greasy. The fries were chewy.  The short rib tacos came out cold but 2 orders were taken off the bill which was very nice of the manager.  Give it some time and hopefully they'll find out what a real lobster roll is!

0gEfQZPtDzNu-KrYDLKGFw.text: I am staying at the hotel and came down here because it seemed like a really nice spot to have lunch outside by the pool after a very long flight. The venue itself is really pretty but the service I received wasn't  the best. I expected more considering the location. It was not busy at all but my waitress forgot my drink and then wasn't around for about 15 minutes after I had been  done eating and was looking for the check. The food is good but my experience was nothing special and not worth the price.

MaQwi4m5auwN1UlOqAItCw.text: This was our first time in the Encore and we came here yesterday for lunch and were seated right away. They weren't very busy which was great and the place had a nice vibe. But we waited for a least 10 minutes for someone to come to the table. A waitress came to tell us someone would be with us in a minute, and then we waited some more. We thought about just walking out but then a waiter finally came. He was good, but honestly we won't be going back. The food wasn't the greatest, it was just okay and the waiter was good but the waiting around kind of blew it for us. I have feeling he wasnt supposed to have our table in the first place. When you pay that amount for food, everything from the minute you walk in to the minute you leave should be outstanding.

7OxtzfOuIvslLNCOGcbhSg.text: Decent food & horrible service. When we arrived, the place was 80% empty. It took them 15 minutes to seat us at a table. Then when we sat down, took another 10 minutes just for the server to come get drink orders. We had to ask for check 4 times with 4 different people to get it. Also realized when we were walking out that everyone had bread on their tables and we were never even offered bread. Never going back, would not recommend it. Much better places to eat at the Wynn

ZTgVGfTe6ZQ0RnpFNM96_A.text: Food was average. We came after breakfast time and were dying for breakfast and our server went back and talked to the chef and was able to make us breakfast. Very happy with the service but the food was nothing special.

TFwZOHpvvg3BePUn_Q-ghQ.text: I've had breakfast here for 4 straight days - the service is good, the atmosphere is very relaxed and inviting and the food is better than the other options around Wynn/Encore.

6Rd67f3UGCc9hvzX7qyziw.text: It was alright, food was overhyped, service could have been better. Didn't really appreciate getting kicked out by Erica. Really? After spending $300 and asked to leave. Customer is always WRONG! Sorry, try another restaurant...

M35f8oqxjcF5w3G3JmDSsA.text: Came here late after a Cirque show. Wonderful service and best meal I had in a long time. Attention to detail, exquisite flavors and cooked perfectly. Amazing decor and atmosphere for a romantic evening. Will definitely be back here!

8Uc9tmIH_Yas-w2pxlCA8w.text: The steak and eggs are perfect. The filet tip was so tender; I was really happy. The eggs Benedict was rated an 8 out of 10 by my dining partners. Overall this is a great spot. It's not the cheapest spot but definitely worth it.

bC_t3P03FZnonGpbsjgwMg.text: I came here on Christmas day, my bf surprised me and Im only reviewing now but first off, whoever cooked my hash-browns this day deserves a prize! They were perfectly made and were probably the best hash browns Ive ever had. The pancakes were good but I expected more, and my friend had the lobster eggs Benedict which he said was great and with lots of lobster! Tea service was good as well! The decor is to die for! It makes the experience so much better!! Service was also great!! Our waiter was very knowledgeable with the menu and nice and attentive. For dessert we had the flower pot chocolate raspberry cake which is delicious and moist! The whole cake is edible including flowers! I got this cake also my for birthday and will also give it to my bf for his birthday! Only $17! Worth every penny!! I LOVE jar-din!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5_j4CFQXxhxeCQ-q64TkPw.text: Just love this place! Been here several times both for a date night and night out with a big group of girl friends.  The service has always been kind and attentive. The design is also amazing with beautiful flower arrangements, nice decor and classy set up.    I have had a lot of items on the menu and so far,  the favorites have been the steak, Mac and cheese bites, and truffle pizza. You really can't go wrong with anything, though.    Price is expected for a high end steakhouse in Vegas at the best hotel on the strip. You gotta love it!

IiMTdHU1olW8jAgpSEvNBA.text: While the Wynn does not list Jardin as a fine dinning experience, I would argue that the food quality and flavors, the service, and experience overall could rival a many fine dining establishments:) The server was great! Up-selling - without being annoying; and attentive- without being clingy. The management was very attentive as well, ensuring we enjoyed our experience:) the salad, soup, and appetizers were great! The pasta and house signature burger were fab:) oh! and the truffle fries and portobello fries are amazing and so flavorful! Dessert- great! Cocktails- great! I would highly recommend! Cannot wait to go back:)

0MmOrm3jPa7DUCkuaw5y4w.text: The beautiful surroundings with the pool in the backdrop - and the inside floral art arrangements and decor - presented a colorful experience! The wife and I enjoyed the food immensely! Those crab cakes were the MOSTEST! We are coming AGAIN!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w2IdGxSwPdzOG8OQxbBQUQ.text: Where do I begin? The initial greating by the host was equivalent to that of a mid shit Denny's host. Very flat and a demeanor of someone who is just passing through. Upon entering, perhaps its just me but my hat was on backwards with jeans and a button up. Normal I'm tired and need food ensemble. When told to turn my hat around I get a little pissed. I'm a 50 year old man. I'm far from  the age of being told how to afix my hat. But hey rules are rules so I acquiesced. After being greeted by a server who turned out to be FANTASTIC I settled on the chicken chilaquiles. A dish that I know and love. Once the dish arrived and I took the picture all of 1 min I bit into the dish from the bottom.  What resulted was cold sauce and limp chips. This is where the wheels come off. The lack of care into the assembly speaks highly of the line. In my opinion, it comes down to hey I'm cooking for the masses and they won't know any different. Epic failure comes with consequences. Obviously the meal was sent back and I ordered a VERY UNEVENTFUL bacon and eggs. The bacon was limper than an 80 year old mans Johnson. My advice,  find some line cooks who care about the preparation of the dish. Show some care and love. It ended with half eaten breakfast,  an apology by the GM, and a tip for the server. Come for the view and apps during the day maybe. Breakfast avoid.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eHNpyCN30o1elLwAeX2d-w.text: Hardly worth the price.  Food was mediocre at best, small portions.  I ordered the salmon with carrots, salmon was good, nothing special, and the carrots were really just a few pieces of carrot peels. The kind you discard when you're peeling them at home.  On a plus, the ambiance is great!

GfomjEDMSdlkcavD43J3Aw.text: Jardin, I am soooo sad that you have less than perfect reviews.... Hopefully my review will take you out of the orange zone and into the red zone....  Our breakfast experience at Jardin was nothing but perfect. We asked to be seated on the patio. It was a bit chilly so we asked for the heaters to be turned on. The employees were very attentive and nice.  The Coffee: It is from Fonte coffee roaster in Seattle. Steve Wynn made a special trip up there to choose this coffee to be served at Jardin so it is super special and ofcourse one of the kind.....Just do yourself a favor and order it.  The Nutella french toast was amazing..... It had walnut on the top.... I don't like any kind of nuts in my food so for next time I will order it w/o them.  I don't usually say this, but if you find yourself within 100 miles radius of Wynn hotel, get to it.... Just to try that heavenly coffee.... Yup it is that Good!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can&#39;t find this coffee anywhere in the whole World besides here.... Picked Personally by Wynn Himself.....
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No caption needed....
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella French Toast...... Yum O

enCRI3KB8Jmv49Js97ZE3w.text: Amazing breakfast in the Encore, very bright and colorful decor, service was amazing, espresso very good combined with their Dirty Mary, a Bloody Mary with olive juice and blue cheese stuffed olives (they have five different types of Bloody Mary cocktails. All entrees we decided to split to taste as much as possible. Chicken omelette substituted with egg whites was fantastic! Jack cheese peppers topped with a generous amount of avocado, their hash brown potatoes are small but incredible. Maine lobster Benedict was incredible eggs cooked to perfection and hollandaise sauce was on point and the sauteed spinach was a nice accompaniment. French toast came with caramelized apples on top I was a little apprehensive about because it looked like someone reached into a loaf of bread and decided to make it out of wonder bread. It was fantastic, maple custard and bacon was a pleasant surprise all in all one of the best I have ever had!!  I considered closing the meal with an antioxidant smoothy but I choose to just order pomegranate juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorful
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light and Airy
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast

P7EDi0SU1wPQUFEODEIH8Q.text: Came here for brunch with my mom. There was a wait of about 20 min until we got seated but nothing a little shopping can't take up. There are brunch options for every taste here so it's difficult to be disappointed. We decided to start with coffee and some drinks- which were delicious but took about 15 min to come out, so I am knocking off one star for slow service. To my surprise my almond milk latte had a Mona Lisa on it, very memorable touch. If you are vegan there are some great options for you and the server knew what she was talking about. I ordered the "just egg" product, a vegan egg replacement that just hit the market and I was surprised to see on the menu. The potatoes were good too and my favorite color, purple. Our breakfast came with a side of toast, and they had wide variety of options for bread and even vegan butter. The ambiance outside was nice and not as noisy as inside and they do put out patio heaters if it's a little chilly. Overall great experience, will come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mona Lisa Latte
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8hYsOJxq3qsQUg6MYVFmbw.text: Omg people order the Ragin Cajun Mary!! It is divine and delicious! Best I've ever had! It also came with a huge tiger prawn which was a nice touch.   The Chicken Ceasar Salad was really good. No complaints there.   Also had the Croque Madame for breakfast the next day and it was so good! The ham was very flavorful and the whole sandwich was just cooked perfectly.   A plus also was that the coffee was very good.   The waiters were also very attentive. My coffee was never empty .   This place is definitely one I will be going to again!

4Sz_XfT1AtEAsCw_qYQZQw.text: I came here last week with some business associates and while the food itself was great, the service was not. Our drinks, meal, to go dish, and check all took SEVERAL requests from several different staff members before being brought to us. Certainly not what you'd expect when spending a bit of money on a breakfast. Three requests spanned over 15 minutes for a diet soda? A side of pancakes being brought out once everyone's done eating, despite the two inquisitions previously made at the arrival of the rest of the dishes.. not acceptable, and not worth coming back. They need to do a refresher on what it means to be AT WORK, instead of standing around in groups of 3, chatting while paying customers struggle to get their full meal and drinks.

KePPJibUrIDaroHAfbayng.text: I expect a little more. Chris takes my order and asks me for my card and ID before my appetizer gets to the table. He then charges me and places the bill in front of me and says take your time. Tuna tartare comes and I have no silverware, no biggie. But how does the guy charge me before my food comes. I guess no desert or coffee for me

Eav2YS4SiPIdUvl0GPzOrw.text: Such a good part of the Vegas experience! I came here right before getting on my flight and it was such a nice way to end. They have an outdoor seating area which is where we sat. The food was clean, good portioned and delicious. I was definitely satisfied after!

n7Omy2lPLO_z22eWjVFZQg.text: Let's talk tomato soup for a second, can we? In Las Vegas? At a hotel restaurant?   Yes and yes! Jardin had the second best I've ever had and maybe the best croutons ever. And don't get me stated on the pretzel bread sticks with mustard butter. Yeah, mustard BUTTER!!! Epic. The soup was so textured and perfect. Not so much cream that you lost the tomato or vise versa. With just a bite and a dash of mancheco on top. Very very good.   The steak salad was just as good (the burgers that went by also looked unreal) and came with an actual steak! Not little strips, but a hunk of burning love.. hey it's Vegas after all. Then the salad part that was so well thought out and over by itself.   Service was so good and quick. Professional would be the word. And the setting was gorgeous as is most of the Wynn properties!   Lastly, a Bloody Mary cart went by with a smiling bartender. That I will save for next time! Looked great.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bloody Mary cart.
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The steak salad!!! Wow!
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The soup!

hIDu-Bwyf6gbeFpXE-JsXQ.text: The restaurant I frequent most when staying at the amazing Encore.  Today I'm enjoying the quinoa and avocado salad with grilled chicken.  Delicious!  Great staff and beautiful space.

LYC7ONyks6eTw64J_o3vFg.text: Food was excellent as was the service , I highly recommend the cauliflower appetizer. Can't wait to dine again

t4CrP0P7jF1GzSpnLMtD8Q.text: came here once in June and enjoyed the pasta, so i decided to come here again for brunch.  For the price, yeah kinda expected it to be high since its in encore hotel, food portion is a bit small but its enough for us. I had their 3 egg breakfast and lobster egg Benedict, tasted decent. The service is great which is what i love about this hotel and its restaurant. If i stay in encore again i will return because it is nicely decorated with a pool view.

The coffee was pretty good too. Trying to go back tonight for our last night in Vegas for dessert for the flower pot signature dish!

mUhHwB3s-EQuoz3b5rymDg.text: Jardin is the perfect spot to celebrate a special occasion in Vegas without breaking the bank. They are incredibly accommodating & knowledgeable about dietary restrictions & allergies with an extensive menu to accommodate for everyone. I'll be back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate mouse cake (all edible) - a great spot to celebrate an anniversary or special occasion
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Cauliflower (vegan) - a must order!
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan bread &amp; butter - stupid good, my bf eats dairy &amp; loved this butter!

QHXw0-28TSjJWtDg49MT6Q.text: Came here twice. One night for drinks and one day for breakfast. Both times I have been here was great. Service was fast and very good. I love the breakfast here. I ordered steak and eggs which was I exactly wanted. It came with perfectly cooked hash browns and choice of bread. The steak was cooked perfectly and just the right portion for what I wanted for breakfast. Not too big and not too small. BUT don't expect this to be cheap because this is in between Encore and Wynn. Would definitely come back here again for drinks before going to Surrender and for breakfast and get the steak and eggs.

lp4BGfezD3qIWCBo-3FrZA.text: Mohammed, our food runner was great! Very attentive and friendly. I was also very grateful for the fact that there were vegan options on the menu. Unfortunately, the rest of our experience was quite underwhelming. Our server was double sat by the hostess, so he took about 20 minutes to take our order and we probably waited another 20 minutes to get our drinks (which were delivered by a shaky, unapologetic manager). The only reason I know the server was double sat is because that's the first thing he told us when he came to take our order; he was visibly upset and made us all feel very unwelcome. The experience only got better when Mohammed delivered our food; that was literally the only time we felt welcome and accommodated. My friends were visiting from out of town and I was so excited to bring them here for brunch; instead I left disappointed and embarrassed for having brought them to such an overrated & lackluster establishment. Living in this city, we are spoiled with so many dining options and you expect to get the best of the best at Wynn or Encore but I've honestly had better service at Applebee's!

QKpKMEPvcLJOAvOsQ-6lsQ.text: Service is outstanding. Ambience is wonderful. Hard to get outdoors seating during busy hours. Food is small in potion but very well made. Frenchie.

kv5UAzYyiFVreFX_BNTneA.text: Great food, gray ambience, Gabe took good care of me

QAHcaQjBRKMyyO77sJt_0w.text: I love the Wynn and Encore properties and almost everything in them. Jardin is no exception. I eat here almost every Vegas trip. I just love the bright colors, the attention to detail, and the patio that overlooks the pool. Perfect spot for a relaxing lunch. The food and drinks are expensive, as everything in Vegas is, but good enough to be worth it. I love almost all their cocktails but my favorites are: cucumber martini and ginger poppy martini. As far as the food, again I like almost everything, but my favorites are the kale salad and fried chicken burger. Definitely ask for the bread basket. It comes with soft pretzel sticks and a honey mustard butter. So good!  I'll be back on my next trip!

e1wEklVq5pmqbqozKFtImQ.text: I am on the Wynn and Encore properties at least once a week for business and for leisure.  I make Jardin my go-to breakfast or lunch spot because there is no other restaurant in town that understands or approaches complete breakfast/lunch service like Jardin.   The General Manager, Brooke, and her amazing staff work well with the Chef and the back of the house to create an amazing dining experience.   The hostess staff is pleasant and accommodating, the service is amazing and the food is top flight. The venue is down right gorgeous.

iDfj8cqDZN65MhX_Ucs3Xw.text: YUM! The Encore and Wynn won't let you down, regardless of how casual the dining is or how upscale. Jardin, my readers, is the perfect medium. Offering delicious cocktails and American fare, I went with the lettuce wrapped turkey burger and broccolini. Hands down best turkey patty I've ever had. Also the best twist to a Moscow Mule I've ever sipped on. The pool side ambiance is wonderful during dinner as well - just make sure you make a reservation on Open Table. This place can get pretty crazy!

STKmH3o0k3f3YqGRHdbJMg.text: Came here for dinner as a party of 4.  Took about 10 minutes to be seated, despite there being no-one else waiting and the restaurant being only around one third full.  The place was very nice. Server was very enthusiastic and friendly. We only ordered entrees, which took around 45 minutes to arrive!  Unfortunately, once the food got there, it was ordinary at best. My steak (Rib Eye) was ok - but it was $45 for what would have been a $20 steak elsewhere.  Other people with me had the Fried Chicken (overcooked, not much flavour), the Organic Salmon (overcooked) and Turkey Burger (dry, not much flavour).  I wouldn't recommend this place for dinner at all. Maybe it's ok for breakfast/brunch, but it failed to deliver for us.

Frdt1h8m9OMqakdhPGVZ9g.text: Freaking legit!!!!! Best eggs Benedict I've ever had. The devote is just stunning and our server Rick was so wonderful. We had the yummiest bloody Mary's with a shrimp in it. I'm coming back here every time I'm in vegas!!!

SO9kYT6GbeXgilMSc89tLw.text: The current review is for dinner. The last review was for brunch. Wine for dinner was lovely, a Malbec. Yet, food was just OK. I ordered many small dishes including their yellowtail tartare, Burrata, beet salad with smoked salmon,kale salad, and octopus grilled. All entrees were good with the kale salad being the best of them all.  For entrees, we ordered the short rib ravioli and a tofu with mushroom and Asian noodles. The tofu with mushroom dish, which is vegan, was outstanding, with phenomenal spices and a lovely overall presence. The ravioli was boring and a little too sour due to some strange sauce on top of it and it just was anything but impressive. Honestly, the best part of the meal was the pretzels that came at the beginning which are equivalent to a bread basket. The downside was they had a horse radish like butter that I did not enjoy but the pretzel sticks were so good that all else did not matter.  Therefore, it was only a three star experience and food is just OK. Very expensive. $125 per person with tax which counts a bottle of wine for 2, A few appetizer dishes, and two entrees. No dessert as way too full.

t4hlpFzIt9NgH8JvO0mFZA.text: Never going back. The server was rude and racist. It's a good thing I was preoccupied while breastfeeding my son. Had it been a different day, I would have asked for a talk with the manager.

-fzSZHy_EamilwOIW3bQDQ.text: Hey Michelle the hostess... As a hostess, it would be appropriate to address the person that gets to your hostess stand first, not the "celebrity hairstylist from the hotel" who is 20 ft behind me and who is probably going to get his meal comp'd anyway. I am sure my money spends just as well as his. You never know who you will be snubbing when you overlook people....like presidents of large pharmaceutical companies. Just sayin. If you are going to be in the service industry, then serve, regardless of the clientele. If you want to serve the hairstylist, maybe he needs a nanny.    #fail

ScI47K2Qva_dPx2JXNlWyw.text: Very disappointing experience we had at the Jardin restaurant. We checked in at the Encore hotel on 10/17/17 and decided to go for lunch to Jardin restaurant. We ordered tune poke which is raw fish; kale salad and desert. Me and my girlfriend got sick right after lunch. Had to to drug store buy medicine. The pain and discomfort didn't go away; I called the manager hours later lunch explained what happened he's said he has to call security to file report. Manager didn't ask what we ate and didn't offer to take off the bill. Security came to the room and file report and that's it. I checked out on 10/19/17 and had to pay for Jardin restaurant which we got sick from. I was very surprised that five star hotel and restaurant have these standards and don't take care of their customers. The only thing manager called and said that they did investigation and nothing was wrong with fish. Sounded like they didn't believe us that we got sick from eating their food. I was very disappointed and never will return to Jardin restaurant.

WsKpmsguTE2Ct0RNNmD3dg.text: Looks great from the outside, but quite underwhelming once you begin to dine. We ordered the turkey burger, salami and mushroom pizza, tomato soup and butterscotch pudding. None of these dishes were anything special. Total bill was $100. We won't be going back as the cheap food quality and high price tag made for an overall disappointing experience.

5Khyj-yqYJF7e3kASIKIpQ.text: Worst restaurant in Wynn. Horrible service. Love the other restaurants in Wynn. Maybe just Sunday night is horrible.

lyhiyYYZR2rBGgy0HZsJBg.text: In some ways, it seems like a poolside version of the now closed Society Cafe, which was a favorite of mine. I think this Jardin just replaced it, actually. Some of the menu items are the same and a lot of the staff also transferred over. The service is just as good and so is the food. Jessie is a sweetheart, so I was glad to see her again. The Cubano Sandwich was very good and the temperature on the patio was perfect. I'm sure I'll eat here again.

yfdoWVehGi30ZjNfzWNcVw.text: The waitress was very accommodating and the food was quite yummy.  I had chardonnay and for dinner had a slice of the margarita pizza and the mac n cheese poppers ( I think that is what it is called ). Not too bad. The place itself is beautiful as we sat down by a big ball of flowers in the middle of the restaurant. The down side was that I had asked the waitress to bring out one of the deserts with a candle since it was my friends birthday but when it was dessert time, the waiter who brought it out just brought it out without a candle and didn't even put it in front of the bday girl which we specifically identified. Awkwardly, the waitress realized and took it back in, put a candle on the side and laid it back down and left. It was awk but we made the best of it.

17I8ATLqGO7fkGFCjRJlZQ.text: Eww. Don't get the beef short rib taco. The beef was so dry and hard that it tasted like pork. They give you very little guacamole with the entree. Flavorless entree. Terrible service. Our waitress looked like it pained her to take our order and that we were bothering her if we needed something. Unfriendly and inattentive. Probably because they include the gratuity for a large party. Not only that, but they'll tax you on top of the top they pre add. One star for the Mac and cheese appetizer and bread, and another star for the beautiful decor.

lfbWPMgxRuHWEaLxc1odNQ.text: Jardin recently opened at Encore, having replaced Botero and Society Cafe. The cuisine is essential Society Cafe, but more elegant and less casual, but in all honesty, everything at Wynn/Encore isn't casual. If you remember Society Cafe, you'll notice the plate ware and flatware are the same! (Save where you can right? :P) The food was all amazing, as was expected. The service was lacking just a smidgen but that could've been because our waitress was training someone else. The only hiccup was that she mistakenly switched our crab legs for another crab dish, and by the time the crab legs were ready, the rest of the meal came out.   For cocktails, they have a full bar of course but also a Mule Cart going around the restaurant making Moscow Mules and their mixed mules were amazing. We ordered the orange and it was great! We ended up ordering another each time he came around! If you have a big party, he can make a big one that services 16! For appetizers we had a flatbread which was basically an entire pizza. We expected a small rectangular size with maybe 4 small pieces total, but this was a full on pizza. But delicious nonetheless. As I said, we also got the King Crab legs. However, these weren't the same as you'd find in the buffet. My photo will show it's 2 tiny pieces already taken out of the legs. It was delicious but not expected. For our entrees, we ordered the oven baked prawns, which came on a bed of rice. There were about 6 prawns, decent size and deliciously seasoned. The rice was a bit al dente for me. We also ordered the short rib ravioli which was apparently great. However, you get like 5 raviolis. We had to get a side order of the oven baked mac and cheese which was a huge side order but delicious. And of course, what we were so excited to try was the potted planter chocolate cake. Everything is edible. You break open the pot and there you'll find the most decadent, non-overwhelming cake with dark chocolate mousse. A must try! But not just for one. We were 2 people and we couldn't finish it. Overall an 8/10 based on price vs. quantity ratio. Would go back just for the Moscow Mules and the cake!

kEaNHLIsAAwnInmMjg-HKQ.text: If you're looking for a great brunch spot, look no further. Jardin is where it's at.   They (and the rest of the Wynn establishments) have a good handle on vegan options and food allergies. That said, our server was a bit confused about the difference between vegan and gluten free. It was all good in the end, although a word of warning is that they cannot make a vegan bloody mary, apparently (I'm neither vegan nor a fan of bloodies, but my friend is both).   That said, the food was great. I ordered the Three Egg Breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, and sourdough toast. Everything was great, but the hash browns were something else - they were crispy on the outside, softer on the inside, and deliciously seasoned. I asked for my bacon extra crispy and it came out pretty close to how I like it. Our table shared an order of sweet potato waffle fries, too, and they were tasty.   Coffee was great and regularly refilled, and my bellini was delicious. Definitely sit outside if you can - they have a wonderful patio area!

3EFcnIewFtQhP6QruYO_aQ.text: We had dinner here on our first night at the Encore tower suites. We were extremely disappointed in the Encore, and struggled to find a restaurant that was not filled with smoke, as they all front the casino floor, the smokiest by  far of all high end hotels we have stayed at in Las Vegas. Jardin is the only exception, as it sits away from the casino a little bit, and we were able to eat our one and only meal at the Encore that week, without being buried in cigarette smoke.  The staff is amazing, almost too attentive, but that's hard to complain about these days.  Like everything in the Wynn properties, it was overpriced, but we were glad to pay a premium for the privilege of still being able to breathe freely.  Food was great, though not excellent, so a four star review is merited.

KkOmxPHUdqGBqnj4ZxDZMg.text: It's rare I give 5 stars but this afternoon's experience was highly exceptional and excellent. My friend and I were there to plan his wedding over  late afternoon cocktails and snacks. Restaurant was busy both inside and at the patio where we were sat. Service was impeccable- THANKS to our gracious server Adam who took care of us outside his designated station. He made sure everything was perfect. It was. Caleb, who took over at the later part also made sure we end our afternoon happy. Kudos to Jardin and the very accommodating manager Lisa. Mission accomplished. It was a very pleasant experience and we are definitely coming back.

xlyRSchgzGTFJuoaAMEYlA.text: We returned Jardin for dinner on a Sunday night. The manager Lisa made sure everything was perfect for us. Thumb up for the service. Too bad they changed the signature center piece. Hope they bring back another glamorous set soon.

OzTMNLLyMafkdP4BnRCjhQ.text: We enjoy breakfast here when staying at Encore.  Great service and food is good.  It is not cheap.  Breakfast for two (without any booze) is typically $70.   But what do you expect?  Your at the Encore so we believe it is worth it.   Tables outside are poolside and worth the wait.    Only complaint are the hostesses.  They come across cold and uninformed as to your wait time estimate.   Once you check in with them they tell you to stand "over there".   Could be much more efficient if they would allow you the opportunity to stroll the nearby shops or casino and text you when table is ready.    TIP; make a reservation, your wait will be shorter

CI9g4XmSMFzrnpIV8gh5KQ.text: Horrible service, we came for a late dinner around 10 P.M. and were seated quickly. The hostess told us the server would be right with us with the menus, and ten minutes later there was still no server or menus. We didn't even get water, it was like we were invisible. After receiving no service I went to go talk to the hostess about the lack of service and yet we still received no service afterwards. At this point we were fed up and we walked out. Keep in mind the restaurant was not busy and there were only about eight other tables. This is unacceptable service for a restaurant in a five star hotel. Will not be returning!  . . .  Update: Caroline reached out to us and offered a complimentary dinner for two. The restaurant manager met at the hostess table and we felt very welcomed as she seated us. Our server was also very attentive. Overall the food was good, drinks were good, and the service was what we expected from this restaurant in the first place. We will definitely come back after this experience.

tZW6QdhZI9j-bNZkRvyLWQ.text: I've probably walked by here a million times coming and going to XS, yet never really give Jardin a second look into dining.  This visit brought me here for my friend's bachelorette dinner. Although I wasn't entirely hungry, I did order chicken noodle soup. It was the perfect remedy for a slight hangover. I did have a taste of the roasted chicken and wow was that moist. The chicken breast was so juicy and tender, it didn't even taste like I was eating white meat. And the mini pretzel loafs were delicious. Comes fresh and warm. Oh, and the dessert! We shared the chocolate cake that looks like a pot of flowers. Everything was edible. We felt so guilty breaking it apart. It was so pretty!  Beautiful huge floral decor in the center. Felt almost whimsical inside. The staffs are super attentive and friendly. We never had to wave them down to refill our water. I forgot our servers name, but she was great and patient handling 14 girls orders. When the food was brought to the table, they knew who ordered what. I appreciate the little details.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert! Everything is edible

ViyzNGXLRhhGeVziPsbFnA.text: Jardin is a great lunch destination and I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere is garden-like and bright. Our wait staff was pleasant and extremely efficient.   My daughter ordered a chicken sandwich as did I. I found the chicken to be juicy, tender and perfectly seasoned. My cousin ordered some egg contraption from the menu. I'm not exactly sure what it was, but she enjoyed it.   I've noticed some previous reviews complain about the portion sizes here. Bah! I found the portions to be perfect, and I was full at the end of my meal. While some chain restaurants out there pump out huge extra, extra large sizes of subpar food - I appreciated the appropriate sized portion of food that was well flavored at Jardin.  The adult beverages we had were good. However, they only serve margaritas on the rocks - not blended - which I thought was a bummer.  Overall, a good experience and delicious food. We will definitely return.

pv6Ds3e0bWxG59C_eAprdw.text: I knew I wanted to dine at Jardin for 2 reasons: the Impossible burger and the flower pot cake.  I was happy to get both! We started with Tito's and soda and a Van Rose.  Both delicious.  My husband got the prix fixed menu while I chose to do a mishmash of options for my meal. I started with the "beef' croquettes, which are made of the Impossible meat.  Basically, it looks and tastes like beef but is a pure vegetarian protein.  My husband tasted it and said that if he wasn't told it wasn't beef he wouldn't have known that it was veggie.  It's now more available at Umami and The Counter.  I got the chicken entree, while my husband had the crab cake and the filet. He liked his crab cake and the filet. I also enjoyed my meal but wanted to save room for dessert.  My husband received a butterscotch pot de creme and he enjoyed it. But I was waiting for my flowerpot cake.  It did not disappoint! It literally looks like a flowerpot and for $18, you got a large cake.  It is so good.  And when you make the first break into that pot, and the cake comes oozing out, it's so worth it.  The cake was rich and had a wonderful layer of raspberry jam filling.  It was rich, moist and enough to have for random bites over the next few days (when kept on ice).  The is not a cheap meal but with the beautiful garden and floral ambiance, neat looking colorful bar and great meal choices, I recommend coming here.  And get that cake to share with your table mates. So delicious.

HkLZYylfrtYfAETMAOoldQ.text: Stayed at encore and came here for a quick lunch with my fiance and was seated by the garden patio. We ordered the crab cake and the truffle mushroom pizza.   Crab cake was delicious! A bit pricey for only 3 pieces!?but... I loved the chili oil and the lemon aioli that goes so perfectly well with the crab cake, the jicama slaw was very refreshing.   Truffle mushroom pizza! OMG this pizza is so delightful and so flavorful! I would definitely order this pizza again and again and again..... it's a must try!   Atmosphere and staff was great!

v0jAS9krQhhBU2RrIAT91A.text: Located by the exit going from Wynn to Encore, Jardin has an openness with plenty of natural lights that gives the seating area an airiness feel while looking out to a pool area.  We had drinks and apps to satisfy our strip experience since we normally don't go down there, and weren't disappointed when we left.   Margarita on the rocks with no salt, Gin (Hendricks) and tonic, shrimp cocktail, and truffle fries were our poison.  The truffle fries were awesome and worth the $17!   So if you find yourself at Wynn and want a quick drink and food, give this place a whirl... cheers!

1Msia1hpy-nzcTFeY9itsQ.text: I had mixed luck with the food here: the Shrimp Capellini was "adequate" - it left something to be desired, and I would not order it again. However, the Adult Grilled Cheese & Hearty Vegetable Soup were surprisingly good.  Similarly, I had mixed luck with the service here: the staff generally took pretty good care of us, but one of the servers was a bit clumsy and spilled some soup while attempting to deliver it to us (yes, I know the job is not easy, but it does bear mentioning).  The seats are comfortable, and you get a nice view in the heated patio. Overall, I would come back here again, but I would definitely order something else. The Barbecue Short Rib Sandwich looks pretty good.

iEdKLIX3KGkvFyVpErXyrg.text: We have been to the wynn several times before, we like the quality. This time they were really missed the mark. The service was attentive and friendly, a professional server named Carlos. The restaurant was half empty but the food took an extended amount of time. When it arrived the lobster club had a strong order- not fresh. The spaghetti was tasteless and over cooked. The culinary really fell flat on this occasion.  Our expectations are much higher at a hotel like wynn.

xa8oUlO3ogxGBIel0oCckA.text: SUMMARY: Nice seating options and a basic menu that was quite good. The portions are sizable although the coffee was pretty bad. They do parking validation so feel free to park at the Wynn to eat here. If you sit outside, be warned that the birds will get quite close to you.   VERDICT: I would return here on my next excursion to Vegas (if that happens, ha!)  ITEMS ORDERED: (1) French dip sandwich -- I ordered this and it was HUGE. In hindsight I should have split something with my family (the prosciutto pizza was awesome and definitely shareable between two people) but it was so good. The horseradish wasn't overpowering and the au jus was a perfect complement to the sandwich.  (2) Prosciutto pizza -- huge pizza! 8-10 slices of thin-crust pizza that was also topped with arugula (although not the spicy kind, unfortunately!) (3) Lobster benedict -- my sister had this one and she seemed to think it was just okay, although I think she did probably enjoyed this place the least among the four of us.   Unfortunately I can't remember what my dad got (knowing him, some preparation of fish) but I don't remember any complaints from him. The coffee, however, is bad, and no amount of milk can make that liquid palatable to drink. Still, this was probably the most pleasant dining experience I had in Vegas in terms of the food served, so feel free to check it out (along with my reviews of places I did NOT like, in case you were curious!)

LqiPAAOChXGNAW-GqEyqXQ.text: Talk about a nice ambience, Jardin was a very pleasant way to start the day. There were very nice views of the pool outside as well as the "garden" theme inside where we sat. We were hoping to have room for the all edible flower pot dessert but we overdid it with out brunch meal. Maybe next time!

7m8tF36uMnTDr-JY1VlbYA.text: A lovely spot for lunch/brunch! I'm a sucker for pretty flowers, so the decor won me over immediately, but the food doesn't disappoint.   The smoked salmon and eggs were delicious, flavorful without being overpowering, and filling. The most memorable menu item was definitely the flower pot cake, which is almost too pretty to eat. An Instagram worthy foodie pic! The cake was moist and not too sweet. Enough for a few people to share.  Service usually is pretty good, although it can be a little slow at times, even when the restaurant isn't busy. I've found this to be True at other Wynn restaurants, but I think it's because they don't want the diners to feel rushed.  Their menu is a bit pricey, but that's to be expected on the Strip and at the Wynn.

feO5Fxbn4QgCoxrpWJoLBA.text: I had the crab cakes and eggs Benedict. It was delicious and the service was very good. The staff was nice and friendly. Rick was such a great server.

xCQJVWQINnIXpa0Z3YUCxA.text: This place is permanently on my Top 5 Favorite Restaurants in Las Vegas. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, with indoor and outdoor seating. We sat outside, which is a perfect people watching spot since it's adjacent to the pool at Encore.   Cocktail menu is small but mighty. Husband ordered the French Cucumber and I had a sweet & tangy passion fruit based margarita. Both delicious!   We ALWAYS order crab cakes if they are on the menu, so we ordered those plus the meatballs. Crab cakes were pretty good and a great portion for 2-3 people. Meatballs were probably the best I've EVER had.   For the entrees, I ordered the beef short rib - all I have to say is you're going to need a nap after eating it! It's served over a luscious bed of polenta, and the meat itself was so incredibly tender it melted in my mouth. Now listen, I had gastric bypass surgery a few years ago and I'm not supposed to over-eat. But I ate practically the entire plate. Husband ordered the seafood pasta. House made penne, and a ridiculous sauce so good he almost licked the plate.   I was too full for dessert, but we both ordered cappuccinos and a cake pop at the end. I wish we could have tried the Marshmallow concoction that included a presentation with dry ice, but my stomach was at the brim!   We will definitely be returning next time we're in Vegas!

y_Otq1vePvwbKDR3qfWfZA.text: I can honestly say I have no qualms about my experience at Jardin. In fact, my experience was more than above average. It was superb!  Pros: -Outdoor seating option; despite being near one of the pools, you don't feel distracted by it and it doesn't reduce the restaurant to a "poolside snack shop." -No wait, at least on 8/9/16 -Nice ambiance and interesting decor (dark grey water glasses, nice, subtle green linens paired with white and black trimmed chinaware) -Attentive service -Despite having a daunting menu (in a good way), the dishes don't take too long to come out -They offer organic salmon -Dishes had beautiful flavoring  I ordered the healthy option kale salad and added organic salmon to it. The salmon was very good quality and cooked perfectly. No knife required, broke into perfect slices upon sinking my fork into it. The kale salad was equally delicious and had a very flavorful dressing mixed within it. The dish was very fresh and hit the spot!  My partner ordered the chicken, which was very tender and juicy.  I absolutely would visit this restaurant again. The only thing I would recommend they do is offer a few more options for each meat. For example, a few chicken dishes, a few salmon dishes, etc.

Lmozn6tSUfL2ZFvZ7b-1QQ.text: Great ambiance and menu. Since it's at a Wynn property they had an incredible vegan menu, and will even bring out a vegan bread option for the table if you ask (the pretzel bread has an egg wash). The servers are amazingly knowledgeable as well -if you have any food allergies/aversions just let them know and they can point out what on the menu to avoid/modify.

YQlAnMH-4WWspG2OVIV6yA.text: Alright so I love this place! Lol.... been a long time patron of the Encore since it opened and have tried all restaurants on the Wynn and Encore properties. Been coming here since it was Botero and to be honest I was quite disappointed when Botero was pulled out. But I've been enjoying Jardin ever since. I've never had a disappointing meal, drink, or service. Some must haves are the crispy buttermilk chicken sandwich and anything breakfast! They have an amazing Bloody Mary cart that comes around and makes your Bloody Mary to your exact specifications. Had the pleasure of Rick helping my group and I, superb service! Seriously amazing. Enjoy!

xgULB1gRS_v_KbmMcr9__w.text: The California burger is a sandwich I'll actually remember, with just the right amount of Fresno peppers in the sandwich. Obviously the decor is incredible!

yHq27DoetcqOzofrbernmw.text: Between the four of us we had the salmon, seafood pasta, and fillet mignon. We also tried the chicken and tomato soups. The food was pretty good, the drinks were great and the mango cheesecake was "heavenly" (I'm a dessert guy and I've never used that word before, ). Atmosphere is very good as was the service.

g6HxEHTyBUDjenq4ylomoQ.text: 5 of us came for brunch on Sunday our last day in Vegas for a few months. We discovered that the society cafe had closed and jardin was now the place for breakfast at the encore.   Jardin is located where botero was located. Very nice place that looks out on the pool. Beautiful. We had brunch. We really like some items in the society menu like the monkey bras,but nothing seems to have survived on to the jardin menu which is a bummer.  Jardin's food was pretty good.   Bennits with raspberry sauce good but not as good as the monkey bread from the old society cafe.  Chicken and waffles was good.  Buttermilk chicken sandwich very good.  Bowl of berries expensive but good.  Coffee excellent Adult cheese sandwich and soup was great.  Side of bacon wonderful.   The service was ok, not great 4/5.  The food was 4/5. Overall 4/5.

K7FlfuT8FxfUedh6LIbY2A.text: The chocolate flower pot cake is so good, one of the best I've tried. About the dishes, nothing really to love. We tried the carpaccio, crab cake, kale salad, the branzino, raviolis, and the lobster spaghetti.  Salad was my favorite of all this. I know...sad. Drinks aren't the greatest either, we tried the lavender mule and the orange blueberry mule. Service is ok. Atmosphere is good.

Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate flower pot! Rich chocolate cake with chocolate mouse and orange or raspberry jelly. Flowers are not edible though.

1iKUAQ6dp0GWjTnFfBEn2Q.text: Fantastic ambience.  Just what you are looking for in Vegas.  The food was better than good but not spectacular.  The back part of the restaurant where you can eat, you can also smoke.  But not cigars! only cigarettes, from what I was told.    The service was a major let down.    It was packed from the moment we got there until the moment we left.  I am going to try a few more places before coming back here but if i find myself here again, i won't be disappointed.

nJgH7V-imokcLIpcAxGOZg.text: I love this place I saw it in yelp and I decide to try it i like it alot the steak is cooked the way i want it.. Great. Few things I wasn't sure how it works.

OnnklnsdOG0pGOd5pEJUFQ.text: Had a late lunch there after our visit to the spa. Great ambience, good food. We had the fried chicken sandwich and the bottomless spaghetti. Spaghetti was average but the fried chicken sandwich made up for it. Good service. Will come back again.

Yu0X0Ia6ssnZz2VD9ZVKdg.text: This place was bomb. Came for a pre fixe dinner with girlfriends - we had table apps, a toast, entree, and table dessert for $60 each plus tip. Of the appetizers, the tuna poke was my favorite, really delicious. I was not as impressed with the bitter salad. The entrees we got, salmon and filet, were absolutely amazing. I was so impressed with the way that they were cooked and prepared. Dessert was pretty good, but by then I was so stuffed that I didn't fully appreciate it. The other stand out is service - our server was so attentive and very friendly, got every aspect of the order right, and managed to serve us well without imposing. It was a really great experience in Vegas.

KgdBVt4Fjus6F0dphsz9Nw.text: This review is for Brunch only. I've been to Jardin 4 times now and hoping for the improvement in every visit. Sure this is fancy restaurant in Encore Las Vegas, which is 5 star hotel, and the interior ambiance is beautiful. However, their quality of food does not live up to the price and the ambiance. Reception staffs seems to be soulless in my every visit. Perhaps, they ruin my appetite, but the food is just so bad.... Service is so so. Just go have a coffee and take lots of pictures of inside... don't expect more than a pretty selfie here....

WhQT3dx9QfVvae9o1VeoxQ.text: my meal tasted amazing. i think we had a new waiter on a relatively normal sunday am brunch. he forgot to fill cups with water, runners didn't bring out plates with the pizza, they didn't put fruit on the sides, as explicitly requested several times - literally we had to explain to the waiter that "on the side" meant NOT on top of the pancake. had to ask another waiter to refill my coffee. the last straw - on an order of pancake and fruit - a worm was sticking out and MOVING around in a raspberry. and the fruit was being consumed by a 4 year old - we doubt the child ate bad fruit - but we recommended  to the main server that the entire batch should be disposed of - since he was claiming it was delivered "fresh" daily. my friend had to fill out a security form for an investigation. i can't rate 1 star - bc the reason we even came back is that our experience was amazing the day before. in fact, the maine lobster club tasted amazing. i'm sure this was a rare occurrence -  but this review was based on my experience

TKj5-K9JPbg10SkkEvnMrA.text: Great new dining spot located right next to XS nightclub. I can see this is going to turn into a wonderful prelude to a night at the club!   I had the white bean soup, to start. This is a tomato based hearty soup. When I am trying out a new venue I like to order small bites . This allows me to enjoy the menu.  My next selection was the crispy shrimp. Oh my goodness kill me now, this is beyond delicious. Arranged in the plate in a 5 "petal point " design. Perfect 5 star in every detail. You must give this a try .   The room has a sleek 60's modern vibe. This environment just makes you want to linger that extra moment.

277pwZ9SR_6U-ICSYBJIWg.text: In line with the shoddy spectacle that is Vegas, this place looks great but doesn't have the necessary sophistication in taste to justify the triple digit check for brunch for two.   The classic eggs Benedict was made right, but nothing to be proud of, especially for the given price. The potatoes lacked flavor, and the hollandaise sauce felt plain and frothy.   The Challah bread French toast was nice, but again, nothing great.   We had the blood/ruby orange mimosas, and for $16 each, we were just disappointed -- it's not just the price, the taste is just not worth it!

Zk4Nd_IFf26e5dGZxFnEag.text: Just came here for the dessert for the chocolate flower pot cake not bad for $20. It's something different & unique

BC0aS8OuTkB2Jsd39nvM1g.text: LOBSTER EGGS BENEDICT. If you're staying at Encore or Wynn, would definitely recommend rolling out of bed and walking over for brunch. The restaurant itself is elegantly decorated with a garden theme, as its name would suggest. There's also patio seating but given it was December, we opted to eat inside. The lobster eggs benedict was $24 but worth the price. It came with ample lobster that was well-seasoned and cooked. I also really appreciated the sauteed spinach and classic hash brown to round out the dish. Lastly to note, there's a roving cocktail cart in case you're up for a boozy brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Eggs Benedict

Q1oaiPuY4VC8HhJcSPC9pQ.text: We stopped here for small bites and drinks after watching the Le Reve - The Dream show, which btw is amazing and I highly recommend it if you're looking for family friendly entertainment in Vegas!  The hostess set up us under the heaters in the patio which was so cozy and beautiful. Our waiter was polite and very attentive to our table.  We ordered the mac and cheese bites and the buffalo cauliflower which both were delicious. The white sangria was very delicious.  Will definitely come back to try their entrees on my next trip to Vegas.
