Wb8D-z4MxEF7MjfelAi_tw.text: This place is in the Wynn Hotel.  We came during brunch on a Saturday, which usually means long lines and long wait.  We got lucky and only waited 20 minutes for our table.  We ordered lunch and both got the chicken sandwich.  I got sweet potato fries and my husband got the side salad.  The salad wasn't too good but the fries were perfect.  Criss cut, flavored, crispy and perfect.  The food is nothing monumental, but it is tasty and good for a simple lunch.  Our waiter was really nice, and that always takes a three star restaurant up to four stars in my opinion.  You leave your meal smiling because the waiter was just that pleasant.  I wouldn't recommend this place for a fancy/special occasion, but for a simple lunch or brunch, it does the job.

XHD0YKNZN-ifsHLwTXS0-Q.text: Was visiting Vegas in business after a long time of not being there. While Wynn is a great hotel, Jardin is a very beautiful and tasty place for breakfast (I only had a pleasure of having breakfast there). Great atmosphere, nice and international crowd, superb service (I sat at the bar and enjoyed my breakfast) and amazing stuff at the bar!

gT29gYbOg_hL__ofwperOg.text: Sean gave us the best service we ever had in our lives. Such a genuine, hard working man is hard to find. We'll forever remember this evening at Jardin.

999_A9JkXkpedors2ZiRSg.text: Never again! I came to Jardin with 4 other ladies on 08/19 during my sister's bachelorette weekend in Vegas. We were going to XS later that night and wanted to have a nice dinner before hand. The main reason we chose Jardin is because it is close to the club and beautiful but the service we received was an absolute joke!   Our server came by and said hello and then we didn't see her for almost 20 minutes. Meanwhile other servers are hanging around our table noticing us looking for our server and not one of them came to check on us. When our server finally came back she simply said, "Sorry I had to step off the floor". So my first question is why didn't you let us know that or send someone to check on us? It's not like we went a cheap diner! This place is upscale so the guests should be treated that way.   Our food took FOREVER to come out. I realize it was a Saturday night but again the server never came and checked on us and the restaurant honestly looked like it was dead. Once the food finally arrived we were so disappointed. Luckily we were snacking throughout the day so we only ordered small meals because the food was just alright and the drinks were mediocre as well. The presentation was fabulous but the taste...not so much.  After we had finished with our food it took our server another 10 years to finally check on us and my sister in law asked her very nicely for our check and she asked if she could please split them. This server looked at my sister in law and said (with a TON of attitude) "all 5?! Ugh just give me 2 minutes". About 10 minutes laster she returned with checks, slammed them down in front of each of us and said, "thanks" under her breath as she was walking away.   At this point we were upset and wanted to speak with a manager. I have friends that are servers and I even worked in a restaurant for a short while myself so I completely understand that not every table can be pampered and that splitting checks can be a pain but with that being said this place was not cheap and the service we received was terrible. The manager came over and our server made sure to be very close pretending to do stuff so she could listen in to our complaints. All the manager said was "I'm sorry for your experience let me get your checks". After another 10 minutes goes by the server (yes, the one we had a bad experience with) came back with our checks and said very sarcastically "I'm sorry for you bad experience, the manager took $5 off your meals".   Why would they send the server who we complained about to give us our checks? Also it is nice that the manager took some money off of our meals but honestly $5 off at a place as expensive as Jardin is more of a slap in the face than an apology. We were not looking to get anything discounted or free but we wanted management to know about our experience so hopefully their future guests have a better time and the half hearted apology we received along with the $5 off seemed like they were just trying to get us out the door. Overall I was truly disappointed that our final dinner for my sister's bachelorette party was ruined by the horrible service and treatment we received from Jardin, I highly recommend anyone who is considering to eat here to turn the other way. Although the ambience and appearance of this place is fabulous everything else was subpar.

BapePRHHb6Xbg0FCMRTWjw.text: Fantastic restaurant. Ambience, food and service. As the name suggests it looks like a beautiful garden!  Not too count the delicious and unique flower pot chocolate cake desert. Truly a work of art. Will be back over and over!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Savory meatballs
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak was perfectly cooked
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful

5tNi3msKtQH6w1TH3BGskw.text: Impressed by the atmosphere, but not by the service. Jardin's menu and beautiful patio initially attracted us to dine here, so we decided to try it for dinner one evening during our most recent trip.  We were seated quickly without any reservations, but after being guided to a table on the patio, the hostess left and the service issues began.    From the beginning of service until we paid the bill, we were disappointed.  Our server largely ignored us, not being able to offer much helpful information about the menu or the wine list, making us feel like more of an imposition than an invited guest.  We had to flag her down several times throughout the meal to order appetizers, entrees & wine, and even to request our check (which took more than 15 minutes).  Other service members were not helpful or seemingly willing to help), so eventually we just gave up hope that service would recover and tried to enjoy our meal.  Thankfully, the food was delicious.  There were not many seafood entrees, but of those offered, the bouillabaisse was the best, filled with tender squid and buttery scallops, a surprisingly light and delicate dish that really challenged the idea of what a bouillabaisse should be.  The hamburger was also well-liked, definitely filling by itself or with a generous side of fries (it does not come with fries, so if you want them, be sure to order them as a side).  Overall, if you are in a hurry, Jardin is not your best bet...but if you have time to kill and really want to enjoy the beauty of the Encore/Wynn gardens, then Jardin may be your #1 pick!  Cheers!

4gUQJdk65EV60Lo37z852g.text: Great service from Sean! This outstanding waiter from Pennsylvania really loves his job wholeheartedly.  Great food! Will come here again!

6TODMGkLAF5jmX1hyDzQhQ.text: Great food and atmosphere. I've eaten here a few times and had positive experiences. However I had breakfast there yesterday and encountered the rudest most pretentious hostess which inspired this 1 star review. No smile. No eye contact. Few words spoken. I was made to feel lucky to be in her presence. Today I avoided it and chose a different restaurant.

8qOFsKtIxqsaT53v0VUYLg.text: Food was horrible. We came for a birthday and it was a large party. Food took 45 minutes to come out even though the restaurant was just about empty. After receiving the food 2/10 people enjoyed their food as the rest did not. We all work concierge and for our first time dining here we are NOT impressed. The ambiance does not match the food especially not the prices. After taking some meals back to the kitchen we started to wonder why the manager NEVER came to our table to check on us and make sure we were alright. Instead we just got stares from the manager and everyone else working in the restaurant as if WE did something wrong. When booking this reservation we were told that they validate parking and never said anything about a limit because they clearly knew the reservation was for 10 people. So they tell us the can only validate 5 which was annoying but not once did we complain. Manny was a good waiter and did everything to accommodate us. As for everyone else they could really care less that we were even dining. Upon walking out Everyone thanks all the white people walking out but as soon as our large party walks out, all we get is awkward stares from every worker. They never offered us dessert, they never checked on us given the service we received and they never acknowledged the two people who came for their birthday. We will never come back and waste our time. If you like expensive food with no taste this place is perfect. If you want food with taste I would advise you to avoid at all cost. It is not worth it.

_0anwzMdbfkPk3LPOk-ftQ.text: Incredible food, staff, and quality. Will be coming back for sure!

fzJStYzuL0MsXsPl4cPvOw.text: Ate at this place two days in a row due to the simple and good breakfast. The restaurant is beautiful and their hashbrowns are amazing. I ordered the 3 eggs over medium with bacon and hashbrowns. Amazing service and everyone in our group was pleased. Would definitely go back for more.   FYI: Be aware that you cannot sit inside the restaurant with a tank top (its more formal).

3Wtz_GH_rpUMfeQlIhlW6Q.text: This restaurant had good food and a unique ambiance. Our waiter was spectacular and friendly. They went out if their way to make sure my flax allergy was taken care of. The manager came over and was gracious also. I would have to say the reason I am not giving it 4 or 5 stars is because we sat outside on a beautiful night na dhad people smoking around us while we are. When the hostess asked if we wanted to sit outside she should have informed us. I did not expect this in such an upscale place to eat. I would go again but probably sit inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

enSXMY94iE_uMx9sSO2DwA.text: We had the most delicious dessert wine here, pacific rim reisling. Went with the prix fixe menu, it was a lot of food but it was amazing!

mFB1Oi52PbkKBFEJNn2NyQ.text: Worst customer service making us wait over 20 mins while the restaurant is empty, just because we were wearing shorts! Very disrespectful!

4vZnOD5mMvD0wtQuX009tQ.text: Absolutely beautiful location for a smallish (40) business dinner. We were seated overlooking the pool and the weather was so perfect we didn't realize we were outside at first. The food was excellent and the dessert was stunning and tasted wonderful. The chocolate dessert was a beautiful potted plant with edible flowers. It went so fast I couldn't get a picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kw9vCsJg-iOAhFkJFQIdyg.text: Wow this place is fantastic! Really a top notch dining experience, without long waits or extremely large prices. We had quite a bit of different options and everyone loved their food. I had the salmon and it was amazing, I also hear the pork chops, filet mignon, fried chicken, mac n cheese, and house salads were amazing. After they take your order, they bring you out some fresh pretzels bread sticks with a mustard seed butter, and that is just enough to get your taste buds watering for dinner.  Their drinks? So Many great choices. Try one of their moscow mules, they have a whole specialty bar cart to come around to make you your perfect mule! I promise it won't disappoint.   The service was great, we interacted with a few and everyone was welcoming and patient. They also were mindful of when we needed to get going to be at our show on time. (Le Reve, check it out!)  We were not able to check out their brunch, but I hear it's pretty nice!

ttO_8DHcU39oQYgZEv9wRw.text: Great restaurant! My overall experience was beyond words. I asked to be seated in a special place when I made the reservation on OpenTable and the staff obliged. They really made my birthday that much special by respecting my wishes. The service was exceptional and the food was delicious. The food portion may not seem like a lot, but it will definitely keep you full for the vast majority of your day depending on what you order. I had the pancakes and my boyfriend had the smoked salmon scramble - both dishes were delicious. I should also mention that a very nice couple order a dessert that I was going to order for myself as a birthday dessert, but the couple offered to give me theirs because they were also full from their meals. Our waiter also brought out a scoop of ice cream with a candle and edible "happy birthday" message to pair with the dessert! I was so surprised by all of the sweet gestures. Great place to be for any special occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6NJpCCZepMrMKPkq_nxSVg.text: A very nice dinner out. It wasn't really crowded for dinner on a Saturday night, I think Jardin is more popular for breakfast/lunch/brunch but our dinner was still awesome.   I ordered the orange and lavender mule and the pork chop. The mule was fresh and light and a nice summer cocktail. The pork chop was cooked perfectly and the glaze was sweet and smoky. The pork chop was served with a cauliflower puree and an arugula and radish salad. We also ordered the meatballs as an appetizer and a side of the Mac and cheese bites. The meatballs were tender and the bites were ooey gooey cheesy and came out super hot. Jardin also starts you with pretzel bread twists that come out of the kitchen warm served with cold honey mustard butter.  We ended our meal with the famous flower pot dessert. It's a chocolate cake with chocolate mouse and raspberry sauce, surrounded by a chocolate shell, and topped with cookie crumbs and edible flowers. It's both gorgeous and delicious. The menu says that it serves 2-3 and there were 3 of us and we couldn't finish it. Honestly, it would probably be the perfect size for 4 to share unless you have a major sweet tooth (a quarter of the cake was enough to satisfy mine).   We will be coming back in the later summer or early fall to enjoy brunch outside because the patio looked lovely, it was just too hot to eat outside the night we went. That said, the dining room is brightly lit and gorgeous.

sgxCuuzTEW1_YzyVQy6D1A.text: Had an early dinner before XS Nightswim (which is right outside the restaurant) and was pleasantly surprised. Our server asked us if we had any allergies or food restrictions which was great as we had two vegans and a pescatarian as part of our group. The bread service was great as it was warm pretzel bread served with a mustard sauce. Tried the buffalo cauliflower which was an amazing appetizer and had the veggie ravioli for an entree. The food was amazing and our server also brought out vegan bread and butter for our table which was awesome. The only issue we had was the lack of vegan / vegetarian options as most of the restaurants at Wynn and Encore seemed to have separate plant-based menus while this restaurant did not.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and Kale Ravioli

T8BvjpFSuDNt-DbuO1vUKg.text: Food may be good...staff is super rude...will not come back. I took my sandals off for literally 1 second because something was bothering on my feet and the girl yelled at me and told me to keep them on...who that hell is she??

u6AH_EMikPRET_C5rtuGrQ.text: Wow! What a Great experience ~ what a great Dinner. I'm surprised that this place doesn't receive more accolades. The fresh Italian fish was delicious. Seafood pasta amazing ....I think because it doesn't have white tablecloths and a different background other than the pool it doesn't receive the attention it deserves. Five stars all day long.

p4uVzXKvp8HMhbp467ZQsA.text: 2 stars for absurd prices relative to the quality of food. Their signature cocktails were SEVENTEEN dollars each -- and tasted pre-mixed. They arrived in tall glasses, with the flavoring parts not even mixed in to the drink. Seafood pasta was good, so adding a star for that. Pork chop was overcooked and had an overly sweet jam all over it. Service was comparable to a really really good TGI Fridays. A disappointing experience, especially surrounded by so much that is sublime.

vuTrmVor3ozawQG4xg5xhw.text: This was a trip to impress my wife and Jardin did just that!  Although it was a bit cold, we choose to eat outside to take in the views under a heater.  We went at night and weren't too hungry so after enjoying the fresh pretzel bread, we ordered the Jardin Burger which was excellent!  So good, it required no condiments!  Perfect as is!   But the part I was looking forward to we dessert!  I ordered the Jardin Signature "Fleur"!  A beautiful confection that looked exactly like a flower pot!  Chocolate cake and mousse with an edible "pot" and flower was something to behold! It was delicious and to much to finish, we had to take it back to our room! The Service was excellent as we felt very comfortable like dinner at a friend's house!   Definitely worth a visit!

t0fYmJkNfMaZzmmJ4WYPkA.text: My Boyfriend and I don't usually care for breakfast but since we were with a group of friends we decided to have breakfast here on Sunday morning. I wish we never dinned here. The service was horrible. We were a party of 6 people and by the time we got our drinks ordered our waiter went MIA for a little bit. By the time he came back we just ordered our main dishes with no appetizer. I got the Lobster Benedict and I was not impressed at all. My Boyfriend got the Steak and Egg, which he was whatever about. Once we got our dishes we both just looked at each other like...??!!! We had finally finished having breakfast when we were looking for our waiter who once again went MIA. It took over 30 minutes to get our check. I felt so bad because my friends were waiting for us outside Jardin for 30 minutes till we got the bill. I will not dine here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster Benedict.

OFGDJV-97sbhnrTejXVKQQ.text: Hostess can improve, waiter was friendly and attentive! food and drinks are great! Outside patio, nice shade of trees, pipits flying around is really a JARDIN experience. ideal in a hot vegas day!!

u4-yg0mcMCenZPbvYOrNww.text: Went for diner last night. We booked the table outside in the morning. We double confirmed during the day and the table was not available when we arrived.  We ordered Spanish wine , not available  We ordered fish entree , not available  We ordered chocolate desert, not available  Manager came and barely apologized and blamed the waiter. Bad management.  Not a good experience ! Just don't care about customer experience.

GZBrbg0454tT-Sa_HGqL8A.text: Jardin is a Nice Relaxed Place for Breakfast or Lunch  I have been spending a lot of time in Las Vegas lately, and at the Wynn in particular, and Jardin is becoming one of my go to's for a noon-ish meal.  For my latest visit I opted for the classic Virginia Ham Eggs Benedict. Perfectly poached eggs, luscious, thinly sliced ham and velvety Hollandaise. The dish comes with a small crispy potato hash brown "puck" -- for lack of a better word. My only complaint is that I wish the potato portion was bigger. Not that I was hungry after I finished my meal -- I am just a glutton for crispy fried goodness.  In the past I have had a nice Caesar salad and the Margherita pizza -- both very tasty. And the pizza was HUGE. Way too much for one person. Easily lunch for two.  The other thing I like about Jardin is they never rush you out. Typically I am killing time waiting for my client. My servers have always cheerfully re-filled my drink and allowed me to catch up on my email while I wait for my meeting. And when I am ready, I have my check and I am on my way. And considering this is a very beautiful dining room, staffed by wonderful, attentive people in a five star hotel, the prices are quite reasonable. I will be back.

81lPk9-rXtqMDZ8I4O2kZg.text: This is a beautiful restaurant that's in the same space where Botero used to be. I'd eaten at Botero several times and I thought it was one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas, so I thought I'd give Jardin a try. That turned out to be a mistake.  The service at Botero was always exceptional, but the service at Jardin was embarrassingly poor. This was a Sunday night, and Jardin was not very crowded. Asked for ice water with lemon, but after a wait got only plain water. Had to flag down the waiter to get some ice, and then again to get lemon...and that was just the start of the meal. Ordered a coffee and it came out warm after a 10 minute wait. Even though we were seated next to a wait station, the waiters were rarely attentive. After dropping off our long awaited food, the waiter (and his helper) disappeared until he asked for our dessert order. Never bothered to ask how our food was. Hint: it was not that good. The corn chowder was the worst I've had at any strip restaurant, which was surprising because the corn chowder at The Country Club at Wynn was always outstanding. Jardin's chowder was dull with very little seasoning, and was not served hot. The mashed potatoes were runny and were more like potato soup. How do you mess up something as simple as mashed potatoes, then have the nerve to send it out to a customer?  The salmon and the chicken were good but overpriced. The cheesecake was the star of this experience, but nobody ever asked how anything was. When it was Botero, a manager always came by to ask how everything was going, but not at Jardin.  All in all, a very disappointing experience. I thought it might have been just an off night, but there were just too many mistakes. I won't be back.

hsCiAeEZuDNAlTda-PxCvw.text: Oh my god. This place is incredible! Inside the Encore hotel- Jardin is DELICIOUS!!!! Gorgeous restaurant, wonderful service and deliiiiicious food!!! The spinach and kale ravioli is to die for, with big portions of truffle fries- the delicious pretzel bread. I cannot wait to return to the encore to dine at Jardin/ make a reservation, and dress up! They have indoor and outdoor seating available. Thank you Jardin for a wonderful experience.

6pngjc7e3J4q_4JF_be8EA.text: I wish I could give this restaurant less than 1 star...  Naturally you would think that dining in the Wynn comes with quality food and service. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case. My group and I celebrated a birthday dinner on a Wednesday night. Business seemed slow and there weren't many guests in the restaurant. Our orders took extremely long to come out. I ordered the "Endless house made spaghetti" (prices at $31) with a Caesar salad and garlic toast. I picked at the salad until they asked to take it back. The spaghetti was underwhelming - no seasoning or taste whatsoever. Only took two bites and decided to send it back. I was ultimately charged $8 for the salad I picked at, when I thought it was inclusive of the meal.   Working in the industry (especially within a 5-Star hotel), you already have an expected level of service. I will say that through our unsatisfactory experience, our server Manny, remained polite. The general manager did not come by to check and see how our night or dinner was going, albeit he visited other surrounding tables. I'm saddened that my expectations were low-balled tonight. Please, save your money and dine elsewhere. It's a beautiful venue but the food quality DOES NOT justify the price.

8e-LyKMcTuRKG9tUCQUeZA.text: The worst experience in my life with reservations!  I made my reservation 6 months in advance for a party of 8. When I arrived to the restaurant, I was 15 minutes early and checked in with the hostess.  I was informed by the manager that my party was shown to their table already and pointed to them saying, "the zavala reservation has already checked in."   I then pull out my phone and show them my ID and the email that shows the reservation and conformation number. Now this is where it gets interesting, now the manager says "I don't have this reservation in my system." So the story changes...  Next, the manager has the nerves to point again to the same table and blames that table for taking my reservations. However, she just said I don't have reservations. And to top it off, they are blaming part of my family that are also part of the wedding group.  As more of the wedding party, that I am apart of, is showing up to the restaurant, the manager informs us that we will have to wait while they seat the bride and groom table. Of course that is fine. But they have not resolved my issues and ignored my group.   Finally, the manager apologies, just to apologize. And sat us down at a table. Funny thing is, the whole restaurant is basically empty with plenty of sitting. They could had had a 4 star review if they would have just sat us down immediately and managed the situation professionally.   I will not return.

ZnmVLNFG6XU1pkXorbFT0w.text: We are Vegas locals and  came here Friday night before a concert. Greeted by lovely hostesses.  The place was largely empty.  That's a surprise, especially for a Friday night.  It didn't take long to realize why.  Service was ok.  We had to constantly ask for water.  That's not something a guest should need to do.  Martinis were good but ridiculously overpriced.  $23 for a vodka martini.  Ridiculous.  Anyway, I ordered the prime rib. It was one of the most unattractive slabs of meat ever served on a plate.  Fatty.  Dark brown.  Zero taste.  $40 for a sandal on a plate.  I couldn't eat it. Nobody asked if there was a problem when they removed the plate, with the "prime" rib largely untouched.    I've never been impressed by any Wynn / Encore restaurants.  For that reason, this place didn't disappoint.  I would try Capital Grill across the street.  Stay away from Jardin.

PbSTYr_GRwT_43dub3IyUg.text: Like most things at the Wynn & Encore, Jardin is an equal, meeting the tone of extraordinary set as the standard.   We popped in for an afternoon cocktail before our flight. Having been Lakeside at Parasol Down a few times prior at Wynn, we wanted to see if Encore had something comparable. In steps Jardin. Although it looks over a pool area, not the lake.   It's one of the more elegant restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas. Light, bright & airy with a keen aire of sophistication the ambiance is right on pace for what we were looking for.   The bartenders were friendly, offered customized birthday ice cream to my amour (we declined), & generally took good care of us while we lingered, people watch & clearly snapped away photos.   I Can't wait to come here & dine outside on the patio, this is a gorgeous restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceiling art
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those flowers...
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bread sticks are extraordinary

NpKwIstVWJC2FdJAvU24Fg.text: Visited with a party of three coworkers in town for the Adobe Summit.  Greeting by the hostess was very cold. Seemed like we were bothering her by checking in.  We had reservations and there was not a very long wait.  The wait staff was extremely friendly, though they did forget to deliver a steak knife with the steak.  The food was not good enough to justify the price. We had three entrees between us (Strip Steak, Chicken and Spaghetti). Only one of the meals (the spaghetti) was deemed "good". The chicken sandwich and the steak were definitely not, particularly given the price.  In summary, rude hostess, friendly wait staff, subpar food, and highly overpriced.

3mdhibWZh65Ymx9Bmm44JQ.text: My birthday was completely ruined. I was so excited to have my birthday dinner at this restaurant.   The service was horrible. We were a group of 10 and 3 of my friends were unhappy with their meals and we asked our waiter to take it back. (The food was very bland) The waiter didn't not even attempt to Rectify the situation or even offer any recommendations. Then the entire staff decided to huddle around and look at our table making us very uncomfortable.   We are a group of professionals and we did not like to the way we were treated. The manager went around to every table but ours.   The restaurant also knew that me and my twin sister were celebrating our birthday. The waiter even mentioned it. They said they were going to give us the flower pot cake In celebration of our birthday but that did not happen I'm assuming because they had to take back a few of our meals.   Over all we were very displeased with the food and service. We also watched as other parties were leaving the restaurant staff thanked them and said goodbye. When we got up no one said anything then just watched as we left feeling uneasy.

G5ZnDZPtNNyO2S-sOohlDw.text: This place is at the Wynn so it's obviously fancy and expensive. But the food was pretty good. We got the kale and spinach ravioli, the buffalo cauliflower, and the chickpea bowl. the portions are decent we definitely didn't have any leftovers but luckily they did give us bread so without the bread we probably would have still been hungry. I would say you could definitely get better vegan food for a much lower price many other places but when you're in a pinch and you're at the Wynn this is a pretty good option. during the day the Wynn hotel has much cheaper food options but at night time you're kind of stuck with more expensive fancy food so maybe another restaurant would have been better but this was the least expensive one we can find. Nothing to write home about as they say.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and kale ravioli

zkOfWzKhxD4t9t6L_ndzFA.text: Nathan was a super awesome bartender. I had the NY Strip steak and few beers. Prices was reasonable and the steak was excellent, really tender and I am glad I went medium rare vs. medium which I normally do. I ate just right in the bar and got to watch a vegas golden knights game on TV (no audio), but the restaurant itself looked really nice as well. Overall great experience. Will def come by here for a bite and a drink again.  Yum yum

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip 12 oz

xsDMOnJd651kXbnEphmnSg.text: My favorite breakfast spot anytime we are at the Wynn!! Delicious bloody Mary's, eggs Benedict and pancakes!  You can't go wrong eating here.  Have tried dinner here as well and it didn't disappoint either. There's usually a wait to sit outside, and making a reservation is suggested!

icKxKi3Nb9vKphUlca9M5Q.text: First time visit for Christmas dinner. The restaurant is great as you would expect from a Wynn property. The staff was friendly and attentive. Service was great. Our waiter and sommelier were terrific. We ordered from the chef's set Christmas menu which consisted of Bacon Wrapped Scallops with Kale Caesar Salad, Prime Rib with Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Custard Covered Brownie. We also tried the additional Wine Flights that accompanied each course. Dinner and service was excellent and we recommend patronizing this restaurant.

nFK18EsR8Lqf68Dyq1yJ6g.text: This place would've gotten a solid 3.5-4 had the service been better.  I ordered the eggs benedict, which was a little runnier than I'd like.  I prefer the whites fully cooked and the yellow soft.  I don't enjoy the texture of runny white.   The hollandaise wasn't spectacular.  I ordered the fruit instead of the hash brown which was just a block.  It seemed like a creative attempt but it did not deliver.  The food itself, was good.  I enjoyed it.   Our table wanted mimosas for the brunch so they said they'll send over the drink cart.  The drink cart was unattended for most of it. No one came by.  The table requested this 3x during the entire meal and no one came by.  Even getting our waitress was impossible.  She was missing and the restaurant was not busy.  After we were done, the drink cart came by and asked what we wanted and sounded surprised when we said, we don't want anything, we're done with the meal.    From the service I received, I believe that management has not kept an eye on the employees and the employees have excelled in lagging or abiding their time during work.  Responsiveness was terrible and there must be some secret room where they all disappear to so they can't even be called on by us.

roWsgu1dfYJsGOQlpsOcIw.text: Unfortunately, we had a very unenjoyable dinner here last night.  We were cold, so we sat on the patio.  It was crowded, but fine and inside the restaurant was almost empty.  We ordered a bowl of soup, flatbread, arugula salad and chicken meatballs.  We asked our waiter to bring everything out at once so we could share.  We then waited over 30 minutes for our soup and salad to arrive.  Ouch.  Every table around us was being served while we watched and wondered where our remaining items were (meatballs and flatbread).  And we waited. And we waited. Without apology, our last two items showed up after the salad and soup were long gone--at least 30 min later.  By then it was over the acceptable wait time and the patio chairs became uncomfortable and the other patron's smoke started to annoy us.  We had intended to go in for a few appetizers and got stuck in service hell.   In hindsight, I should've spoken with the manager but we were in a hurry to get out of there.  Enough was enough.   Definitely the slowest, most irritating service we've had in Vegas in a long time.  (Two stars because the meatballs and flatbread eventually were delicious.)

YlJFwJOCS_xqAWuuzSy5fw.text: Jardin is a nice, casual lux place to enjoy a meal. First off, they got carpet on the bottom of their tables y'all. Apparently that's code for classy.   I recently went for an industry mixer at Jardin where they were serving a prefixe menu and the food was so damn good!!! Just wish I hadn't ate so much before going to XS!   Margherita Pizza- it's no NY pizza but definitely a nice starter   Kale salad-  I could've ate 12 plates of this. Who the heck likes Kale anyway?  Steak kabobs- steak was tender and the veggies were nicely marinated   Penne pasta- my favorite dish of the night. It had corn, eggplant, and it was bomb. This was what slowed me down at the nightclub for sure.   It was nicely paired with their Moscow mule. Odd cause it was served in a glass.   I would love to go back for lunch because the view overlooks the pool and it's so serene and pretty. Can't go wrong at Wynn/encore when dining.

FPX_eXIQHnGE_pCNUDX3CQ.text: Maybe the Latinos in Chee kago get better meat but this place sucked! Waaaaayyy overpriced for a white tablecloth taqueria. Wife had the chicken and the dessert was decent but not enough to warrant another star.  A taco cart would make a killing outside of here.

MoYju4XLfIrq3doJLO834w.text: Ehhhhh. What can i say. We got there fairly early by Vegas standard- around 9/930. Place had opened tables both inside and out. So did we get seated - no, we had to wait for 5-10 min. Whyyyyyy? Not sure. We ordered - coffee is exceptionally strong- be aware. Took forever to get our meals. Service was slow - again, unsure why since there was not many people there. It took 25-30 min once we ordered. I had the chicken and waffles. Their take on it is - it's actually not a waffle but more of a French toast with an egg cooked in the middle of it. It was good but nothing fantastic- esp when we waited so long. Had to ask for coffee refill. As we left my friend asked me if it was a repeat. I quickly answered -  no way. So overall service that included a long wait for our meal, overall value/ price, & food quality/taste - totaled 2 stars. That was my experience.

oXtYEi_itb4KrfzuP3E1nw.text: One star for not making it past the bar due to the rude 38ish yr old grouchy haggard blonde bartender behind the bar (nothing against females of an age as I am one-I'm just angry at her bad representation of a female server). Four of us sat down about 7:30 pm on 9/13 for a refreshment while we pondered going into the dining room for dinner. The woman didn't even crack a smile, make any welcoming comment and basically gave us one cocktail menu and immediately asked "what can I get you?". Nothing worse than not being fully seated and settled in and someone's harassing you for your order, and still not a smile to be had. We got up and left and spent out $360 on dinner at Chica at Venetian. Sorry Wynn/Encore-thought you paid more attention to the quality of your staff at your high end restaurants.

TCHrjUTyg_ru2DpzQwb--g.text: This restaurant had the best ambience! It is great for dinner and/or just grabbing drinks. I wish there were more places like this in Southern California.

gJRHiZoFMfqdWoInS9TMyA.text: The best kept secret in Vegas Amazing Chicken Meatballs.  Great surf and turf, try the Flower pot for dessert it was awesome.  The Penne pasta was great, and so was the pretzel bread!  Every thing was great

dREk7K3Zp3akWfk6c240bg.text: Ate here on Friday night, started feeling sick about an hour later and am still sick 4 days later.  I had the salmon kale salad and honestly think I got ecoli poisoning from it.  Going to GI tomorrow if diarrhea does not let up.  Ruined my trip to Vegas - what a waste!!!!!!    Also everything took forever, including just getting the bill.

ofLsiSoCG1y2UutjUdcZOg.text: Waiter was great. Very on top of everything. Managers left a lot to be desired. Food was overpriced and lacking in flavor. Ordered a drink on the rocks. Very little ice. Most of it melted before it arrived. Served soup with no spoon. It was cold by the time I got the spoon. Lots of choices on the strip. Skip this place and check out the ones across the street.

bWIxpfxSEb-raclydLX4pQ.text: I would have expected more from an Encore restaurant.  While considering the pricing wasn't bad for Las Vegas, the food just wasn't that good. We did the fixed menu option.  They start you with a literal tea cup of cauliflower soup - it was basic.  Next We had the chicken meatballs and crab cakes as an app, both were actually quite good!  We both thought it was going to be a good meal... until the main dishes came.  I had surf and turf and my husband had the roasted chicken.  I don't think they used salt on anything.  My steak was disappointingly bad - over cooked and no flavor.  Shrimp was cooked fine but bland and they topped it with a type of pesto that didn't work with with of the proteins and didn't even taste good.  I actually took it off and pushed it to the side of my plate.  The broccolini was only slightly over steamed.   My husbands chicken was served over a bed of smashed fingerling potatoes with a hatch chili sauce and side of green beans. The chicken was cooked well, but again lacked flavor.  I pretty sure they don't use any type of salt or pepper when cooking.  They shouldn't even try to call the sauce any type of chili, it's a plain red sauce.  Never would I describe it as any type of chili, more like a tomato sauce.  The beans were just good ol' steamed beans.    They redeemed themselves with desert.  We had the maple pudding and apple crostata, both were excellent.  Wish I would have had more room to eat them.    The other factor contributing to the three stars is that the waitress went missing for a while. We actually thought she was on break.  My beverage  sat empty for about 15 minutes.    In nutshell, I wouldn't go back.  There's too many good restaurants in Vegas to bother with Jardin.

m0cCvg7EA97CN6VSykGWFw.text: Relaxed but lively atmosphere with great good. Service was friendly however pretty slow. Recommend the charred octopus and mac and cheese (side).

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7V39Yzq2cpz27qLTzRb-GA.text: I have eaten here on several occasions. Jardin is a great replacement to what was Botero; the day people sculptures there always kept me away.   The reviews are accurate in that service has always been slow, and it's difficult to get a server if you need something quickly, but besides that the food is really good, and the decor is somewhat refreshing. I do enjoy eating here, and have only had the "brunch foods" all have been really good.

OwvRIEA-LDFQXYKBx4SU0Q.text: Food was delicious... Server was great. The time to get served took a bit longer however we didn't mind since we had great company! They did forget the ice tea until the end of our dining... But that was the only mistake! The restaurant was beautiful and the dessert was absolutely amazing!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wkfIfuHNBCGjnn13ZXJ_vQ.text: Nice place. Love the flower pot dessert. Came back with my mom and daughter. Nice and quiet, away from the riff raff of the strip.

jWlWntBsoSNAxRu32GM8Fg.text: Hella expensive, but it is Vegas and I'm 99% sure that everything is made fresh (I base that on how long the food took and how it tasted).  I ordered the vegan French toast and while it was delicious, I regretted it immediately because it was SO sweet. I know, it is French toast, it's sweet. It was very delicious but a bit too early for me. If you like sweets in the morning, you'd love it!

lhzVeihvnygTgWpk5TZjpw.text: I went to Jardin today for my anniversary lunch. Ive been told any place at Wynn is THE place to go in Vegas for vegan options. Honestly, the food was great. My husband and I were having a nice time. And then, there were 2 pigeons under our table as there are IN EVERY SINGLE OUTDOOR VENUE in Vegas, we gave them a small pc of our pizza crust because we love animals (hence the Vegan thing) our Waitress told us off, told us not to encourage that behaviour..... Is the Wynn not a vegan (animal) friendly venue?! In my entire life, I have never been told to not feed a bird!!! Not only were we embarrassed by your 20 year old waitress, but disgusted that your staff would treat us that way when paying that much per plate, while sitting in an outdoor (vegan friendly) venue.

oRatkgnUjhjQl73d1pE9Dg.text: We were going to an event at Encore, so decided to eat dinner there since it would be convenient.  I wasn't familiar with Jardin, but we gave it a shot and were very happy with our choice.    We asked to be seated by the window and it was interested seeing all of the people by the pool.  Good people watching.  The decor of the restaurant is beautiful as well.    Our waiter was very attentive and gave recommendations that we enjoyed.  My boyfriend would normally not order the chicken, but he did this time and it was great.  I also loved by lobster pasta.  Big chunks of lobster!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CePDGvmewAReo37C_kvx_Q.text: We love have breakfast here... Eyes can eat nice view too The breakfast steaks are amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love steaks  Morning steak
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jZPSzb1EVzl-Cp_MlqfwIg.text: Great value !  On the strip a very beautiful restaurant. Seating is great you're not going to be packed like sardines!    There is something for everyone even vegans!  Excellent crab cakes they are worth the trip!!!

y3YT3KHmbGhVj_RhdOI56g.text: Jardin was a great place for lunch. I ordered my New York steak medium rare with some asparagus and mashed potatoes. It was very decent. The steak was a perfect medium rare. Since I love asparagus so much, I also ordered the bacon wrapped asparagus. It was delightful.  Jardin's decor is very nice on the inside, and they also have an outdoor patio. If you get there at the right time, it isn't too hot to enjoy the outdoors.   Service was decent for such a restaurant. They did a great job!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y-XBSKA1Siq5F9NBeYf2Og.text: FLOWERS GALORE!!!! . . Jardin = Garden in French. This place most definitely lived up to the title of making a freaken Garden in the middle of a casino hotel!! Located right next to the XS club which is closer to the Encore side of the hotel. The ambiance is CLEAN & VIBRANT. So bright & BEAUTIFUL during the day time. They have a lovely patio seating w/ heaters but the inside is just as GORGEOUS with all the flowers. . The SERVICE met exactly what i expected from a restaurant on the strip. DREW was our server for our LUNCH experience & he was so KIND & ATTENTIVE & literally went the EXTRA mile to go above the expectation especially since we had 2 CHILDREN w/ us for lunch. One thing that really stood out was the fact that he got the chef to make a dish for the kids that weren't even on the menu.The manager also took the time to stop by the table &  greet us since it was our first time. She was definitely a bundle of JOY, she was able to keep the kids occupied for a little while as they showed her a magic trick which she literally stayed to patiently watch the child STRUGGLE to show her this MAGIC trick of his. This might be not big of a deal but being in the SERVICE industry i knew she had to get things done because after she PATIENTLY watched my nephew's struggles, I saw her go back & forth from the kitchen to patio at least like 20x within a 5 minute span. Whoever this BLONDE TINY MANAGER is..... Props to your PATIENCE & SPEEDYNESS while keeping a SMILE the whole time! it was fun to watch. . FOOD........ SO FREAKEN DERICIOUS!!!! who knows it might be because i was HUNGRY, but it was good to the 5 other people that were eating w/ me (including my EXTREMELY PICKY husband) . . . ANTIOXIDANT SMOOTHIE $9 - acai, pomegranate juice,  blackberries, blueberries, & maple syrup was PERFECT in flavor BALANCE. . AVOCADO TOAST $17 - black garlic hummus, cherry tomatoes, & black pepper. The most SIMPLISTIC yet flavorful. . GRANDMOTHER'S CHICKEN MEATBALLS $14 - backed in tomato sauce w/ ricotta cheese. This chicken was sooo TENDER & JUICY!!! Plus who could say no to Ricotta cheese.  . QUINOA & AVOCADO SALAD $16 - watercress, ucumber, toasted almonds, & lemon miso dressing. This salad literally made EVERYONE at the table SPEECHLESS. We were all expecting it to be not so tasty & just blah.... but it was seriously so good that it was DEVOURED INSTANTLY! . SHRIMP CAPELLINI $25 - roasted garlic, fennel, & lobster cream sauce. It was a subtle pasta dish which was perfect for a lunch item. None of the flavors were too much or overbearing. . FLOWER POT DESSERT

A9Xw4yOwAPkxYr3oQMK5nQ.text: Came here for breakfast and it is a beautiful restaurant in True Steve Wynn style. Like the rest of Wynn property, you just feel special being here.    I just ordered the steel cut oatmeal but it was property good with a side of brown sugar, maple syrup and golden raisins.  The real star of breakfast was the coffee. Jardin knows what what good strong cup of coffee is all about.   If staying at the Wynn, you can go wrong eating here but don't be shocked when the bill comes!  It was almost $20 for some oatmeal and a cup of fonte Wynn coffee.

WbVD4tkafApZ3SmrrNnUOg.text: Service was great with a smile.   Food we ordered:  Turkey burger $19 (protein style) w/ lots of butter lettuce, sliced tomatoes and sweet crunchy pickles. Yum!   Crunchy chicken sandwich $19 super good!   Eggs Benedict $22 very fresh and cooked with perfect. A must order.   Classic Bloody Mary $16   Fries   All sandwiches are served ala carte, fries are $7 extra.   All in all I thought this was my favorite place to have lunch. I'll be back!

LHCsZD_WVt9BvYIxI0qGag.text: This is more of a formal restaurant. Service was great. The have good vegetarian & vegan options that are clearly marked, & the staff are familiar with this. Once, I had a seasonal mocktail, Mushroom Agnolotti (arugula, Pecornino cheese, roasted mushroom, Marsala glaze), & the vegan tapioca desert. This was more than enough food.  Another time for lunch my wife & I had a kale salad, cheese pizza, & a green pizza, & they were good as well.This restaurant is at the Encore hotel (next to Wynn). Seating was on the porch. Please don't feed the birds though!

CNNrS6Nkrzix_lxR6Jev2A.text: We were wandering a bit one late morning and stopped here for late breakfast.  Despite the fact it was past 11:00 they kindly offered us both the breakfast and lunch menus.  We were seated outside under the umbrellas with a view to the pools.  It was lovely.  I had the croissant French toast (excellent) and my spouse had the biscuits and gravy, also excellent.  They also have a good vegan menu.  Sides are all under 250 calories.  Many healthy menu options available.  Service was good, one side was forgotten and water was not refilled, but otherwise great.  Yes, if you sit outside the birds will be around but we thought they were more amusing than pesky.    We will return.  Love finding someplace new by stumbling upon it.

79BU3SgxasUYtKkkf9pXJA.text: This is a great place for amazing vegan/veggie food. Was here for dinner, the service was impeccable, the food was delicious and the ambience was quiet, relaxing and romantic. We had the tomato soup and the mushroom tartine for appetizers. Really well made and filling. The mushroom tartine comes in a good portion so try and share if you don't want to be too full with just the appetizer. For the entree we had the chickpea curry and spinach mushroom raviolli. Both well prepared and perfect portion size. Jardine was a great experience and we are definitely coming again the next time we visit Vegas.

WUxJzJxFkYIbN_BNFKMMIg.text: Had a great breakfast out on the patio (poolside) of Jardin's at the Encore. The weather was perfect, the service exceptional, and the food great. I highly recommend this place for breakfast if you're staying at the Wynn, Encore, or Palazzo.

_HNL2Yql-iBKploS89iUsA.text: Delicious tomato soup! Beautiful restaurant and decor. Situated between the Wynn and the Encore.   Service is very slow

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs

hQCwv1XR1E20bWO3mnCh7w.text: Meh this place is way overpriced, but what would you expect for Wynn.  I can deal with the prices if the food were decent.  Its not very good.  Its pretty average.  The service is also pretty blah.  Its billed as a somewhat quick service at the Encore Resort so if you want something while you are here its one of the few places that is casual in the whole resort.  For me it was just way overpriced for what you get.  I'd rather go elsewhere and spend the same for something great or spend less for something probably better as well.

dpcE5WTk0D6AxTtvbzxKfQ.text: My husband & I had dinner here for our anniversary. I primarily chose Jardin due to the vegan options on their menu. However, the sample menus online had several more options than the actual menu! I had a mushroom tartine & spinach/kale ravioli. While neither were bad, they were both quite bland. My husband had the wedge salad, salmon and portobello fries. There was nothing special about the salmon, and the salad & fries were good.  The atmosphere was much better when this space was Botello. It has been stripped of its character and is very loud. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic spot with good vegan options, this is not it. We were disappointed all the way around & left with "buyers remorse"!

0P8apGw9ZEYgyA70OMeqZA.text: We loved our two breakfasts at Jardin, especially because the service was superior in every way. For instance, we thought the creamer for our coffee was a little on the turning side, and mentioned it. We instantly had new cups, new coffee, new creamer and the old carried away.  The ambience is lovely, and the view of the gardens (Jardin) makes breakfast even lovlier.  We enjoyed our veggie frittata and chicken sausage and eggs entrees were very good. I especially enjoyed the frittata with sundried tomatoes, goat cheese, broccolini, manchego and parmesan.   I think my husband was a tad disappointed in the chickeen sausage. He expected something that was less like grocery-store sausage. But the taste was good.  The coffee was unlimited and very good also.  Expect to spend $70 for breakfast though. The loveliness costs!

-1Wxcc8tJ1bMeB_2NlqfVg.text: After hearing that all the Wynn & Encore restaurants have vegan menus, I decided to give this place a try. I was really surprised to see that there wasn't an actual separate vegan menu, and only a few vegan items offered. Basically there was one salad, one appetizer, and one entree option. Unfortunately the entree option didn't work for me, and I asked the staff if they could put together a simple pasta with veggies. The staff was accommodating of this request, and the food was quite good. However, there was not a lot of choice. Bottom line, you will get a decent meal, but don't expect variety of options or choices.

F3zM5QzdrG1SLxNL11NiMA.text: Breakfast Brunch for the hubby in Vegas... after a nice swim. Food was delicious... drinks were amazing staff was super friendly!!! Definitely 5 stars!!! Vegas was good to us!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t89_bGEYp7s7zJe1EEb_QA.text: REVIEW FOR VEGANS  Went here with a group of 10 omnivores   I had a salad, bruschetta that was billed as an entree & 2 drinks.  Service was gracious, but slooooooooow  Food was tasty. But that bruschetta is NOT an entree-- especially when you see how dang big the MEAT options are  Menu has clearly marked the vegan & vegan possible options  Decor is lovely  Cocktail was AMAZING   Bill for all 10 of us was $710

iYoQuekKDTusP-jjyazsxg.text: Food was decent. I made a 7pm reservation for 1, arrived at 6:55 and it took 20 minutes to get seated, despite the restaurant being vastly empty. I was told I would receive a discount as a result of being an Ultimate Software conference attendee, but I did not. Spent close to $100 with tip for a glass of wine, salad, and salmon.

DeCqyyvlq9Y-6_lRc0zBag.text: So i came here for dinner. The service was outstanding and top notch. The food portions are very small but it is a high end type of restaurant.   We started with a arugula salad: very fresh and delicious. Next i had some kind of bread with pork belly avocado and a few other things on top. It was awesome i never had something like that before. We drank moscow miles with everything! Easily one of the best mules i've ever had but it wasn't too strong.   Next we had salmon which was hot and crispy omg he outside. The dip it came with was good too. Last we have a small piece of steak: very well cooked and crispy on the outside. i love when the food comes burning hot it's really so important!   Last i had the banana bread pudding and signature pot dessert. Both were UHHHAMAAZZZINNG! Check out my awesome pics!

6wrjH5WvdoH9A18WVrlv7w.text: Had lunch here today. The lady who greeted and seated us has no personality at all..no smile...no introduction or even a good morning..have a good day. We got there at 1130 handed a bfast menu and said its limited since its already lunch time. Then why did she hand out the bfast menu? Asked for the lunch menu..already got our drinks bfor she came nlback w menu . Ordered our burger fries and tuna appetizer as soon as we got the menu...didnt get our food till 1210....more than 30min. The table next to us who came later than us already got their food and had started their meal. I think they forgot our order since our server brought us some pretzels to start with...35 min later...and no apologies or anything that our food is taking a while....a burger we ordered mind you...then we even got a scoop of ice cream afterwards..hmmm...would not recommend this place at all...there was hardly anyone thwre and our order took that long. They should have comped our entire meal....nice ambiance but poor service

JVH-ms8eHHKuSzLba0_blA.text: We are at the Wynn for a conference and were looking for on-property dining. We had a lovely meal at Jardin. The decor is very white - walls, chairs, tables, a little jarring. Our server was attentive, but not overly so, very professional. I had an arugula salad with ricotta and fennel with grilled shrimp, light and tasty. Hubby had salmon that was cooked just right, served with Brussels sprouts. It's the Wynn/Encore so it's pricey, but the quality and overall experience was excellent.

J2AOIjl8ZYm7ad7KWxFnmg.text: For the price and the portion sizes...not worth the cost.  The ambience is great and the place was more than 3/4 empty.  I was super disappointed I could not order what I wanted.  We were not allowed to change the side items which is absurd.  I worked in restaurants of this caliper and the key we were always taught and it was stressed...the customer is always right despite what the Chef wants to do.  So I dropped 40 bucks here and did not get what I wanted.  That is just awful.  Stay clear and save your money. What I had you can get just as good at Red Hot and Blue!!!  Here is a key....make your customers feel like kings and queens because a good portion have to save up to feel like that once in a blue moon.

oE72QtnqijmtqAL7PqnltQ.text: What a great new restaurant at Encore! My family loved it especially the chocolate cake in the edible terra-cotta pot that looked so real! I had the tempeh entree which tasted great. Can't wait to come back in the summer it's right next to the resort pool

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempeh entree

A8xjW6Yz3x31voT9ijlQJQ.text: Great breakfast spot. The lobster eggs Benedict was great, and the crab cakes. Their tea and juice selections were also amazing. Service could be better but the food definitely makes up for it, and the ambiance.

NvLv2_Px3dNrySxS4hQIwQ.text: I just walked up to this restaurant and 3 extremely rude females ignored me when I asked them two questions.  They were so rude that I walked away and will not ever be eating or spending money at ghis establishment. Word of advise to this company...people want to spend money were employees are friendly.

_PpKS1l4NPjZ1J66b_igNw.text: My wife and I ate here for breakfast two days in a row (November 2016).  I had the fillet and eggs both times.  My wife got a omelet one day and the French toast the second day.  My fillet was pretty good. Not the best I ever had but still pretty good.    My wife's French toast and bowl of berries were excellent.  The staff was friendly.

akI-on6wi0Y6-FiNgST86w.text: Food is pretty good there, but somehow high-priced for this quality. But we're at the Wynn - Encore, so you would like to think it worth it. Unfortunately the service is very poor. We had a reservation that they decided to cancel without giving us any reason, so we had to wait for more than 30 minutes meanwhile the restaurant was pretty empty. Then the waitress forgot our drinks; we finally got them when the appetizers came to the table. Same thing with the wine, they brought us the bottle but we had to ask 3 times for somebody to open it... I guess the poor waitress had too many tables to take care of, but the ballet of supervisors, managers, whatever around was even more upsetting as none of them would help her or care about the guests. Keep your money and run out of here!

F7VJFrk4PJQFQX4azJ-Sgw.text: Came back to Vegas about a month ago with my hubs. We always stay at Wynn as it is our favorite hotel in Vegas. After gambling for hours, like it was no one's business, we decided it was time for dinner.   From the outside, Jardin is lovely, no doubt. Every time I've walked by in the past, I always commented on how I wanted to try the place out. On this particular night, Saturday, it wasn't busy at all. We were seated immediately, so that was nice. It pretty much went down hill from there.   Drinks: Took forever. The alcohol is one thing, but the water and soda didn't come out until the food came out. My double vodka came first but took as long as it would if the restaurant was actually busy. (Many empty tables.) Server said the bar was backed up. I looked over and there was 1 person sitting at the bar. Yah, really out of control. The server had to bring out a cart full of alcohol for the table next to us. Super dramatic style as if the bartender was swamped af. I laughed, literally. No idea what that was about.  Food: Like I mentioned... took forever. Restaurant 85% empty. I actually ate part of the bread basket which I never do. So long... so hungry.  I ordered the salmon. It came with white rice. The rice was hard af. Unedible. Comparable to the rice at the bottom of a cooker that u don't scoop because you know it is blown. I can't believe the chef even plated it. You can tell, visually without even trying it, that it wasn't good. I told the server. He seemed nervous and unsure of himself most of the night. Service should be stellar especially if a restaurant is most empty. They comped my one double vodka which is cool, but I was hungry. :( Salmon was decent, but I have made and had better. I'd expect a whole lot more considering the price is high for what it is. My hubs ordered the ravioli. It was seriously enough for maybe a child. I believe this is why their bread basket has big soft pretzels in it. They try to fill you up with that because they know their proportions are off with taste quality low. I felt bad for him. The plate looked really sad and was over $30, I believe. I understand we could have ordered appetizers and would have if it wasn't for the fact the food was so meh. Even if the plate barely had any food, at least make it amazzzinngggg. Then the price would somewhat make sense.   Would we ever dine here again? No. Just not worth it. Sinatra, at the Encore, is sooooo much better. Also, this restaurant looks to be more popular day time. Wayyy busier. Tables are filled. (Can imagine bartender would be out of his mind.) They also have an outdoor dining area which overlooks the pool. I guess I would come back just to sit in the patio and bask in the ambiance? I guess that deserves 1 star.

EjbVZNGfcF68Bl6Qs_H1eQ.text: What an amazing room! The food was great, the service was spot-on. We were treated like celebrities!

HD7h-aIlQqFdYSw5YDmCyw.text: The food is incredible. The only downfall less of a 5 star was the service. It took the waiter 15 min to come over just to give out dinner menus. We were stated with just drink menus.

ofsRfr4dw2wsSfqgp6VQzw.text: Lovely restaurant. I was looking forward to having a nice meal. After waiting 15 minutes at my table not a single person bothered to see if I needed anything or was ready to order. It was not terribly busy , so there is no excuse for ignoring a single diner. Very disappointing!.. Decided to leave without trying the meal. Did not try the food but the service left a bad taste .

JIQmyQeVSvKkXA6AAm4SHA.text: Brilliant! I went looking for a vegan breakfast and this venue didn't disappoint. Servers were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. I had the tofu scramble and it was excellent, perfectly crisp potatoes, nice scramble, and several options for bread. Venue outside is peaceful and relaxing for an early morning breakfast

bQBY0aPj_hXj0GoN4zyGdA.text: The service was slow.  We didn't know who the waiter was for a while.  They gave us the wrong menu to look at, they gave us the breakfast/ lunch menu during dinner.  The food was average and the medium steak was cooked rare.  Not worth coming here especially with so many great options in the area.

sWW33e1AvgfHsXPIzDsX_Q.text: Over priced and over rated.  The menu is extremely limited.  Burger started at 13.95 plain,  and any topping such as cheese or mushroom is $2 extra. Steak salad is very weak i.e. bland. Except for service,  everything else is below par.

4syF0PSHc62wrT67F8Jy0g.text: Staying in the hotel and came here for brunch. Being the Wynn, the scenery was beautiful but came with a long wait. All the staff were so attentive and accommodating. The only con was that the food didn't seem as hot and fresh as it could have been; it was probably sitting out for a while before getting to us.

4CJKg52xIiu85oS4KnIsnA.text: Beautiful venue, excellent service, and delicious food!

NihFLlIWl_XXF3YXCfdfaA.text: Came In for dinner last night for restaurants week. I had my hopes up for this place. The host was very nice as soon as we walked in we got greeted, but once we sat down our waiter was very rude! We waited long for our drinks and once we got our drinks it took for ever for her to get our order. At first we thought it was because she had a group of 6 she had to attend but once another couple got sited next to us she was sooo sooo nice to them she got there drinks and order. we weren't getting our food when they had there appetizers and wine. I don't understand why the difference between that group and us!! I don't want to say racism but she made it clear who was important to her. I don't think we're going to go back to get treated worse than a fast food restaurant!!!

A2PWoQNennFZqbgwX6PhdA.text: This place is so good, we ate here 3 times in a 3 day stay at the Encore!  We went for breakfast smoothies.  We had a great lobster roll for lunch the following day.  Then we loved it so much we had to try their interpretation of chicken and waffles before we went home.  I love eating at restaurants that make you feel like they appreciate your business.  Las Vegas is a city where this should truly be the norm and not the exception, but Jardin goes the extra mile to make sure they ask you the questions you forget to think of to make your experience a great one.  I'm sure we will visit this restaurant at least once any time we stay at the Wynn or Encore in the future.  With so many dining options in Vegas, its comforting to know a restaurant that never disappoints!

Fv9IsSKx6rehMQDXkT168g.text: We came in on Sunday June 12th for Restaurant Week 2016 lunch.  Place seemed steady busy, took about 20 minutes to get a table for 2.  I saw each table sat after us get service from the waitstaff, except our table.  After about 30 minutes, I saw a hostess speak to a gentleman in a suit & point to our table.  The gentleman in the suit came to our table & stated he was sorry for the wait.  I said " Yes, it felt like we were forgotten about."    I can't even make up what he said next, " Well we have a small celebrity in the restaurant that is more important." He then realized what he said quickly & flustered to correct his statement.  Our food did not come out in a timely fashion, again seeing tables sat after us getting their food.  When the gentleman in the suit came to our table to bring food, I asked if he was the manager, & he stated he was. I then asked him who the celebrity was & he told me Ciara & where she was sitting. Wow, I was floored, he spilled the information without blinking an eye.  Needless to say, our lunch & experience was not worth the $30.00 price tag.  Sad to come from such a high end hotel like Encore.  I am a local & really wanted to enjoy this place.

3lTUTAjjIb0w6nyjxWmRxg.text: Second time visiting and on this visit I had more time to really experience the menu and the food. You ever walk into a restaurant and realize theres nothing on the menu youd even both eating ie Public House at Venetian. Well here I wanted to order everything. The food reminds me of a step above Stack at Mirage and Beauty and Essex at Cosmo. The only saving grave Beauty and Essex has is the name, location and ambience.   Anyway, on to the food because the sevice, while present and cordial they dont really excel at making you feel at home. So, that leaves the food to carry this restaurant. I ordered the beet salad which was cute and dainty and really well seasoned and delicious.  At this point in restaurants everyone is going a beet salad and its kinda hard to screw it up. Im a sucker for fried chicken and honestly it was a toss up between that and the braised ribs with jalapeno grits. I went for the chicken because the menu just made it sound so delicious and it was probably some of the best sit down fried chicken ive had on the Strip. To top it off most entrees at Jardin come with sides and it feels like a whole menu.   Id go back for sure but i wish they had this menu as a quick service concept somewhere.   They lose a star because they served a moscow mule in a dinky little glass. For $16 they need to find copper mugs and sprigs of lavender. What a joke!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The orange lavender moscow mule that everyone raves about.  No copper mug and no lavender. :(

y6kJDgLMgDczWbKlHs0kIA.text: I came here for brunch recently, and Jardin still stands at 3 stars.  On my most recent visit, we were seated inside by the windows overlooking the pool.  I ordered the mixed berry parfait and three egg breakfast.  Nothing really tickled my taste buds, though the pieces of bacon I got with my plate were nice and crispy.  It took a long time for my entree to be brought out after my parfait, and service didn't really pick up until the end of our meal when our sever was around more and making conversation with us.  Tables looked like they were spaced apart, yet we could hear the conversion in the table next to us so not as far as they appeared.  Not sure I would come back again for a meal, though it is convenient if staying at Encore or doing some shopping there.

V_dfndHSktnQeXf3ND7wKg.text: Visited for breakfast with my husband and we were not disappointed.  This was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had in Las Vegas and as overpriced as I thought the meal was, I would eat there again because it was really delicious!.  I ordered Chicken omelet w English muffin w lots of avocado which was perfectly cooked and very flavorful. Coffee was hot and tasty, but served with really cold cream which is never a good idea because it just kills the heat of the coffee. I enjoyed the fresh Pomegranate juice but DANG $14 a glass is crazy.  My husband had Steak and eggs and said the steak was perfectly cooked. Eggs super fluffy and we both really enjoyed the finely shred hash brown - crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.  I'd go back just for those, lol.  Don't be put off by the small portions because the meals were actually quite filling.  Again, while everything was delicious it is way overpriced for the type of meal you get. The eatery options in Vegas are endless and you can get delicious food for much less (maybe not this good, but good enough)   World class customer service Meghan! Ambience was elegant but casual.

IivGcoSpLfcZuGX8gtvqDw.text: I am between giving 3-4 stars... really like the vibe of the restaurant. Food was extremely tasty (I ordered the chickpea bowl and my husband ordered the lobster Benedict- The hashbrown that came with the Benedict was delicious) BUT by the time we got our food it wasn't really warm? Service was also not very good - we asked our waiter to refill our waters twice and he never did, we eventually got the attention of a different waiter that refilled our waters. Overall experience was just ok.

lmze-5h9LK1v5RKlwFHlbA.text: Came here for breakfast many times during our trip.   Sat inside, outside and at the bar. Service was very good, prompt and attentive.  Restaurant is very pretty and the food is always first rate.   One downside is that it can get busy at the weekends.

6oLuZ5tAMjqkj7dqxusoMw.text: I really enjoyed dining here! Opted to sit outside (great move) and had a lovely waitress.   I started with a Caesar salad and it was basic per most restaurants, but still good of course.  I ordered a filet (medium) and it was cooked perfectly. The truffle fries are a MUST. Seriously these were delicious.   We paired our meals with a Prosecco and the waitress was awesome with a recommendation.  I will definitely come back to dine next time I'm staying at the Wynn!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cFtkuKr18VOC4r15oWo4UQ.text: As I was walking to the Wynn from Encore, I saw a sign for endless spaghetti with garlic bread and cesear salad so we stopped at the Jardin.   Food: I should have read the fine print a/o asked questions. It was bottomless spaghetti, garlic bread and cesear salad but it was served with a marinara sauce rather than bolognese so admittedly, I was disappointed. The pasta was cooked al dente and my unrefined palate again, was unhappy. Jardin totally delivered on the meal, I just expected cheap spaghetti bolognese but was served a much nicer meal. We also ordered the Thai chicken wings which were very tasty and the green vegan pizza which was surprisingly good for vegan food.   Service: excellent! Our server was attentive and friendly. Dishes were delivered at reasonable times and our drinks were always filled. No crazy wait for a table when there a lot of empty tables. The hostess was so kind to ask us our input for a table and moved us closer to the pool. My experience here was so much better than Andrea's!  Price: reasonable given the excellent service and food. It's not cheap but definitely worth it!  Location: it's located in the walkway between Encore and Wynn but closer to the E. Jardin is also located next to the pools so you could sit outside and enjoy the lovely atmosphere of greenery and water. We did and it was beautiful.   Overall, I'd go back to Jardin and recommend it!

Their berry plate is fresh, sweet, and delicious; which cannot be said for other restaurants who offer the same fruit options. Hubby decided to be creative and asked for a lobster omelette. Lz_34nKMHa7a2ZL4WhPQwA.text: We have ate breakfast here our entire stay at encore. The food is decent and I would have given this review a 4 based on the food. _JayMcbkCwL63q3405JTBQ.text: What an absolutely gorgeous restaurant. The decor inside is fabulous and it's nestled in the garden and pool area of the Encore. My family and I came in for dinner one evening and we were all impressed with the quality of this restaurant.  They offer these warm delicious pretzel bread sticks and regular crunchy sticks to start off with. For dinner, I had the salmon and it was probably the best salmon I ever had. Perfectly cooked and seasoned.   I decided to try a dessert and went for the chocolate flower pot. It was HUGE!!! It actually looked like a flower pot and it was rich and chocolaty without being overly sweet. It was way too much for one person to eat.   I would definitely recommend coming here if you are looking for a fabulous dinner with beautiful views and excellent service.
