BmICEAZjwPU0laKCkZdZMg.text: We have been here twice during our stay this week. Once for dinner and once for breakfast. Breakfast is definitely the winner! Everything was tasty! We got the steak and eggs and the Maine lobster Benedict, as recommended by most people on yelp. All the reviews are correct- they were delicious!! Service was quick, food was hot, and they kept our coffee and water refilled. Dinner was okay, the food was excellent but the ambiance was just "off". It was way too dark and the prices were too high for what we got. Overall, I would definitely come back here for breakfast or lunch!

-dNg8wNnYAywnA-60PbuKw.text: I was surprised the reviews weren't better as we had a lovely meal here.  I wasn't super hungry so I settled on the roasted tomato soup (YUM) and the mac' cheese bites (SUPER YUM).  Cocktails were delicious and service was great.    If you don't want to eat here, at least pop in to the bar for a cocktail because the design of the bottles up and across the ceiling is pretty neat.

toPhQNaZMzgmsZ_uO097-g.text: This was a very nice, quiet, elegant place to stop in for lunch!. Most of the people were seated outside (which there was a 25-30 min wait for), so we chose to sit inside, in which they offered us a window seat. The staff was very nice and we were seated pretty much right away for our 3:30 reservation. Bailey was our waitress and she was amazing!  Gf and I both ordered the sangria (which was sooooo good and refreshing). Upon getting the drink however, it had blueberries in it (which I'm a allergic to, and they replaced it with no hassle.   For lunch, I ordered the jardin burger, which was excellent. Juicy, with the porkbelly on top with the aoli sauce. Just perfect, and a side of fries. My gf got the margarita pizza, which was good as well.   Overall this place has a vibe that combines the elegance of a Sunday brunch with the cool & chill atmosphere. Would definitely come back. The floral center decoration in the middle of the restaurant just brings it all together.

WBhGg--QEMzR6ZSDC6MRSw.text: My Wife and I came here for our date night before going to see Le Reve, dinner reservations were not necessary though we did go on a Tuesday night. They were well staffed, and not too busy maybe 4 other tables in there with us. The restaurant itself is huge! Counting the large outside seating area.           SEATING/AMBIANCE:We were seated right away and noticed immediately the ambiance was incredible! We started by trying a couple of their Mule Cocktails as there was a beverage cart making them table side which was neat. The Mule's were average, nothing spectacular. Then after a time our server greeted us after having had our drink order taken and our cocktails made at the beverage cart and asked if we were ready to order which we were. We ordered the Buttermilk Chicken entree and the Beef Short Rib Ravioli along with a side of Lobster Mac & Cheese, Mashed Potatoes and a side of Vegetables.            THE FOOD was served promptly which is always nice! The presentation of each and every course was immaculate (which it should be for the prices and being a fine dining establishment). The food itself however was underwhelming and we were rather disappointed in the quality of flavor or lack thereof. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was really just Okay along with the almost flavorless Mashed potatoes. The vegetables didn't have much flavor and were somewhat watery. The Buttermilk Chicken was average for fried chicken, probably the best thing was the Beef Short Rib Ravioli which even then I would say was just "Good" the best thing about it was it's unique sauce with nice flavor. The portions of course were very small (even for fine dining) and expensive. Need to deliver more then beautiful presentation and ambiance, especially in Vegas were fine restaurants are a dime a dozen.         THE SERVICE: We maybe saw our server twice and only for a moment each time once to take order and again to deliver bill all other contact was with the the Food Delivery person or Beverage cart attendant. Overall we spent $140 for dinner and didn't bother for dessert because of the underwhelming experience up until then.  The Gelato place around the corner was great though!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu at Jardin

zHBNhaWNwalOayvgwwk0mw.text: I personally have to say the service at this restaurant is unlike any other. The manager on duty (Emily) was absolutely exceeded my expectations and was extremely sweet. It's not often you find this service in Vegas. I highly recommend you purchase their flower pot cake. You've never had anything like it.

uGBa7wFDAV9CCMxxCrF4Kw.text: I came here last week with some business associates and while the food itself was great, the service was not. Our drinks, meal, to go dish, and check all took SEVERAL requests from several different staff members before being brought to us. Certainly not what you'd expect when spending a bit of money on a breakfast. Three requests spanned over 15 minutes for a diet soda? A side of pancakes being brought out once everyone's done eating, despite the two inquisitions previously made at the arrival of the rest of the dishes.. not acceptable, and not worth coming back. They need to do a refresher on what it means to be AT WORK, instead of standing around in groups of 3, chatting while paying customers struggle to get their full meal and drinks.

1WLV_LldUaeFq5jJE_TXsg.text: Exceptional service, food, staff and ambience!!! We arrived in Friday to start a birthday weekend and went straight to Jardin for late lunch. Amazing pasta with stumps, salmon and salad!!! Fresh baked pretzel bread was melting in your mouth. Definitely will come back on my next trip!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale quinoa salad with grilled chicken
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish Salmon
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp capellini

sXd_iu59PxnbCcLDqD8WYA.text: Beautiful, bright setting.  Great menu and service.  I've been a few times, and plan on returning.

ZQAn8QmOY3BanD1jrjEupw.text: I am giving 4 stars for the food and the decor. The service sucks. Never was asked how was our food. Some employees should learn etiquette. I will try one more time but lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Rose too sweet -tasted like a juice minimal alcohol

W2eaUKEYRlCKwAeOXTSlAA.text: We booked a reservation for Jardin for my senior prom. Upon arriving, we were seated immediately and offered water. We had no problem ordering, and got the appetizers quickly. However, it went downhill completely after that. It took over an hour for us to receive our food. We ordered a meat sauce for one of the spaghettis, however the cooks brought out a plate of meat instead. They also forgot to bring out a mac and cheese we ordered. The menu doesn't tell you all the information; for example multiple people in our party ordered mac and cheese without being told it was cauliflower mac and cheese. One persons burger was completely pink inside after, my garlic bread was completely burnt. I do appreciate them taking off the burger on the bill, and the late mac and cheese. We also received two free desserts. I'm still giving Jardin only one star, because of the poor experience on our prom night, making us late to our prom as we were there for about two hours. We were only a party of 6, and the place was empty. There is no reason that our food took as long as it did.

XrgFWsVSh_mlM6Re9h9LVQ.text: Jardin is a very nice restaurant located inside Encore. Things to try. Popcorn Chicken, Grandmothers Chicken Meatballs, Truffle Pizza, Green Pizza, Bigeye Tuna Poke, Organic Salmon, Caramelized Chicken Ravioli, Braised BBQ Short Ribs, Truffle Fries and Fork Mashed Potatoes. Good food nice atmosphere and of course class. Give them a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-UYMGIXvNDi-taiktDsYrA.text: This place was okay! Went here for a comped dinner before going into XS. I believe the old restaurant here used to be a burger place??  This is an American restaurant that triples their prices because it's in the Wynn... Duhhhh obvi. I was looking at their menu for a price range and it was your basic 10$ for vegetables, 30$ for a few pieces of shrimp ETC... So not that bad.  We tried the cheese and meat plate, and kale salad for appetizer. Then for dinner: baked chicken on green beans, tomato cheese rice, steak for entrees. We also got ONE free Moscow mule. No dessert unfortunately. Everything was delicious and made with superb quality. Everything didn't wow me but it was delicious and piping hot!   Our server wasn't very friendly though, she acted like we were a burden because we were a comped table... Does she not know us industry people tip out extremely well? She even tried to charge us for a drink we didn't order thinking it was a mixed drink because the restaurant ran out of copper mugs.

S2u1g8suS45TAT4dXFbcYQ.text: My husband and I made a reservation here for my birthday dinner and we couldn't be happier with our decision. We were seated promptly and everybody was very attentive. We had Wayne as our waiter and he made sure everything was to our liking the entire night. We never felt rushed and our drinks were always full. For the appetizer we ordered the meatballs which were really good. For our entree, I ordered the short ribs with a size of the truffle Mac & cheese bites and my husband ordered the prime rib. Everything was very tasty,especially the mac  &cheese bites. They were so rich I loved them! For dessert we had to try the flower pot cake which was perfect. The balance of sweetness between the chocolate mousse layers with the chocolate and raspberry filling was perfection. We would definitely come back here to try their other menu options for brunch/lunch! Great experience overall.

R4mGow18yQrv_RJ2T_oacQ.text: Worst service staying at the hotel the whole place is empty and the been waiting 30 min to sit. The blonde waitress I the front working right now was so rude. Other people waiting told the front they were here b4 us and still no service. Not used to this never have I ever been treated like this. Makes me want to not only never go here again but never stay in this hotel. My husband and I own 11 restaurants and this is a huge red flag

x8aC_hLvSHuflUm7lYtIRw.text: Very poor service, super slow and everything took forever. That's not an expectation you have from any restaurant yet alone here in Vegas. Completely disappointed.

sPMB-03qK73NK7kuhK2WYg.text: This quiet tucked away gem in the Wynn Encore is quite beautiful and elegant.  It feels like a white garden room with all the flowers and charm for a pleasant meal.  Three of us came here for dinner and overall the experience was quite good.  Service was very attentive and professional, very well trained staff.  Our table was actually near the outdoor garden so the view was pleasant too.  The only downside was I was i advertently given an old menu and what I wanted was not available, and I really wanted it!  Oh well.  I was quickly given a new menu and the choices were far less, so I ended up with a compromise, Branzino.   The fish was well prepared with a puree of potato and some veggies, all quite good.  One dinner companion wanted a small salad and they accommodated it nicely and without any fuss.  Overall the experience was good enough and a nice choice in the Casino/Hotel and away from the crowds.  And the price wasn't that bad either.

mbAQswdgQH-8M0qTeE9mZg.text: Good food but really small Portions. My kale salad was good. Other people at my table got the meatballs and fried chicken as well as their soup. Everyone enjoyed their meals

G3BWxP4xcAfq4O8Wj2qLmw.text: The decor is beautiful the food is delicious and the price is just right ( relative to the surrounding Venus).  This is not a loud pumping music-high energy  95 db joint like STK steak house but a classy calm establish where you can carry on a nice conversation while enjoying your superbly prepared meal.  It was a perfect setting for me as my voice needed a break from a 4 day club hoping marathon which completely obliterated my voice box with the help of the dry air.   I've been here a few times and its ever changing menus have never disappointed me.  I posted some pictures and every dish we ordered was delicious.

XU4xz4bWDJNdNJhvvYdJKg.text: I was super excited to finally try this place and i am happy to say it did not disappoint. The food was delicious and service was great. I loved the pretzel bread they brought us out before the entrees. One of my favorite things were their mac&cheese balls, ugh the dipping sauce was so good. Then to finish off we had the edible flower pot. I thought it was going to probably be dry since the outer layer was a little hard to cut into but boy was I wrong. The inside was a super rich and moist chocolate cake with chocolate mouse. The outer layer ended up being super good too as it was just a chocolate mold. I loved the whole look of this place and I am seriously super excited to go back and try different things.

XLRQqfF6SddJhnvirjAuhg.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Encore at the Wynn so we decided to have breakfast/brunch one morning at Jardin. The decor and service were both lovely. My husband had the short rib sliders and enjoyed them. I ordered the maine lobster benedict. There is no egg I love in this world more than a poached egg. Well I received 2 hard eggs on my benedict. I know poaching eggs is an art, however, at this calibur of restaurant there is no excuse for improperly poaching an egg. Honestly for the prices at this restaurant I would not recommend anyone to go here. I do not mind spending $30 on a nice properly prepared brunch for myself. I do mind spending that much when the food is not prepared properly.

6dQu--X-baHpslqKki4zqw.text: Another pay alot for mediocre food restaurant, the Buffalo cauliflower where nasty, greasy and not cryspy, definatly will not get those again. The short ribs ravioli were ok nothing special,the wife had the baked prawns and we split the Margherita flat bread... more like tortilla than flat bread, she was not impressed , i give it two stars because service was decent and people were friendly or else it would of been 1 star.

cTwbxE3julmHwtRv4g9usw.text: Dinner at Jardin was hands down our favorite meal during our short visit to Las Vegas. I ordered from their pre fixed menu since the choices were exactly what I would have wanted to order on their al a carte menu. My appetizer was a crab cake, entree filet mignon cooked perfectly to my specifications. It also included a choice of 2 desserts.  We were there to see Le Reve and didn't mention it to our server until we ordered dessert. He was able to request the kitchen to rush it since we only had 20 minutes to our show time.  My dessert was a warm berry crostada that was cooked to order. It was amazing.   I wish I had more time to relax and eat the whole thing but it was our fault for not letting the server know earlier of our time constraint.  Definitely go to this restaurant. Our server was amazing (I wish I remembered his name) along with all the other wait staff that was servicing our table.  We sat by the window overlooking the pretty pool area.

J4eaL21aPKzuMj11F8B11w.text: Food was dissapointing here, been coming to wynn/encore for many years and I'm used to top notch food from every restaurant here. This was just average, nothing special. First dissapointing dining experience here, out of 50 or 60 that I've had.

w-cIPP_Mp2qS-bxOaq-oBQ.text: I don't post much, but this place moved me to. I cannot say enough good things! From being greeted at the door, to our server being one of the most fun and attentive we have ever had, and then a visit from the GM who was one of the most engaged managers I have ever seen. She moved from table to table with a huge smile, engaging people and joining in the service. My recommend - chicken and waffles and chilaquiles are awesome!!

PYzNISUDKZLR5_CrTrBPSQ.text: We've stayed at the Encore several times and have loved everything about this resort including the restaurants, so I was expecting another wonderful meal at Jardin on our first visit since they opened. The restaurant is beautiful, surrounded with Windows and adorned with fresh colorful flowers. Unfortunately, the tables are very close to each other and it was annoying to hear the conversations of people next to us, literally 18 inches away. As for the food, I expected something similar to Terrace Pointe, typical Vegas cafe, nothing exotic, but reliable fresh delicious food. I was disappointed. First of all, it's a very limited menu. We came here around 2 on a Friday after checking in and before hitting the Encore pool. Half of the menu was breakfast, with only a few salad and sandwich choices. I went with the Caesar salad with grilled chicken. The salad came soaked in dressing, it was very soggy and iced cold as if it was sitting in a fridge before they doused it with dressing. Also, for an extra $7 I expected grilled chicken, this was cubed pieced of semi frozen chicken, similar to what you'd find in a bag at the supermarket. I understand that Caesar is made with anchovies but the fishy taste was overpowering. I ended up sending it back and the waiter apologized and offered me something else. I was turned off and no longer hungry so I passed. My husband ordered the fried chicken sandwich which he liked, I tasted it and it was pretty good. I  recommend walking over to Terrace Pointe at the Wynn if you're looking for a cafe, skip Jardin.

PyHIPhQmsGMZ1AKwI5_GGw.text: Terrible. Don't bother. Does not compare to the former amazing Society Cafe. :(. Plastic cups to bring your wine to go??  Fake flowers. So cheesy.

x39FLHVjrDRqfbm1K3-Akw.text: We went for breakfast -- so disappointed that Wynn/Encore closed Society Cafe its previous breakfast place.  The good -- food and service.  We were able to order a traditional bacon and egg breakfast, off menu - just ask!  Service was excellent.  The chairs are comfortable.  The negative.  The acoustics are terrible -- I mean terrible -- you can hear everyone's cutlery clinking.  The food is overpriced.

GQxBNua8QCNscDoMLHpBWg.text: Food is okay, service isn't so great. I ordered a 5 course meal and left still hungry.  In addition, my bill was $105 total and still hungry.  Waitress forgot about me so after waiting nearly an hour to pay, I had to walk my money up to the kitchen door to finish paying/transaction.  Waffle House service at a premium price.

5jHIVUHHvSVdM4ngNFVN8g.text: A wonderful upscale dining experience. Nice atmosphere, an excellent staff, awesome food and cocktails. The roasted Portuguese octopus was a delight, and the Tuscan short ribs left me wanting more. I can't wait to return!!

3Az33jmmZcLXPfAThv5c6A.text: Wonderful place to eat and enjoy your meal. We went for dinner and it was amazing. Decent price and very cool atmosphere, I had the short ribs which was the most tender I have ever had. My husband had the filet and said it wad also very good. Lastly the bread pudding dessert is a must. We live in vegas so we will definitely come back. Yum!!

fDr_Lj6vrT-5y-wTk_TDQA.text: Nice to see they offer vegan dishes!  I tried the white bean soup which was tasty. I also tried the coconut curry tempeh entree. I'm from Detroit and you don't see this in many restaurants back home so was excited to try it.  It was good but unfortunately a bit bland which was a bit disappointing. Other than that the restaurant was nice and would go back.

mLRihupLgGb_-c2koLBfUA.text: Visually the restaurant looked great. The menu even looked good with what it had to offer. So we decided to go there for my birthday and then see the show Le Reve (best show in town by the way). So we get seated in what we thought was a private table. Well every 30 seconds there was a buser getting into storage by our table.....Then the employees belly aching about the set up and complaining to each other......We ordered a pizza and 2 lobster rolls......The lobster was terrible and the bread it was on was just as bad......The only saving grace of the night was Joseph the manager. He really took charge and made it up to me and made me feel like it was my birthday.......He was great!!!!!! Sorry to say with so many places to go in town we will never go back there!!!!!!! Maggianos is right across the street and its a great place!!!

rKiRPmG4DEhb-oVKzc3LtQ.text: TERRIBLE - SERVICE and FOOD.  Worst waitress ever....not even close to what I expect from a Wynn associated property.  Wow, don't know where to start with what was wrong with our dining experience.  (I should have known it wouldn't be good when we were able to get a 7:00 reservation that day on one of the busiest weekends in Vegas).  We had to flag our waitress down for everything...from trying to order wine, appetizers, dinner, waitng for the food to arrive, the check...well, you get the idea.  We even had to take our check up to the hostess stand to pay because our waitress was MIA.  And when she did come by (after we would flag her down), it was an effort for her to help us.  Then the food itself......I'll leave it at, we got sick on the crab appetizer....literally sick.  I LOVED the space when it was Botero and hoped it would be similar....terrible disappointed.  Every other dining experience at the Wynn/Encore has been 5 star....try one of those restaurants and avoid Jardin at all costs!

JyJSyx1nf9_ZxjEjiI_p-A.text: Jardin was highly recommended by the concierge at Mandarin Oriental due to Steve Wynn (owner of Encore and Wynn Hotels in Las Vegas) making sure there are vegan options in his restaurants.  Ambiance in Jardin is lovely, light, and bright with white decor and indoor and outdoor seating available.  The room was uncomfortably warm due to the door to the outside seating being located within 30 feet of where we were sitting.  The highlight for me was the vegan entree of Mushroom Dashi, a beautiful bowl of baked tofu in broth with  baby bokchoy, mushrooms, and rice noodles.    It was delicious and creative.  Unfortunately, the non-vegan entrees left a lot to be desired.  The pork chop was a large portion and a good cut, but it lacked flavor and the sauce was uninspiring.  The salmon was dry and inedible.  The waiter removed it from the table without even asking why the diner left almost the entire fish on the plate.  The most disappointing aspect of the dinner was the service.  From waiter to the waiter's assistants, the staff cultivated a stiff and pretentious demeanor that was off putting.  With all the delicious restaurant options available in Las Vegas, we would not try Jardin again.

5kMd9-zjTlE8LgS7TyeZcQ.text: My wife and I came here after a long walk on the Strip. First of all, the ambience is so relaxed and and colorful with the surrounding elegant flowers and pool setting outside. We had the following:  Grandma's Chicken Meatballs $14  Chopped Kale Salad $14  Sea Scallop Cioppino $29  Hot Pot $20  Biegnets with Raspberry Sauce $10  The chicken meatballs were absolutely divine! They were probably the best chicken meatballs or maybe meatballs in general i've ever tasted. They were tender but still had a good texture and the tomato sauce and ricotta cheese helped the dish add more flavors. The kale salad was good. Next time though i would ask for the dressing on the side bc it was dressed pretty well. I liked the apple slices in it which made it refreshing. My cioppino tasted good but I thought it was too small of a portion for $29 and the scallops were of the small variety. My wife's hot pot consisted of kurobota pork, kimchee fried rice, and a fried egg. I thought it was good but not worth $20. The dessert was fantastic! The beignets were surprisingly light and airy with the acidic raspberry sauce to balance it. The service was great. Our waiter described to us in detail about the menu. FYI, the menu does include an allergen guide which shows how customer focused this resto is. I give it 4/5 stars bc the ambience and service were great and the food tasted pretty good. The chicken meatballs and beignets were 10/10 on execution and taste.

ScjCU1eeW7m_E7-9nQcLhw.text: Delicious food, great atmosphere and wonderful service. Nice options for vegans/vegetarians, including an incredible coconut tapioca pudding for dessert! Special shout out to our server, Alicia, who was friendly and efficient.

axKPWl1Nmf9fo8gazVpm-A.text: My husband and I really enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service here.  Has a great atmosphere and food was done right.  I recommend the buffalo cauliflower, the ceasar salad, as well as the fish fry.  We would definitely come back here next time we are at Wynn/Encore.

pGx5LL9qEBCV7ww6jzKD5w.text: Best crab cake in Vegas. Underrated restaurant...Better than many of the higher rated spots around town. Located in the Wynn Encore casino hotel.

TWapljZAsZOFNGHqT1ULjQ.text: Completely overpriced for overly salty food and slow service. You're better off with the other casual dining options at the Wynn/Encore such as Red 8 and Wazuzu.

5JgKOH1MfAh4_tqn1U0YPw.text: Great food...  Terrible service...  Be prepared to wait a long time for food.  As I'm typing, my husband is pulling hair out of his Avocado Toast.  Sorry!!!  High hopes dashed.

bFENWL9k2rIv1tVHcS1_vg.text: This place is a solid choice. Good food and service. Great room and space. Would return.

ZHZCjl9nd1cbILXrMLwdHg.text: So for being in one of my favorite hotels the experience my friends and I had at this restaurant was horrendous. So lets start off with our reservations. We were a large party and had a reservation on Saturday night at 8:30 for 11 of us. They told us that if we were late or did not show up we would be incurred a charge of $50 dollars per person. We got there early and were not even seated until at least 45minutes past our reservation time.  We inquired about the wait twice, the first time we were told that they were still waiting for one of the tables to leave.  The second time they told us that they were going to relocate the current table to another table.  Once we got inside I was a little confused because the restaurant was not busy.  It wasn't even half full so I don't understand why it took so long for us to get seated.  Then, we finally get seated and the waiter takes our drink orders.  They had a moscow mule cart and about half of us ordered one.  It was delicious and we all enjoyed it.  It was also really cute and a good way for us to get our drinks right at the table.    About fifteen minutes later we noticed that the tables around us all had warm pretzels/bread sticks.  We had to flag down a busser to inquire about it and they were the ones that brought some out to us.  That was strange, I thought the waiter was supposed to do that.  One of us ordered a soup and salad at their dinner, the salad arrived about 30 minutes after ordering.  However, it was over and hour later by the time we all got our food.  When we did get our food we received two salmon steaks that were completely raw in the center and a steak that was ordered medium well but came out raw.  The rest of the food was pretty good.  I had the fried chicken but my side dishes were cold.  I did not want to send my food back because I was so hungry and did not want to wait another hour before getting my food.  The other half of us that got hot food, really enjoyed their meal.  However, I was so hungry that I got full waiting for my food.  I hate blaming the server because he does not control the kitchen.  He was actually pretty nice and accommodating.  Meanwhile there was a table near us who arrived at least thirty minutes after us, they got their food before we did.  I think that this was the longest dinner that I have ever had.  We were so tired and over it by the time dinner was over.  Finally, we pay our bill and after we get our change/cards back we ask to speak to the manager. We were being polite and told him what happened. That was a waste of time because all that he said was, "Thanks for the feedback" and walked away.  That was completely rude and he did not care one bit.  I do not think that I will  return to this restaurant.  This is pretty high on my list for some of the worst service I've ever had.

R00xZ_Q9jK18Jcfkbg0TYA.text: Very pretty decor but I expect nothing less from The Wynn properties. A few friends & I dined here for no particular reason other than to try something new. The food was okay and the dessert very cute. The overall theme and decor is nice. The service was slow and I we had to repeat ourselves a few times on different items. We had 3 servers during our stay which was odd(didn't feel a personal touch). My friends loved the drink cart as a nice touch. I would like to come back for breakfast or brunch but I'm not fond of the slow service. SMH

kNon_uTcF9hdzUkdWSo-Og.text: Saw an advertisement for Jardin so I decided to give it a try. I'm a big fan of the Wynn/Encore casinos but I've never eaten there. I usually make reservations but I was too lazy I just walked up and was seated within 10mins. The decore is open and airy with beautiful flowers. It was a toss up between the chicken sandwich and chicken and waffles/French toast. I decided on the French Toast and a Cajun Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary was very good and the food was good also. I would recommend Jardin for Breakfast/ Brunch.

3KL_zbLa1VqrFmkjxT-SBQ.text: Beautiful restaurant, great service, and delicious food!  We loved the fabulous warm pretzel bread with mustard butter, and enjoyed all the entrees suggested by our server. The Lobster capellini tasted heavenly and included a full lobster tail and lots of chunks. The pork chop was cooked just right, with a wonderful sauce!  Definitely a great find at a reasonable price.

ttf3I6ezA7oiE0oaAaor-g.text: Got a comped dinner before heading to XS Night Club. We each received a moscow mule before dinner. The food was so good! They gave us a variety of dishes. The service was excellent! I will definitely be returning. :)

7CwWcOIRG5HuF7gE45pXWA.text: We were surprised to see that this new restaurant had just opened, and decided to try it.  That was the best decision we made.  Even though they had only been open a few days, the service was top notch and the food was spectacular.  Arianna was our server, and she treated us with so much joy and passion, and any request was met with a fantastic smile.  I ordered the Pork Chop and the oven baked Mac & Cheese with ham, both were cooked to perfection.  I highly recommend trying this place.  We for sure will be back.

eGbzaUdTYorIch7M5No6QA.text: This place was great. We made reservations and they seated us outside, per our request. We had the crab cake for an appetizer. Very good, but. A little on the small side. The wind started up and it was cold, so the waiters found us a nice place inside. The hot twisted pretzels w butter was yummy. I ordered the boneless short ribs and hubby ordered the fried chicken . Both were great. The Brussel sprouts w scallions that came with the fried chicken were out of this world!  This place states casual dinning, but I felt like it was more like relax  and enjoy your meal in casual clothes and eat like a queen and king!

P0LUs2xJ5jvW5UEol-2E3w.text: My fiance and I went to Jardin for a mid-afternoon bite to eat. The restaurant was pretty much empty. We ordered a BOY Burger and a bowl of chicken noodle soup. After waiting for our food for 30 minutes, we asked what was taking so long. The waitress replied that it takes 20 minutes to cook a burger (okay, then why is it not ready after 20?). We waited 40 minutes for the food to finally arrive. The soup came in parts: a few shredded pieces of dried out chicken and exactly 4 small pieces of dried pasta. The waitress then proceeded to pour broth from a teapot into the chicken to hydrate it, I guess. The presentation was unique but the taste was awful. The soup had absolutely no flavor at all! I put a lot of salt into it and it still lacked flavor. This was not even chicken broth. It tasted and looked like beef broth or the au jus that comes with a french dip sandwich(but even that would have had more flavor). I complained about the lack of taste to the waitress and she said that the manager would come over to speak us. For a restaurant that is very highly priced in a very upscale hotel with a chef's name attached, I'd expect that they could handle a bowl of chicken noodle soup. The manager said she would take the price of the soup off our bill ($10). That was fine but not the point. When our bill did arrive we were charged $36 for a burger and an ice tea. The price of the burger on the menu was $16 but on our bill it was charged as $29! When I asked about this the waitress said she would take it to the manager. She came back with a lowered bill and stated that the manager took off the ice tea. This still did not explain the $29 charge for a $16 burger. We were so frustrated with poor service and lousy food we just paid the bill. On the way out, I asked to see the menu one more time to see if there was something I missed, the young ladies at the front desk were very rude. When I questioned why the burger had an extra $13 on it they said that it was for the toppings and fries (really, cheese?!). I asked why it didn't say that on the menu. She stated the restaurant had just opened and they needed to work out some kinks on the menu. With all of the outstanding choices of places to eat at the Wynn and in Vegas in general, why would anyone want to waste their money on this place. Awful, don't waste your time, taste buds, or money!

LVApZ6aC-zgBSPPE6lC0lQ.text: we had a large party and the staff was excellent.  they have a prix fix which I would recommend.  Portions are quite large and the deserts are excellent.  I had salmon but if I were to order it again I would ask for it simply grilled as the sauce was a little over-powering.  It is a very beautiful place and elegant in a casual way.

ROW5HnGSbaotiG-ClCENUQ.text: The service was impeccable. From start to finish.  My husband's dish, the corned beef St Patty's special was good - smaller portion but doable.  The Caesar Salad was simple deliciously dressed.  Pretzel sticks also soft and yummy.  The ATROCITY though??? LOBSTER CAPELLINI $31. Not worth it at all. And resulting in my would be 4 stars down to 2 stars.   By far the worst pasta I have ever had at a restaurant of this level. The lobster portion was good and prepared decently, however the hot heat and Pernod sauce was way heavy and made the noodles overdone - very mushy.   This is the point where I am starving hence ordering the pasta dish and made no say to take it back.  And mostly because all the other points throughout dinner were serviced nicely.   I'd also forgo the tuna stack... to much fillers less tuna.

IOlIwWGxT8E4cU5_R-yQWA.text: Where do I start.... Amazing experience. Hubby and I had dinner reservations before heading to a show at the Encore Theater. As soon as we stepped in we were greeted by a friendly hostess who directed us to our seats. Our server was warm and attentive. My husband had the burger and it was delicious l, out cocktails were perfect. I had the crab cakes which were divine. Absolutely love the decor. Gorgeous restaurant. Perfect for date night. We will certainly be back when we are in Vegas.

fHakmlbW-cfeSR2sMFAAAA.text: During our most recent visit to Encore we had dinner on our first night at Jardin, and boy were we pleased...  The meal began with a bread basket of pretzel bread sticks with a peppercorn butter spread. Usually u say "ugh" when pretzel bread comes out since most places I've had it serves cold, tough bland pretzel bread which wastes precious appetite reserved for the appetizers and entrees that I am there for.  I decided to try a bit more out of curiosity for the taste of the peppercorn butter spread.  I was VERY surprised to bite into a hot soft delicious breadstick with just the right amount of salt which the peppercorn spread complemented beautifully.  I have never spent more than an passing comment about a bread service, but I felt that I needed to share my delightful surprise...  Moving along...  in our group of four people, we ordered both appetizer and main dinner courses.  Appetizers included the Roasted Tomato Soup about which the two in my party who had it raved.  My wife and I split and Caesar Salad which was very fresh and crisp, dressed perfectly with just the right amount of dressing and Grana Padano cheese. Delicious!  For our entrees my wife and I split the Short Rib Ravioli and the Bigeye Tuna Poke.  Short Rib Ravioli consisted of delicious braised short rib meat stuffed in pillows of fresh pasta to form the ravioli.  Parmesan cream sauce with port glaze to add some nice flavor perfected the dish.  If you love, like or can tolerate short ribs and enjoy a rich (but not overwhelming) cream sauce, you will LOVE this dish (hopefully) as much as I did!!!    The Tuna Poke was very nice and fresh and balanced. My only suggestion to improve it to my taste would be to add more avocado. Something about sashimi grade Tuna diced with avocado chunks is a match made in culinary heaven.  Just my opinion though... if you don't dislike avocado you won't mind it.    One other of our party ordered the Lobster Capellini and said that it was very good. He finished the dish and he is not one to do so unless it is something he truly enjoyed...  Service was very attentive and professional.  Not one complaint or neutral/negative comment to be found.  The decor was beautiful and featured an immense floral arrangement in the center of the restaurant which brightened up the entire space.  Just gorgeous!

t4j1vV_-0jV7m721bhHd6A.text: We came in pretty late, close to closing time. Service was great. Got the crab cake and mushroom tartine appetizers. Crab cake was fine, but I've had better. The vegan mushroom tartine was very nice. The almond cheese was creamy and cheesy yet not heavy at all. They both paired nicely with our drinks. Venue looked great. Overall nice experience

Gz4iJ9oJezH4fcMvzZwmpA.text: I wanted a casual dining experience while at Encore or Wynn and was debating between Jardin and Tableau. But once I saw photos of the Maine Lobster Benedict, I knew I had to go to Jardin.   It's located in the beginning of the Encore Esplanade, right across from Hermes. It's a beautiful restaurant with tons of colorful flowers. If you sit outside, you overlook the pool area.   I don't like ending conversations on a negative note so I'm not doing that with this review. The food was marvelous and I'll get into that soon. But the service was very lacking which was surprising to me for a luxury resort hotel. I had had wonderful service so far during my stay that I was disheartened to experience less than great service from Jardin. I was told afterward from my husband that he had made a special request TWICE (from the hostess who sat us down and to the maitre'd himself) for our anniversary. Unfortunately, that request was never fulfilled and even when he had approached them afterward, they did not make any offer of amends.   We had three different servers. One had been moved indoors and so we had a second server. Then it got too cold outside and once we were moved inside, we had our third server. Of the three, our second server, Megan, was the most attentive. We were not checked on often by any of the other two which was a sad shame.   But on a better note, our lunch was fabulous. I ordered the avocado toast as an appetizer and it seems pricey at $16 but it comes with three triangular toasts that are heaped on with fresh avocado, black garlic humus, pomegranate seeds, lettuce and grape tomatoes. It was delicious.   We both ordered the Maine Lobster Benedict and it was the best Benedict I've ever had. $24 but very much worth it in my opinion. Two English muffins with large pieces of lobster on each and an excellently poached egg on top of each. In the middle was a rectangular hash brown that was a great compliment to the dish. It was very crispy and buttery. I loved this dish and highly recommend it if you're able to have lobster and don't mind the higher price.   I also had the Orange Lavender Mule which was delicious! Loved it so much, Megan gave me the recipe from the bar.  It was so refreshing and delightful. I also had an English breakfast with milk. They serve Forte teas on the Wynn property which is nice.   Overall, the food we had was marvelous. Maybe we just had sheer bad luck with regards to the service during this visit and hopefully it'll improve. If you want Maine Lobster for breakfast though, come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster Benedict. So delicious. Highly recommend. $24
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Lavender Mule was refreshing and delicious. One of my new favorite drinks.
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English breakfast tea with some milk.

OSGnWKrVoAoJnblQiyw7Cw.text: Fun little spot in the connection hallway between Wynn and Encore.  This Garden was beautiful.  Flowers everywhere, beautiful art and just an all around great place to sit an enjoy Brunch.  Some of their menu options were very creative like my Chicken & "Waffles" which was a French toast with a hole cut in the middle and egg fried inside with some buttermilk fried chicken placed on top and maple syrup.  Some options were not very creative like the fried chicken sandwich which was literally that.  Fried chicken breast in between two pieces of bread with some slaw.  Not sure what my friends expected but they were definitely jealous when they saw my dish.  We had some sweet potato fries with the chicken sandwiches and they were waffle cut and very delicious.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Honestly I'd give this place 5 stars but I feel the menu was slightly lack luster (maybe needs a bit more options) and also the cost for what you get seemed a bit out of whack.  This place is very pricey.  I know I rated this 4 stars, but I'd probably not choose to come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and &#34;waffles&#34;

Cwzoj_UG-HhjOsfHj2fSVg.text: Jardin is one of my favorite restaurants.  I always go there for special occasions.  But recently I took my friend there to celebrate her birthday, to my disappointment, they removed the giant flower vase in the center of the restaurant! Instead they put two trees to fill the space.  That completely down graded the restaurant atmosphere.  I wish they will consider restoring the giant flower vase.

NfIai_vSvftDZkfOkTT9lg.text: I rarely find restaurants where I cannot make a single complaint but yes, Jardin was THAT good.  Let's start off with service. The service was absolutely impeccable. Our waiter made excellent recommendations, checked up on us  properly and our water glasses were never empty. I wish I had gotten our waiter's name because I would request him every time. We also did not come in with a reservation. My friend and I had missed a reservation at Tableau and wandered looking for a new place (so glad we missed Tableau because in comparison to Jardin, eating at Tableau is like eating at Denny's). We were seated promptly. We did feel slightly weird as many patrons are dressed too nicely for a "casual" restaurant but the staff did not seem to care that we were underdressed.  We got three appetizers to share since my friend and I found those most appealing. Before our food came out, we were served complementary pretzel sticks with honey mustard whip. Let me tell you, these were some of the best pretzels I've ever had. We ordered the smoked octopus, buffalo cauliflower and strip steak carpaccio. The smoked octopus was my favorite! It's served with chorizo and a garlic aioli. The octopus is so tender that it cuts with a fork. I would come back for this dish alone! Next, buffalo cauliflower is a pretty standard dish. Jardin did it so well, the cauliflower was cooked just perfectly and the breading was light and crisp. Lastly, the beef carpaccio was sliced thinner than paper! Overall the food was so fabulous that my friend and I were almost in tears (yes we cry over food lol).   I cannot recommend Jardin enough! Food was amazing, service was amazing, decor is amazing! I can't wait to come back to try their flower pot dessert. Yuuuuum.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo cauliflower with vegan blue cheese dressing. Seriously you would never notice the dressing is vegan unless you were told!
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip steak beef carpaccio with potato croquettes and cheese crisps. Mouth wateringly delicious.
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked octopus - my absolute favorite! Like seriously, I dream about this octopus!

xjBUMZa551X4HTUhQ02X4A.text: The most impressive thing about this restaurant is the decor. Beautifully decorated, swanky bar, eye catching touches everywhere but unfortunately, that's where it ends. Everything is else is lackluster.   The service isn't good. They all look like they'd rather be somewhere else. Our busser was more attentive than our waiter. He never delivered the dishes or checked on our food but he popped up every 30 seconds to pick up the signed check. For these prices you would think they would bring it with either service or food but the food was pretty average too. It reminds me of a high end cafe. I had a three course meal and there isn't one thing that stood out. The beet salad was blah and our apple crostata came with no ice cream and was so thick all you tasted was dough. When you're not delicate or rush pastry, it shows. I think the most disappointing part of our meal was having to eat around cigarette smokers on nearby tables (using the restaurant cups for ashtrays). It's gross having someone blow smoke when you're trying to take a bite and I don't know if it was allowed but no staff said anything and they were very aware of it. Judging by the loud EDM music, I think they are trying to cater to a younger, club crowd. Awkward for families and a romantic date.

iQ471Oq1jNipxbnOiBs0kA.text: We had Dan as our waiter and he could not have been more attentive and helpful. He suggested some great meals and our food was amazing. We wanted to go back and eat there a second time but ran out of time. Food is amazing. Make sure to try the pretzels!

r9xSXT4Klzw-wacvS-B4pQ.text: Just another nice restaurants to in the Wynn. Seriously, each restaurant at the Wynn has very similar fare for a very similar price, at least when it comes to lunch, and never does it disappoint. Each meal will run from $15-$25 on average and is very filling. Service is always on point and most places have outdoor seating available, perfect for a spring day.   I had the chicken sandwich with a side of sweet potato waffle fries. The chicken sandwich was exceptionally cooked, perfectly paired with some creamy slaw. The waffle fries were good but not great. I wish the sandwich came with a side instead of having to order the fries a la cartel but it is what it is. I highly recommend the sandwich if you come to Jardin. The salad, especially with added salmon, also looked very good from what I saw at tables around me.   Overall I liked my meal here and would recommend it for atmosphere alone if you get an outdoor seating area. My one huge complaint is the reservation process. I first tried OpenTable and it said they were booked from 10am-2pm. I then called Wynn reservations and same thing. As I showed up at noon, I found that the place was only about a third full. I just don't get how there were no reservations available if it was two thirds open at the restaurant. Jardin needs to fix this issue as I want people to give it a try and not get nervous about having a wait or not getting a table at all.

czsRuhLJJh5LXJ--3bXq3g.text: Ok, even just for the pretzel bread that is served, you should come here. To die for! I could eat it all day!  The yellowtail sashimi appetizer is delicious as well as the avocado salad!  Service is great ...  Moscow mules, made table side and DELICIOUS! Yes please! Would totally come back!

nQ1qwCy8_zRDy8avfP4pDQ.text: This was our last meal in Vegas. We had a 3:00 flight so we hit up Jardin for lunch since it was in our hotel. What attracted us to Jardin was that it was upscale casual with a nice mix of breakfast, brunch, and lunch items. You'll see items such as smoothies, granola bowls, plays on eggs benedict, burgers, salads, etc.   The restaurant has a composed, classy vibe. I didn't see any 25 year old groups downing mimosas, nor did I see many families with kids.   The service was strong and the food was good. Zero drama. Precisely what you want after a night out on a Sunday morning before taking a flight back home to reality. Their burger here leans more to the classic side but is a strong offering. I was very satisfied. The steak served with my wife's steak salad was surprisingly tender and delicious, must have been a prime sirloin or something. Our antioxidant smoothie and coffee drinks were great as suspected.  4.5 stars. Nothing here will blow your socks off but the service and food will meet or slightly exceed your expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino comes with a rock candy stick for adding some nice sweetness
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No foie gras or wagyu patty. Just a very good classic burger.

a_1cVYiA32j5R46SK6tp7g.text: Based on the beautiful setting great fresh food and over all experience Jardin earns five stars although at our particular sitting there was one service faux pas.   We had one prix fixe dinner (sans alcohol) consisting of the tuna tartare appetizer, Branzino roasted fish and dessert tart sampler.  Also we ordered the beet salad and salmon entree.   All dishes were excellent. Each dish had some unique memorable aspect to it, such as a special accompaniment that was not overly showy but brought out the real flavor of the main food.   The tuna tartare (with pieces of pear in it) was a good sized portion and among the best tuna tartares that we've had. The pear really added something.   The beet salad included blue cheese (I'm not a fan - she is) and very delicious shaved radish - nice pairing. The Branzino was flaky and flavorful and paired with shaved fennel which really provided a great side taste to the dish. The salmon was nicely accompanied with shaved and half pieces of carrot.  The salmon was actually on the raw side almost - many would not have cared for its translucent undercooked appearance - but I don't mind salmon that way and its honey glaze somehow made it taste fine and not undercooked.   The pastries included mousse, a very rich chocolate cake, macaroon, and a coconut dipped chocolate ball. (Even liked the macaroon and I don't usually care for macaroons but it had a very good filling.) It was my birthday so they included an edible thin white chocolate Happy BDay and lit candle, and wished me HB! in two different languages. (It wasn't the showy out loud birthday song - just a classy private wish from the server who brought the dessert.)  Service was great - very unobtrusive but one issue was that we ordered a bottle of Pellegrino and a hot jasmine green tea but the water didn't show up until mid way through the salad (and not at all for the appetizer) so we (or more especially I because the tea was hers) were sitting there p-p-parched for a third of the meal reflex grabbing at an empty water glass to the point where I was about to self service a metal pitcher of ice water from the serving station that was behind our table. (By the way our indoor table was phenomenally set right alongside the pool but, looking back I'd have preferred one that wasn't sandwiched between two server stations - you ended up having some server hover behind you at his or her station during much of the meal -reminded me of Sonny Bunz hanging like a vulture around Tommy's neck in Goodfellas.)  Very late on the drinking water aside, the entire experience was very memorable.  All the food was fresh and uniquely tasty.  Would recommend.

xWBWHMmu87HRz-3tPKLN5w.text: Absolutely loved this place. We had Laurie as our server, she is such a sweetheart! Fun atmosphere very chic! The food was great.  I had the lobster Benedict....TO DIE FOR. Smacked me in the face, screaming "where have you beeeeen all my life?" It was super tasty, the lobster was fantastic.  My husband got the chicken omelette, he enjoyed it. Ate every last bit. My mom got the kale scramble and it looked AMAZING. She ate it all, savored every last bite!  My dad got the apple stuffed French toast! He super loved that!!  We got the pecan topped cinnamon roll to start for the whole table it was perfect shareable amount!   My mom got a Bloody Mary and I got the Pink Sangria, then we got a couple more Pink Sangria's....they were DELISH.   We REALLY wanted to get the chocolate mousse in a FLOWER POT. Yes. A FLOWER POT! & it's 100% edible. Every part of it, unfortunately by the end of our breakfast we were far too full to order it. So that will definitely be on the next trip out here for sure.

While our breakfast was a simple one, which included,  yoghurt,granola, fresh berries and the Wynn's amazing fresh strong coffee it was all delicious!  Service this time around was spot on!  Will definitely be back to Jardin our next time around!

F5-YrpYCQMttIljG3axMlQ.text: Had a fantastic lunch at Jardin during my stay in the tower suits. Must say I'll be back and next time it'll be brunch- the lobster eggs Benedict. Thank you Lori for the recommendations, great service, and full bellies.

The lobster benedict was acceptable (not as wonderful as I had imagined) - the sauce was overpowering and drowned the taste of the lobster. My husband said the pancakes were ok.   Service was ok, on the slow side.

2sQghSO4-Ym4un2W_G6L-w.text: My favorite at the Wynn Hotel! The place is very nice, the environment, the food & the service, very good.   Mi favorito en el Wynn Hotel! El lugar es muy lindo, la deco, la comida y servicio, muy buenos.

Hj6TbQq0N8aqMMMifSlBVA.text: Favorite restaurant in the Wynn/Encore resorts. The restaurant has outdoor seating that enables you to overlook the pool as well as internal dining. There is a bar but it doesn't seat more than 5 people it seems so not the place to hang if you're just looking for a drink.   Went twice for breakfast and had a great time every time. The breakfast options are strongest course here. The pancakes in particular were huge. The avocado toast was a popular order among food options as well.   Most dishes for breakfast ran $10-20. They have lighter fare like parfaits and oatmeal if you want something lighter.   Service was excellent each time as well. Many thanks to Dan to taking great care of a weary group of travelers!

mHitebMTrpTdnWNh1EJuvQ.text: Horrible service! Great food! If only our server was more present when we needed something! Seemed as though we always had to track someone down when we needed a refill or a box or the check! We were invited here to review the restaurant as well, and on a service stand point, our server was not excelling. I mean I'm talking about 7 minutes just to be greeted (I timed it)   Enough about the service!! The darn pancakes were so fluffy and dense simultaneously that it caused a reaction in my mouth. That reaction was continuous salivation. So great I'd definitely come back when I'm feeling brunchy!   Omelette was amazing too! Price point is a little pricey but worth it! They make up for it in portion size and taste quality! Not to mention the decor is gorgeous

FGFVha_60kMuP3QUgImGbg.text: Simply put, this place is OUTSTANDING. Reading some of the reviews and seeing how some people only give it 4 stars, and even below that, blows me away in complete shock. Jardin is somewhere where I wish I could dine on a daily basis.   While on vacation in Vegas, I often dine here when I am staying at the Wynn properties hotel. At my most recent stay I came here for breakfast. Didn't order anything complicated, a iced vanilla latte to start. And my breakfast was 3 eggs with potatoes, bacon and some toast on the side. As simple and basic as my meal was, it was absolutely delicious because everything was done so well. Probably the best iced vanilla latte I have ever had. The quality off the eggs were organic and were perfectly cooked sunny side up. The bacon I asked to be cooked crispy, and it was. Hot and crispy which is so rare when you go to so many breakfast places. The potatoes were great too, mixed variety of sweet and regular. And great bread offered with delicious jams and spreads.   The service staff was friendly, the decor is beautiful, and the food is high quality and tastes delicious. What more could you ask for?

qcmjUo05gL813i5PTTi97A.text: Took hubby here for his birthday.  Made a reservation thru Open Table.  Beautiful restaurant with a romantic touch.  Waiter very nice.  Service quick.  Food, outstanding!  Got the quinoa salad which was a large portion for it's price.  Creamed Corn on the side is highly recommended.  YUM!  Passed on dessert, but I hear the flower pot cake is incredible.  Will be back!

JESB10Rsja239KrxNMs2aw.text: Vegan review:  One word: yes.  As a vegan, I thought it would be hard to find food in Vegas. Turns out every Wynn restaurant has a vegan/vegetarian menu which explains why I was at the Wynn almost every day.   Anyways, I had the veggie pizza in the "socializing" part of the menu (fancy way of saying "appetizer" I guess), and my god it was good. The vegan ricotta was very light and fluffy. It didn't really taste like cheese but who am I to say? I haven't had cheese for like 8 years. Toppings were generous and they all paired together nicely. I finished about 34 of it and took the rest back to the hotel to eat later. If you're vegan, I highly recommend the pizza! Even my brother (who is a strict carnivore) enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan pizza with vegan ricotta!

gdqTMPKN7JOnR2gL8i6Z-Q.text: Rick from Jardin absolutely was superior in service and to accommodate any needs.  The atmosphere outside is great and the food was perfect.  Poached eggs cooked soft to order perfectly.  We come to Wynn-Encore for the service and Jardin delivers 5-Star!!  Great job RICK.

WHaSAL_M7IuEh7dcUF2kZw.text: Excellent lunch service today. We had the Buffalo cauliflower and the chicken meatball appetizers. Both tasted very good. I order the French dip sandwich and it was excellent. The bread was very fresh.  Service was prompt and friendly. This is upscale and has a sign for proper attire required and no strollers, so plan accordingly if you are with family.

a9tbljtkpHalCeq1T8DwPA.text: I had the opportunity to enjoy a nice meal at Jardin.  This restaurant had great views of the pool at Encore and has a lot of great ambiance.  I really enjoyed their appetizers and highly recommend the buffalo cauliflower as a healthy and light choice.  It's quite spicy but the cauliflower is cooked perfectly and I could eat a whole plate of it with no guilt.  The meatball appetizer was also high quality.  I enjoyed the "organic" salmon, although it isn't wild caught.  Overall, great service and great food mean a great meal.

xIpuOtBTkHWDNmVGfXWUIA.text: I am not a big breakfast person but we decided to have breakfast there just to try and it was very good. The service was great. The avocado toast was very refreshing. The hash brown was outstanding. The flowers are fresh and the set up is beautiful. If you like to have romantic breakfast in a very nice setting and have a very high quality food prepared to perfection, Jardin will be the place.

PA2DQ7o3L96vjAW0Wbq-Uw.text: The decor of this restaurant is very elegant and chic.  I love the white color scheme and floral accents. came here with a big party who was very fancy so we did everything fancy.  For appetizers we had the meatballs, fried cauliflower, oysters and beef carpaccio. I loved the beef carpaccio. It was delicious and smokey with the cheese on top. I also loved the oysters. They were on the smaller side and it comes with lemon and a garlic olive oil sauce. They were fresh and delicious.   For the entree I got the filet mignon medium rare. I also got a chance to try the ribeye, and sea bass. For the meats you had he option of adding on a side of shrimp scampi or lobster tail. My friend got the lobster but I ate most of it. The lobster with the butter sauce was very good. A little over cooked because the ends were dry and chewy. My filet was perfect. It was a perfect medium rare throughout. It was super lean but very very tender. It was juicy and flavorful. I absolutely loved it. The filet came with broccolini on the side.   Usually the ribeye is my favorite cut of steak because of the marbling but I tried my friends ribeye and I definitely liked my filet better. It was a little chewy I felt that the cut was fatty but the fat wasn't well distributed. It was still good but the filet is better quality.   We didn't get a chance to try dessert because we were so full but I definitely want to try their flower pot chocolate cake. Our bill was extremely hefty for the wine and food. But service was excellent and food was delicious.

The eggs were cooked perfectly and the mimosas were delicious! Overall I had a great brunch experience here & would return. The service was also great, our server was very attentive and brought a cart to our table to serve mimosas in front of you.

yQPOzADAFqanXi-Pxyj1qQ.text: I really enjoy the quiet yet stimulating atmosphere here. It's sophisticated and the spicy Dirty Bloody Mary is really good. It's the spiciest I've ever had. :)

7Zn71Zi2qmEhExdrZdDTaw.text: Beautiful new addition in Encore Hotel. We were here in December 2015 and this place was just under construction. They have outside patio right next to the pool in a gorgeous setting with trees and flowers surrounding the whole area. Came here for Mother's Day lunch. Very good food and nicely presented, could not expect anything less of Encore and Wynn hotels. Love coming here and highly recommend to try all of their restaurants at least once ! Service was a little slow and could have been a little friendlier. Reason for 4 stars.

3pVr1WS5q2D-sHSl1I4U6Q.text: Came here for a friends bachelorette.  I ordered the Salmon with a Ceasar Salad and they were both good. We shared the chocolate cake that looks like a pot of flowers. Everything was edible. It was too pretty to break it apart!  There was a huge floral decor in the center to make the place feel more upscale. The staffs were attentive and friendly. Our server was very patient with handling our large party of 12 and when the food was brought to the table, they knew who ordered what.  I appreciate that the manager  came by our table make sure we were having a great experience at the restaurant.

Y9XzvI6B9bKpFE8iadZnQA.text: Extremely friendly and wonderful staff. The food is excellent and the ambience is very romantic. Top notch place to eat at when in Vegas

qU3NVCEjOu_Gp4Q-3jocAA.text: As a vegetarian, I'm always excited to try places at the Wynn/Encore given their veggie-friendly reputation. I love dining out at restaurants that can offer both a stunning ambience and vegetarian options that branch out beyond pasta dishes (*le sigh*).   Given that, I'm super impressed by Jardin. We came late on a Wednesday night to celebrate a birthday. Our server was incredibly friendly and attentive. He made us smile since he also surprised us with a complimentary flower pot dessert that I still have not stopped showing pictures of to my friends when they ask how the trip was. I can't believe how realistic they can make it look all while ensuring it's completely edible (and delicious, mind you).   As for the actual dishes, we split the buffalo cauliflower (with vegan blue cheese) and I ordered the mushroom steak. I seriously want to travel back to Vegas just to enjoy this entree again. I wasn't in the mood for anything fried, so the chef slightly modified this to err more on the baked side. My boyfriend's hot pot wasn't his favorite, but he still enjoyed it overall. They also deliver complimentary pretzel bread to the table along with homemade mustard spread. I usually can't stand mustard, but appreciated this pairing.   Coming here is a good life choice. You won't regret it as you look out onto the gardens and enjoy the larger-than-life floral centerpiece while enjoying unique cuisine.

ZP5Tv00V0LXL0f4dx3kD8g.text: Went for breakfast... service was very good.  Virginia Ham Benedict was very tasty but wasn't served hot.

2tDiENc4xO0mh13ziyaY0g.text: The atmosphere is relaxing with views of the encore pool. The staff come off slightly uppity but are very knowledgeable. Our service was a bit slow and part of our order was forgotten. Our pretzel bread, appetizers,  drinks and food all arrived slowly for an upscale restaurant.  The tuna tartare was a spiritual experience it was so good! The prime rib and roasted chicken were sublime! The new york strip was sub par. The grilled broccolini on the other hand was tasteful and perfectly seasoned.

5pn-aWHg81QU_BzAT5k1aA.text: Super classy and amazing service from our waitress! The menu and cocktail selection is great with tons of variety to choose from.

BqtdCGBVuqqz3SO_uUlS1Q.text: Reviewing brunch here. Service is super slow, but the taste/quality of the food is actually pretty good, particularly for the strip!   Great for dietary restrictions (vegetarians/vegans). I couldn't eat dairy due to a stomach problem that day, so they quickly made adjustments like replacing the hash browns for roasted potatoes, and butter for vegan butter.   The food: - Chicken omelette with egg whites + avocado: very healthy and not overly oily, great for recovering from a long night. Hefty portion of avocado. Came with perfectly toasty/crispy roasted potatoes that weren't drenched in oil, and your choice of sliced toast.   TLDR: if you've got a minute and want quality brunch, would definitely recommend this joint.

YZTbFWrtOX0rzSVzW2CCVg.text: The prices are high for what you get . They have gluten free options but no menu. Refills on club soda but no waiter in sight to give you one. The meat on the French dip was so small I complained to the waiter. This is Vegas !!! Everything is supposed to be bigger and better! Atmosphere is beautiful  and clean.

zJ20KMt9b6nfaAIbmLbxSA.text: I am completely in love with Jardin at Wynn: Contemporary Garden Decor for leisure and dining pleasures. Meticulous details, but fresh and simple. Bright and airy.   They had a prefix menu to accompany The REVE... However, I didn't like the food choices offered. I could eat on the menu, but I'd go fully vegetarian. So I purchased a show ticket and decided to enjoy quality time over drinks.   Not the worst idea.

0Zl8SFKJNULGJ6Vzlic8Uw.text: Decent food, if not a bit over priced - but that's standard for upscale Vegas hotels.   Main complaint is mediocre service. I can look past the price when it's an enjoyable experience, but our waiter Cipriani ruined my lunch with a bad attitude and snide remarks.   No longer interested in dining here, what a shame.

xx9X8qT3cWNBsB9wdKnOcg.text: Came here for some drinks and appetizers before heading to the Spa. Our waiter, Carlos, was great...very polite and attentive.   What we liked:  Cocktails: bartender made us a mezcal version of one the drinks on the menu...tasted great. Crab cakes  Watermelon quinoa salad  What was just ok:  Tuna tartare: fresh but bland. Maybe a little soy source or the addition of a sweet fruit (i.e. mango, pineapple, etc.) would help  Overall, we enjoyed our experience. Definitely worth a second visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare (right), crab cakes (left)

7Mp8_QCG-RMpoHwbqDQfqA.text: First I would like to address that I am shocked this place has such low ratings. I had a wonderful, perfect, night here for my birthday. The ambience is classy & elegant. The staff was friendly & professional, but still had a pulse (haha), being an upper scale restaurant, minus the white table clothes, which I didn't mind at all.      The round room with gold accents, mirrored pillars, fresh flowers & green plants makes for an extremely elegant and relaxing evening. Simple yet sophisticated... a perfect balance.      The food items ordered were nothing short of fabulous. A fresh Bronzino & a seafood lobster pasta. Let me tell you, I'm not a fan of pasta whatsoever - I never order it, but this pasta had me thinking about it the next day! Perfect preparation & presentation on both entrees.      It being my birthday, I just had to order their signature special dessert, completely edible, flower pot. I have never been defeated by a dessert- that is unable to finish it, this had me waving the white flag and it was DELISH to boot. I can't put into words what a wonderful evening I had here on my birthday- I guess it just translates to wonderful timeless memories made, so thank you for the fabulous birthday evening!

csEplvq1VXqcM33u864jmg.text: If you're eating in the Wynn/Encore area, you could do worse than Jardin. As you can probably guess, you're paying for the view and the surroundings.   With the Vegas qualifier stuff out of the way, I think they do a pretty good job with the menu. Drink selection is solid. I had the seafood pasta, which wasn't close to lining up at my Mt. Rushmore, but was still very enjoyable as a dinner course. Somehow the fries ended up being the food highlight here for me.  Service was friendly. I didn't find any of it to be pretentious. No strollers allowed inside, but you can leave it with them at the front.

Good start to the day give it a try as many options on the menu seemed like a good

oaudo6CaZi8tDROAro7onQ.text: Can't go wrong with any restaurant at Wynn. And Jardin is no disappointment.  The environment is beautiful, typical of the immaculate design at Wynn. Ordered Croque Madam, delish!! The melted gruyere cheese in between two slices of sourdough bread with crispy bacon was so warm and comforting. Probably my favorite.   Got the Hass Avocado Toast, it was a little bland. Asked for hot sauce to give it some flavor. Topped it off with a sticky bun. Talk about fluffy layers of sweet goodness, with the crunch of the walnuts was perfection. Their cappuccino was so delicious that I ordered two.  It is a bit pricey for what you're eating. But worth a try!

Ordered the three way eggs with ham, bacon and avocado was good nothing crazy.   There tuna tarter was amazing.  Mix drinks are very good not on the strong side but very good.   Service is good fast

gv9KFabrZOIhf_Dfh__2lw.text: Always very good service and food. Prices are warm, but look where you are. Not so fancy or pretty as Tableau over on the Wynn side, but less expensive and less shi-shi . . . sometimes you just want a coffee shop and Jardin is a very nice one.

4f3NfmELL5-DGnheGZfIPA.text: Something must happened here in the past year. It is not the amazing place it used to be. Yes, amazing, this is the word. Starting from service, that used to be the most professional I have seen in Vegas, to the food that doesn't taste like it used to. Things are not the same. I wonder what happened.  Errors: cappuccino was served cold. Water and zero coke ordered only got to the table after a long time. Food took forever to get to the table. Avocado toast (used to be one of the best, is now just another dish). No longer my preferred restaurant in Vegas. Hope they will get back to what they used to be.

k2b2a287cZk0ZMtass2QEA.text: Located on the encore side of the resort. It has a delicious assortment of light fare, heavy or even vegetarian. Outdoor seating overlooks one of the many pools located within the hotel.  They also have a nice bar where you could stop by after shopping at Hermes which is right across the hall.

GqHijqKtPdy6qZIf7PNTPg.text: I was incredibly unimpressed with this restaurant. My husband and I stopped in for lunch on a Friday since we were staying at the hotel. We were seated immediately which was nice. The patio is cute. Small with a good view of the pool but shaded well. However, service is lacking. It took forever for our server to greet us, yet she passed us multiple times. When she did greet us she wasn't friendly. She actually seemed really annoyed.   For lunch I ordered the turkey burger with no bun and added bacon and cheese. When it came out they left off the avocado. That wouldn't have been too bad except the turkey burger itself was over seasoned. Too much to the point where it tasted horrible. If I'm paying $15 for a sandwich (without a side) I expect it to taste good. The fries were decent but how can you screw up fries?   Total for a burger, turkey burger and fries our meal was about $40. Not a good price for the quality of food.   Overall not a great restaurant. I would recommend going elsewhere for good service and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger no bun (they forgot the avocado)
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California burger

qMUzbaz5187dwg4V0patYQ.text: My spouse and I visited Jardin only to try the famous edible flower pot. But we loved the ambience so much, we decided on having a light lunch and savor the flower pot later.  We were seated outside, it was a hot day. Absolutely enjoyed the view while our order was served. We ordered the impossible burger - vegetarian, no meat. The burger WOWd us! The patty tasted so meaty, it actually felt like eating meeting. I loved the concept of fried onions versus fresh onions. Added a nice crunch. What I really liked was the lettuce and tomato served on the side giving me an option to add as much or as little as needed. Fries were good, no additional comments. I ordered Earl Grey tea, I must say the best tea I had with the right flavors. The highlight, of course left for the last was the showstopper of Jardin - the edible flower cake. The presentation- impeccable, flawless. You actually feel its a flower pot. The taste - we were in heaven!!!! Fresh cool chocolate mousse blending with raspberry and the chocolate crunch of the pot in between bites. I must say - the BEST! At no point did I feel it had too much butter or too much sugar - just the right touch. I am so in love - must have...!!  P.S : advisable to reserve in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flower cake
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flower cake
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Impossible burger with fries

u7xAAdTIGDOYw8mr1lxFSg.text: Solid dinner spot. I enjoyed all the food we tried. We came here on a Friday around 8 pm and it was relatively empty but had a great time. It picked up as we were leaving. I heard their brunch is awesome too. We wanted outdoor seating and although it was cold, they put two heaters as close to the table as they could get them and gave me a shawl. We had nice views of the Encore pool and pretty soon I was nice and toasty.   Some items were pretty simple but pricey like spaghetti and sauce but I ate the leftovers cold the next day after the gym and it tasted good so that's my criteria for thinking the food is of good quality.    We got a bottle of prosecco, roasted tomato soup with croutons, cauliflower mac and cheese, and spaghetti. The spaghetti came with garlic bread and salad. The cauliflower mac and cheese was good and the tomato soup was yummy and comforting. Was it the best I've ever had? No but it still made for an enjoyable evening. We couldn't finish our bottle of prosecco so we were able to bring the remaining glasses back to our room. Service was great and we were happy.   Food isn't as pricey as I expected it to be for a Wynn restaurant. I was happy.

Gf5KFawhlQikUvvkHCM08w.text: This is a solid place for a light lunch/ snack when you're between the casino and the shops and you need a break. We stopped in when we arrived for a healthy start to the trip and it was a great choice! I had a great cocktail, I can't remember the name but it had a lavender sugar rim and it was beautiful.   We were seated outside with a nice view of the little pool but there were two birds that were annoying AF and bothered me the entire time. (SIDE NOTE: I'm extremely afraid of birds) I asked them to try to shoo them away and they acted like it wasn't a big deal but they weren't little birds they were gigantic frickin pigeons. I wanted to be re-sat inside but they didn't have anymore availability. It was low key stressful and the reason why they are getting 4 stars.  My mom and I shared the buffalo cauliflower and the avocado quinoa salad. Excellent choices! Honestly, I order a lot of buffalo cauliflower and this was hands down the best I ever had. The avocado quinoa salad was really fresh and delicious, I really enjoyed it and it was a great healthy way to start off Vegas.   Food was really good, atmosphere with the birds not so much.
