KcHALSNAc2nDopzQtxtm4g.text: It's a nice & beautiful restaurant that is closed to the poolside with a outdoor patio that is beautiful in the morning breakfast .  We had breakfast here while we stay at encore suites and it was okay.  The prices is topical hotels restaurants high but it's the ambiance that you pay for.  Overall, the  staffs are very friendly & attentive.  The food quality was just okay!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor area

Hf2ysBTm7BSaCgTdt6fU-w.text: We went to have a family brunch with a friend of ours. I'd like to start out by saying the menu is what caught our attention and we wanted to try something new so we decided to have Sunday brunch. I will say the food was good Three of us had steak and eggs I had and I had the salmon appetizer which was not exceptional but good. Service is very slow our daughters burger was overcooked and we had to wait a solid 15 minutes till we got somebody to come around to give us water so that we could tell them the burger was overcooked but at that point most of us were already Finished with our food and she didn't want anything else. So they took the burger off of the bill but she ended up not eating.  My wife ordered an orange juice and didn't get it till halfway through the meal and we had to wait 15 to 20 minutes for our check and we didn't even find our server we had to call somebody else over to ask them to get our check for us and then we waited another 10 minutes and had to end up giving our credit card and check to yet another server because our server wasn't around.  We most likely will not visit again but like I said the food is decent.

bPBwnXWrRsaIS9VSbEa7mg.text: A class act! We luckily had a quiet night and plenty of attention by our waiter. I ordered fish which didn't have a bone in it, potatoes, and a little veggie. All very tasty. The table also ordered salmon and the seafood pasta all received a positive response. We had to try the fleur dessert which says it serves 2-3 but more like 4-5. Not only was it beautiful but it tasted delicious! The prices were reasonable and the view of the pool is beautiful. Check it out!

Cif3oXxmFPYXeE7yf7_sZg.text: *The missing star is for the endless spaghetti.   Everything else was great. We had Buffalo Cauliflower and Corn Chowder Soup as appetizers, delicious. I ordered the French dip sandwich, was really good. Everything was 5 stars until My husband and I tried the endless spaghetti, was a horrible mistake. Just not good and not at the place's level. Presentation was the only good thing about it.  I'm definitely coming back, but now I know what not to order

EF72LiOsU-IZYzRaH5iARw.text: The venue itself is absolutely stunning. The service is definitely up to par. The food had certain seasoning that threw the dishes off, for me at least. Other than that, I would definitely recommend sitting outside for breakfast or lunch.

MApaQ-GTZLleYdTUZbQy7Q.text: Finally tried Jardin at the Encore and we cannot wait to go back next year.  Since I am a pescatarian, breakfasts while on vacation can be lackluster and tend to be either a bagel with lox or eggs and toast.  At Jardin, we ordered the Maine Lobster Benedict and the Kale Scramble.  The Main Lobster Benedict was near perfection and just melted in my mouth. Highly recommended.  My husband enjoyed his Kale Scramble and it was flavorful and satisfying. I fully appreciate the restaurants at Wynn/Encore offering quite a few options for non-meat eaters.

XN71MgNwkwvcnBOJppvFzg.text: Came here twice for breakfast and really enjoyed it ! Food was really good. I ordered the pancakes for my son and I stole a few bites and they were soooo good !! One morning I ordered chicken avocado omelet. Mehhh. It was okay. The potatoes were good and bacon was cooked perfectly ! The second time for breakfast I ordered a different omelet - I think like veggie or ham/onion/cheese and thought it was much better.  Oj was freshly squeezed and delicious. Also had an iced coffee/latte and was pretty good too.   Service was good and the place was clean. They had crayons and a kids menu to keep my son entertained for a little bit and provided plastic ware for my son to use as well which was nice and thoughtful. Would recommend coming back here !

JITJPF5j16qGcPqXwCgG6Q.text: Just came here for thanksgiving and it also my birthday. We had a reservation and at first we were seated outside, it's quite cold and the heater were " out of propane" when we first asked to move inside they refused and said there were not tables available. After complaining again one of the other waiters outside took it upon himself to find us a table inside and make sure we were settled, big thank you to him(sorry I don't remember your name). After dinner my girlfriend told them it was my birthday and asked them to bring out something special and they brought out the same dessert that was free as part of our prefix with a candle. When my girlfriend asked for another one they charged it to the bill at $20. I think a free dessert is the least a restaurant can give on a $150 check for someones birthday.

LP2IBOSSRJmWemVaDYYKKw.text: I came here for lunch and drinks with my Mom during our stay at the Wynn. I had the grilled cheese with tomato soup, which was to die for!! I'm drooling thinking about it right now. The tomato soup was creamy and thick, tangy and delicious. The grilled cheese was done on sourdough. The cheese was perfectly melted and the bread nicely browned. So good.   The drinks were top notch. I had the Vanilla Rose cocktail first. It was nicely presented with a flower, and was the perfect balance of sweet and sour. I also had the red sangria, which was huge (like the size of my head) and pretty boozy. I was into it.   The restaurant is bright and beautiful too. The one thing I would note is the service isn't great. Our server was busy talking to other servers, and was pretty slow. It wasn't so bad that it ruined the lunch, but could definitely use some improvement.

UJwRD0p3uM3wOv2fwyxe2Q.text: When looking at The Wynn's restaurant offerings, Jardin looked SO up my alley. From their al fresco patio, beautiful decor usage of fresh flowers and healthy food options I was immediately sold.  Unfortunately my experience did not live up to the expectation. Unlike other Wynn restaurants the service was erratic -- we had to wait almost fifteen minutes to be greeted by a server and our orders came out incorrectly and with odd timing. A point for enthusiasm, however.  I got the Lobster Benedict which sounded impressive but in reality was not. The dish came out mostly cold and inconsistently cooked and the hash browns were hard as a rock. Due to myself being starving, I ate it anyways but I decided not to return during my week stay at the Wynn. There are many better options within walking distance!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Benedict

bNIRk43CwXvVg8YxB51dJA.text: DISCLAIMER: If you're planning a bachelorette, the Wynn sets up awesome packages for you and your girlfriends. Jardin was one of the restaurant options that we chose so we dined here on a pre-fixe menu.  The restaurant is decorated with gorgeous fresh flowers (one of the things that the Wynn is known for) and the ambiance is intimate. There wasn't anything really to rave about the food except for yellow tartare, avocado salad and the pretzel sticks (all appetizers). I also liked the flower pot chocolate dessert that actually looked like a flower pot! We enjoyed the Moscow Mule cart a little bit too much, and they happily provided us to go cups for the excess cocktails we weren't able to finish at the table.  The service was friendly and attentive during our experience here. They were accommodating to our requests (to go cups, to go boxes, more napkins, etc.) and they didn't have any issues with how we wanted to share our entrees family style.  I would give give Jardin another chance and try their regular menu the next time I stay at the Wynn.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hBJJmzTTUB3nbXcTuV0Pqw.text: This was the first time at the Wynn where I didn't go to their outstanding, heavenly buffet. I def should have gone though because Jardin unfortunately did not hit the spot. First of all, it is one of the more 'casual' restaurants. Every restaurant in the Wynn and Encore is pretty classy, so be prepared for the higher prices that go along with the amazing decor and service.  The food here was creative, but the flavors were off-balance. The fried chicken and waffle was overly breaded and under-seasoned. I wanted to ask for cholula, but stopped myself since it was a $20 dish! The eggs benedict was on par with any other brunch restaurant. Their coffee tasted burned. They forgot our fries and our server had way too many tables. To be fair, it was super busy with long lines at the front all morning.  Sadly, I still haven't found a go-to breakfast/brunch spot in Las Vegas. Bouchon was also underwhelming, so maybe I should just stick to the Peppermill? That place is consistently good breakfast at all hours. Next time i'll pass on Jardin and prob do the Wynn buffet.

YJBkDW80-A0nHt5o0cfg_Q.text: I can't believe it. My experience here was so delightful I stopped caring who was president. That's pretty damn good. Joe the Chef is such a good guy I told my wife to leave me for him because I mean come one, what a nice guy. qJvjgNOsopE7yGCdru_kIA.text: Service was great. Food was delicious...  friend had the pancakes and I has the French Toast with blackberry compote yummmmmm can't wait for tomorrow morning. The country sausage was not good but the ft made up for it.

fVJ9M_Ij0XxUoAclN6__Ig.text: My husband and I stayed at the Wynn for a business conference, our daughter and her significant other joined us in Vegas while there. Wanted to treat them to a really nice family dinner. While the Wynn is one of the most Beautiful places we've stayed- they need to look into staff training in this particular restaurant! The food is fantastic! Can't say enough about the good menu choices and execution- but the service is terrible! Huge downside!  Our server was friendly, but She was really bad at timing and attention. Ordered drinks and salad first, after a really long wait! We were done with our salads before our drinks ever came! She didn't ever come to check whether we wanted another throughout dinner, which we did. Again- the food is great! And the chefs are doing a great job! But in a resort of this price level we expected better service.  The steaks were very good- but don't expect your water glass to be refilled, or To  be able to order anything else from the bar!

i468Q4rOIpZosjEF3yf-jA.text: Another great breakfast. No wait for a table. Service was super fast and my waitress,Veronique was very nice. Even inquired as to if the glassware was available in the home store and she found the website of the distributor for me. Had the Lobster Benedict which comes with a very generous portion of lobster. This is quickly becoming a go to breakfast place on each trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KGoXeNO2sf-mSYyq6y6RBQ.text: If you want a less than stellar meal, a poolside hotel restaurant offers pretty good odds.  Jardin strives to beat those odds but, like most of the players in the casino, it falls short.    First, the good.  The space is quite lovely, with a tasteful floral motif.  We sat on the patio, and the heaters kept us comfy, even on a cool January day in Vegas.  The patio was even far enough from the pool to keep you from getting drenched by overly enthusiastic kids doing cannonballs.  But that's where the really good part ends.  My wife and I both ordered Eggs Benedict, and we agreed that we have had much better.  The eggs were perfectly cooked, but the hollandaise was skimpy and the English muffins were dry and a bit hard.  The hash browns were definitely second rate - sort of a brick of (riced?) potatoes that elevated creativity over flavor.  And by "creativity," I mean I have never seen anything quite like it.  Also, while $20 is not totally outrageous for Eggs Benedict (especially at the Wynn/Encore), for that price couldn't they have put a little slice of orange or sprig of parsley on the plate to dress it up a bit?  It all seemed kind of sparse.  Our friends both ordered omelets.  I didn't see them projectile spitting their meal across the patio, but they weren't exactly raving about the dish either.  And both of them left their "hash browns" untouched.    Since this was to be my only meal for the day, I also ordered a bowl of the roasted tomato soup (my attempt to convert breakfast into brunch), which was just fine.  Good tomato flavor, and a touch of tasty garnish.  Our server was very pleasant, when she was visible.  Which was not often.  It took much too long from seating to taking our order, and from clearing the table to bringing the check.  Fortunately, our friends are exceptional conversationalists.  But as it turns out, the fact that they were staying at the Wynn was the only reason to eat at Jardin.  No, I didn't try the buttermilk chicken sandwich, or some of the other dishes that get good reviews here.  But if you want a better Eggs Benedict, go off-Strip to Hash House A-Go-Go, or Black Bear Diner, or really just about anywhere.

4GGNqjvbqfXZcRVix7HbDw.text: This message is directed solely to the management of this restaurant.  Please do not change anything about this place. The food, the wait staff, the ambience, the decor all of which were top notch. My husband and I walked into the Wynn and were directed by their employees to check this place out if we wanted a delicious meal. When we walked in I was totally blown away by their overly dramatic floral arrangement in the center of their restaurant. It was so beautiful it took my breath away. We were seated at a beautiful table and our waitress did not rush us one bit or get frustrated at my indecisiveness. I ended up getting their Crispy Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich, and im so glad I did. My meal definitely did not disappoint. I especially love how they did not give me a huge portion and a big enough sandwhich that filled me up. Unfortunately, the portion size was just enough to leave satisfied but I didn't have any room for what looked like an amazing dessert. I can't really remember what my husband got but I do know we both cleaned out plates. They are a bit on the pricy side but we didn't mind as we definitely got more than what we paid for. Long story short, this place is a must visit if you are ever in the Wynn.

d98vlnv9alVckvo7qNKUHw.text: I am usually not a big breakfast person but I LOVE enjoying brunch on weekends. I had an amazing experience at Jardin this past weekend. Rick was our server, he was so kind, attentive, and made sure our dining experience was perfect. I highly recommend their vanilla latte, and omelette. I would definitely dine here next time I am in Vegas.

The food was tasty and portions were worth the price, tasted excellent but again, the server was such a witch. Everything I asked was answered with the most pissy, duh idiot, type of response. It was shocking, but of course when it was time for the bill she was just the most helpful sweetest little thing. No thanks chick, your tip is based off your entire demeanor, not the last 3 minutes before I judge your tip. Which is a shame because I always tip above average and she could have had that if she would have kept her snotty responses under control. I'd come back only because I really enjoyed the environment but the servers and hostess need to be replaced ASAP.

But some how you have to wait 15-30 min before they will have your table ready. Food is average. Lobster Benedict and Burgers are good. Drinks are  way expensive, but good presentation when you order Bloody Mary. Service is really slow and frustrating . If you in rush to explore Vegas, don't go this place.

ENMYJ6cz6poqlpyl6GSt2A.text: Good steak. Ran of wagu steak on Tuesday  nite.  Came medium when ordered medium rare. Decent , but 3 stars at most.

K7PZIAPNv3Dil2M_jo4LAg.text: I wanted to try Jardin for dinner, but ended up checking it out for brunch. It is located in the Wynn, with inside and outside dining available. It has a bright French look to it. The restaurant is filled with beautiful flower arrangements that add a lot of charm to the ambiance. The menu featured items such as Nutella French toast, Kale scrambles and a variety of eggs Benedict dishes. I really loved that they had smoothies and fresh juices on the menu. I ordered the Strawberry vanilla and the Antioxidant smoothie. I loved the Strawberry vanilla, but didn't care for the Antioxidant smoothie as much. I sat outside which had a garden feel that overlooked the pool. I ordered the Lobster Benedict. The presentation was beautiful, and the meal was decent. It came with a perfectly formed hash brown  right in the middle. I wouldn't say I was blown away by the meal, but I would definitely visit the restaurant again. The service was friendly, the restaurant was beautiful, and the menu was diverse. Perhaps I will try it for dinner next time around.

SE-XTgzJOSdlN68-NwkFpA.text: A bit of a cluster getting our table but overall, good food and service. Pretty restaurant. Music on the loud side making it a little difficult to hear. Not sure why it was so loud as the restaurant was not busy when we sat down at 7:00.

JCobMHPmT_aED8nYq8TdtA.text: Let me first state the positive about this lovely restaurant. The setting is beautiful. We were seated in the outdoor dining area and everything was lovely. The problem, however, is with the service. I appreciate that it was slow at 8 o'clock on a Friday morning. However it initially took some time for a server to greet us, maybe because we were seated outdoors. Once we were seated we ordered our breakfast. My husband ordered the steak and eggs and I ordered the salmon and capers with the bagel. The food was amazing. The salmon plate was delicious. The salmon tasted fresh and the accompaniment of the cucumber and tomatoes were wonderful. However, if The food hadn't been good there was no one around to tell. The servers were MIA for most of our breakfast. When I got up to find someone to give me a coffee cup , the manager was standing in the middle of the room on his cell phone texting. I literally stood in front of him and cleared my throat so he would stop texting and look up and talk to me. Now I can see if I was at Denny's, but this is in the middle of the Encore and I expected better service. When I told him I was looking for my server he told me that he sent her home because it was slow. That's great, but I still needed a coffee refill and some cream cheese. I hope this was a one time thing and I would be willing to give Jardin's another chance to impress me with their service like I was with the food.

kd1tEJ0L-Vycq8Tzqm_kMw.text: Really beautiful atmosphere and absolutely delicious food. Great staff and they are very sensitive to food allergies with lots of options for varying food intolerances. As a person with a serious dairy allergy it was awesome because there were a ton of choices and I wasn't made to feel like a burden because of it. Highly recommend!

4jGgHLRhQDL7I7FmAqV1RA.text: Staying at the Encore and wanting to eat "in house" I spent some time looking over the reviews of my different options.  Jardin, overall, had good reviews, though there seemed to be a common thread of inattentive and slow service by wait staff.  I would be dining alone and had nothing else to do, so if dinner took too long, it wasn't going to effect me negatively.  I was greeted at the entrance by two smiling, pleasant hostesses and could be seated immediately: on the patio or inside.  After inquiring about the temperature out on the patio, and being assured it was comfortable and there were heat lamps, I chose to sit there.  It was breezy, and cool and I didn't feel much heat from the nearest heat lamp; glad I was wearing a long-sleeved blouse!    (The occasional waft of cigarette smoke from another patron or two seated on the patio was unpleasant, but not overwhelming.  The tables ARE close together and since I was dining alone, I could, without straining, overhear the conversations at the tables to my left and right--but had I been engaged in a conversation at my own table, those conversations probably wouldn't have even registered with me.  And being off-season, there wasn't any noise from the adjacent pool.)  As I was seated, the hostess gave me a drink menu which contained a respectable number of offerings.  (One of the couples eventually seated next to me weren't given a wine menu, the hostesses had evidently not retrieved them from the wait staff; their waiter brought them one upon request.) After asking a couple of questions of the waiter (he was knowledgeable of the cocktails) and asking for his recommendation, I settled for a spritzer (absolutely delicious) and some water (no ice, please).  I also ordered a bowl of chicken noodle soup, the kale salad, and a side of the Brussels sprouts.  Within minutes of placing my order, my soup was delivered (hot, not scalding, so it could be enjoyed right away; hearty; tender cubes of chicken with a heaping serving of noodles).  While enjoying the soup (and consequently being warmed from the inside out), the "bread basket" arrived: warm, soft, chewy, pretzel sticks with a side of horseradish whipped butter (or was it aioli)--I am NO FAN of horseradish, but this was outstanding.  There was a bit of time before my salad and Brussels sprouts were delivered, so I requested some hot water with a side of lemon; promptly delivered.  The kale salad was good, though maybe a few more croutons than I would have liked, but balanced flavors and very filling.  The Brussels sprouts were superb and served hot in a miniature cast iron skillet.  With the little room I had remaining in my stomach, I chose to have dessert: layered cheesecake with dark chocolate cake.  This was the most disappointing item I put in my mouth all evening...but it was still good.  The cheesecake was creamy and delicious, but parts of the cake layer were too gummy/springy for my liking. By now I was full to nearly bursting and left half of it on my plate.  As I was leaving the restaurant I stopped to use the restroom: small (2 stalls and only 1 sink), but very clean.  Both my waiter, Dan, and "busboy", Cris, were attentive, courteous, kind, helpful, prompt.  Their service of my table and the tables next to me was excellent and helped turn what could have been a lonely dinner into a lovely dinner!

ytL5JAxmSBdVWRd_78C4EA.text: Had a lovely breakfast on the patio this morning. It was so hot out but beautiful all the same. I believe my waiter's name was Carlos,and he was wonderful!! His service and attention to my needs was unprecedented. Food was delicious. Coffee was the weak spot for me,but I like STRONG coffee. Please know that pancakes are huge and very thick. I had a single grain pancake with bananas,blueberries and granola /nuts on top. So good didn't need either syrup or butter. Thanks for the experience and we certainly return next trip.

nWAIDMdDfTDdeV063Q9yZQ.text: A True find. Remarkably attentive and knowledgeable waitstaff. They seem to know everyting on the menu including the wines. Mary's chicken was a tasty and reasonable. Served with brussel sprouts and mashed potatoea-- comfort food! Not overpriced like the other Wynn restaurants.

O7GwPn5_ZvrUahYoN7FahQ.text: I had a lovely dining experience here! I was able to be seated right away without a reservation, the host and servers were all delightful and the food was excellent. I will definitely be back the next time I'm at Wynn!

R3N11NDpRIdphUL4MgMcTA.text: I went with 2 friends and it was a nightmare for his type of restaurant : service too low, wine and water was not served after he first glass, the dessert was a pudding on the menu but in real it was a strange cream....  I don't recommend this place sorry for the price it's too expensive for this bad service.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pg8zT9MwuaIW433jAweJiQ.text: Started out with the Orange Lavender Mule-So Good!!! I ordered off their Prefix Menu-Kale Salad-Very Yummy, Salmon Dish for entree-ate all but one bite! They paired a Pinot Noir with the Salmon-perfect!!! I ate at bar had great service!  Highly recommend!!!

t4WPFgNZ7QEg6rMbd-uA-Q.text: The Margherita Pizza is outta the mind delicious! Crunchy cheesy slices that melt... Recommended by the restaurant and they were right! The latte was also nice with raw sugar stick! Service was nice too - great view of the pool and the garden!   Oh and watch out for the birds that might land in your table :-)

0ejtSRSdqheDH3E2ovhjCw.text: I gave a 2 mainly because they are such assholes here in the front.  We moved our Xmas family dinner from 6:00  to 4:00 so we could have an earlier dinner and watch the football game.  When we arrived at 4 we were given a limited menu and told that we could not have a steak or the prime rib Xmas special but only a limited lunch menu.  They said we would have to come back in an hour if we wanted dinner (after we already had drinks and tried to order). We were annoyed but agreed to do that so we could have a real dinner.  We went to the front to insure we could have a table in an hour and we were told they were fully booked and we would not be able to get a table tonight.  Such BS and what a poor way to treat guests of Encore who stay here every year.  We were told they were booked solid the rest of the night, you would think if someone was calling to change their dinner reservation up they would tell you you can't have dinner at that time slot.   The girl at the front was extremely rude.  Well we decided to stay and sit for an hour and stair at each other since it was impossible to get a reservation anywhere in Xmas day.   The dinner was outstanding, pricey but you get what you pay for.  The prime rib was cooked perfectly, the mashed potatoes that accompanied them were superb as well.   The lobster pasta was decadent and the truffle pizza appetizer with the poached egg was to die for.  Our server Roger was outstanding as well.  However because of the rude service and seemingly unorganized front end we will probably never dine here again.  Additionally the tables around us were never seated and for the most part the restaurant was less then half the entire time we were there.  They could have sat us an hour later with no problem.  Shame on you Steve Wynn and Jardin.  Last time we will ever go in there.

vNjtzYulbVou25e5pDH8HQ.text: Super good service.  Fresh salad.  Broccolini was cooked perfectly.  I ordered iced tea and they had simple syrup.

EkW6mx5L8O8rvlyE2vlJxg.text: Very nice place.  But. But but. The service was horrible today.   Slow with the drinks. 20 minutes to get a glass of wine.  20 minutes to get a salad.  Empty water glasses.   Maybe it was our server but not a good day.   Not on my list to try again.

Q6eDO_0weKq-lXLZmvq-Cw.text: We were staying at Wynn and decided to go here for breakfast on our last day. We sat outside in the "shade" (they do ask if you want to sit in the shade or the sun). The sitting area is right in front of the pool of the Encore. It was nice day with a refreshing breeze, perfect for brunch! We got the chicken omelette and wheat pancakes. The omelette was great, but the pancakes were not very fluffy and were somewhat underwhelming. We got two coffees since there were a lot of good reviews about coffee at this place, but the coffee was nothing extraordinary in my opinion (it was good, but not worth all the great reviews I had seen!). We asked to get to go cups for coffee, which they were happy to provide. Overall, if you have a choice between Jardin and Terrace Pointe Cafe, I highly recommend the latter. It is about the same price, but Terrace Pointe Cafe has better food and the same great view.

mkVu9wGOxSueB7A4nPiQ8g.text: My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant in the Encore hotel. We were going to the hotels checking out all of the Christmas decorations and while walking around we saw this restaurant. The ambience is romantic, you can dine inside or outside.   The hostess greeted us with a warm, friendly smile; we did not have a reservation but we were able to get seated.   Our waitress, Amira was very friendly, her customer service was excellent. I asked her a few questions about the menu and she was knowledgeable about each dish and recommended the Branzino. It was very delicate and flavorful, I enjoyed it so much. I also ordered a side of the Brussel sprouts which were amazing (also recommended by Amira). My husband ordered the salmon and that was cooked to perfection, he ordered from the prix fixed menu.   Overall, we had an excellent dinner and superb service, to top it off the manager stopped by our table to speak with us and inquired about our meal and we talked about the flower decorations in the restaurant and he recommended us to see the decorations at the Wynn hotel. Beautiful evening!!

Row-w9dHmUPOC9Ifp1SPMQ.text: From a Celiac:  ** I never like to complain about service, but since this was so horrific- at a STEVE WYNN property, AND the food was bad, I have to mention it.  I was SO excited about trying this place because of reading the great story in the Wynn magazine about the new chef bringing fresh new flavors. We had always joked about the previous restaurant- Boterrible. It was Boterro, but we had to rename it because the food was so bad. The new renovation is beautiful, with fresh flowers, lighter colors, same amazing location. That is the extent of the redeeming qualities.  The Menu: Wynn restaurant pretty much all have allergen menus. Not this place. In fact, our stupid waitress didn't even know what gluten was. (I should've gotten up and left, since I was still recovering from unknowingly being served gluten at Allegro two weeks ago) I digress...  Wine: Wine? Where... where is it? Oh, the server took a lap around the property and 30 minutes later she brought the bottle. Didn't know how to open it. Then never poured one more drop for the whole meal. This is one of my boyfriends biggest pet peeves. He wants the server to pour the wine.   Appetizers: After asking a few questions, having the dumb server return from the kitchen a few times and  STILL not knowing what she was doing, we finally got appetizers, cold and wrong, but at least the boyfriend got some bread, with no butter, to eat with his self poured wine.   There was literally not one dish on the menu that looked appetizing to either of us. I just ordered sides- gross. Boyfriend orders a steak, which was not cooked correctly.   Dessert: Really bland, had no distinguishable flavors. Server leaves for the night.  Waiting......  Waiting.....  Last ones in the restaurant. We didn't mind because we both enjoy each others company, so we were in no hurry. Manager comes over and firmly tells us that we need to leave because the restaurant is closed. I interrupt and couldn't help but snapping at her that we hadn't even received a bill yet. It wasn't even that late, yet the manager chose to be SO unprofessional to ask us to leave. And we hadn't even been given a bill yet. I was FUROUS by this point. I try not to get mad at dinner, but all combined with this rudeness was inexcusable. All the servers and managers were dumb, lazy, ignorant of the menu, didn't know what gluten was, couldn't open a wine bottle, didn't know how to pour a wine bottle. When 2 people spend $500 on a meal and then have to complain about service, that is a MAJOR problem.   Boyfriend and I come to Vegas often and going to awesome dinners is the highlight. He let me choose this place because I'd been going on and on about it for weeks, wanting to try it. Not only do I not want him to have a bad time at dinner, I want him to keep letting me pick new restaurants! This was a major blemish on my restaurant selection track record.   Other reviews on Open Table also talked mainly about poor service. Didn't really see it here on Yelp though.  We stay at Encore sometimes 2-3 times a month. It's nice to eat at the property sometimes, but I will never go back to this disaster. Not even to order a to-go order to eat at the pool.

2wAPzeiYgnPotYeRR1pXTg.text: Food was mediocre at best. Bland, flavorless, and far from creative menu offerings. The restaurant was slow (maybe two other tables dining during our visit), but our food still took forever to come out. The pictures of the restaurant make this place an easy recommendation as a VIP Concierge Specialist, but now I'm embarrassed to know I've been prematurely suggesting this place. *special note: all of the pictures of the menu items on Yelp are NOT offered at the restaurant* Three of our orders were sent back. One of which came with a side of salad as part of the meal. The spaghetti was taken back, but they still made it a point to separate and charge for the little bit of salad that was eaten (tacky, but whatever). Apparently it's not customary for the manager to touch tables with guests who've been inconvenienced, even though he was present, available, and made it a point to converse with the other diners. Three people in our group ended up foodless, and we couldn't get so much as a "thank you, have a good evening" on the way out. Just stares and scowls as if WE did something to them. I'm so disappointed.

iCeyYhX6zmWC6gmL3v9UpQ.text: Okay first of all. We waited 45 minutes for our food to come out. Unacceptable. Especially on a slow night on a Wednesday. I have been to several of Wynn restaurants and this by far is the worst.I came with a group for a birthday and 3 of the plates that came out were cold,undercooked, and tasted horrid according to my colleagues. I have never been more embarrassed to dine at a so called 5 star venue.   I am a concierge and I typically enjoy trying places I've never been that way I can be excited when I tell my guest about it. I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS PLACE IF IT WERE THE LAST OPTION ON EARTH.   General manager didn't even have the decency to check on the table knowing that we sent food back which to me is unacceptable.

6fy2NEtWCYPF3xIMVKShYQ.text: First time here and I can certainly understand the popularity.  Everything is done perfectly.  The service was amazing.  The food is tasteful and gorgeous.  They use really fresh good quality olive oil too, but nothing is greasy.   This is a really refreshing brunch choice.

ZAmLREamU34cu13T2xhJ_w.text: Saw the reviews and went for this but the food is not the best. We order sangria and in the menu had fresh fruit but when we got it, it was just wonderful nothing on it. It wasn't good. The margarita pizza didn't have any tomatoes or spinach, it was a cheese pizza. Also the soup was bad. In general this restaurant it's not worth trying based on the price and location. The food is really bad!

JU1qY5HE9PtlbhwgehU97Q.text: Watch the up-selling by the waitstaff. A $25 meal soon turns into an unexpected $50 one.

tl7aXl8S74SxOnP5UPl2dg.text: Amazing menu that rotates seasonally. Had the lobster roll which is a favorite of mine and my wife's. The fried chicken sandwich is really good. If you're wanting a pizza the Truffle mushroom pizza was outstanding. The blood Mary selections are very impressive. The espresso martini isn't on the menu but is really great drink.

tpgvwqKftcs41kmm52GJcw.text: 5 stars-- As good as it gets!!! If you're dining in Las Vegas, you would be absolutely amiss to skip on experiencing Jardin at the Wynn/Encore. Experience it you must!  My Love and I have been here twice in the past month for the fine cuisine and expertise of Jardin Executive Chef Joe Zanelli. We are quite the foodies and tend to be particular about dining out (especially on the Las Vegas Strip.) These two experiences at Jardin were THE.BEST.FINE.DINING.EXPERIENCE. OF. OUR. LIVES. Truly, truly, truly.   Let me tell you more...  We were greeted at the restaurant entrance by name, which was a 5-star touch on it's own.  The food. I don't even have enough time to write about the spectacular array we feasted upon. Just try what speaks to your appetite! For dessert, you cannot skip that pot of chocolate cake; it's culinary divinity.    The service is next-level. If you want the best of the best, you must DEMAND Chuck be your server. Chuck at Jardin is the epitome of fine dining service and boy, does he set the bar high. Ask for him specifically and you'll see what I mean. The rest of the wait staff attended to our table like a well-orchestrated symphony.   The atmosphere is ideal for fine dining. The sound level is perfection; I loved that I couldn't hear anyone else's conversation. Jardin (translated to garden) is beautifully garden-themed, from a giant floral centerpiece in the dining room, to edible flower garnishes in the cocktails, to an edible flower pot dessert (again, a MUST-TRY) and the luxe flower garden and pool in the outside courtyard.   If you have an appreciation for all the aforementioned, definitely experience the gastro magic at Jardin.

They stuck us outside and I'm just bitter . It's rude I'm hot and their service blows

58t0OureuNcaZHtA3VGpHQ.text: We were back in for brunch we asked to sit with Lori but her section was full. The food was a big disappointment on this time. Cold eggs Benedict, an overcooked cheese burger and a bland fried chicken sandwich which was missing the sauce! The attention to detail was absent this day.  We expect better quality for the price.

-UOspLV7CRKD-ng2e72iXw.text: One of the only open restaurants all day in the resort so it gets busy!   Menu is limited with salads that don't have much substance. My cheeseburger was meh but I thoroughly enjoyed my fries and their pretzel bread. My fiance loved the ahi tuna that came with his salad but I thought it was over cooked for something seared. The tiny tuna tartare was nice but almost a joke sized portion. Even those at the table next to us commented that it looked like someone had already eaten from it.   Quality is good, outdoor seating is nice- but the long wait times and limited menu are why I gave them a 3.

uhwWocan6TvQ_ExyungQcA.text: This is a very underrated Las Vegas spot.  There are plenty of great restaurants in Las Vegas.  Then, there are lousy restaurants with some celebrity chef's name attached to it--if you can trade on your name, why not throw your hat in? Then there are the outposts of New York restaurants, which are plenty good, but same.  Finally, there are restaurants that are neither, but have great food in a great setting.   This is Jardin.  The food is reasonably priced by Vegas standards, the portions are ample but not overwhelming, and the chef (who, I guess isn't a celebrity, unless his name is Jardin) makes an effort to be original.

wlwS69TCZbt6zgHndSIhpg.text: Wow is all I can say Above board in every way. Pricy but worth it. Was out on business and enjoyed myself a lot! Sat outside by the pool with heaters and just took in the sites and the mist excellent food and wine! Highly recommend if looking for fancy

-wVrCHpgMw8UqF11FiGAQg.text: From the get go, unpleasant reception by waiter, 20 minutes to get a coke for my wife and a beer for me, another 30 minutes to get an appetizer, which was dull and no flavor clam chowder, that looked more than a chicken noodle soup with corn starch on it, in a bun the size of a hawaiian bread. Main dishes, both a disaster, by the way 45 minutes later. A grilled rosemary chicken, with COLD mashed potatoes for me... and my wifes disgusting cheeseburger.... terrible experience. I have stayed at the Wynn many times and eaten at most of their restaurants with amazing results, but this one is really a fiasco. Too bad, won't be coming back to this restaurant. Oh, by the way, the busboy treated us better than the waiter himself.

jyDBHiKHvIig6-FTNCrGEw.text: In a word: disappointed.  In two words: very disappointed.  We had a larger party (more than 5 but not huge by any means).  Originally we went to Wazuzu, but the wait was over an hour.  There were some hungry people in our group that didn't want to wait, so the kind hostess at Wazuzu directed us to Jardin for dinner, as they have a larger dining area.  We put our name in at Jardin (the hostesses were very pleasant) and it was still a 20 minute wait.  Not great, but expected given the crowds this week, and not so long that we didn't think we'd have a problem waiting.  One of the people in our group kept saying that we should take a Lyft to Shake Shack.  I managed to convince them to stay since we'd be seated and eating soon.  I think we were seated within the 20 minute window, so no issues there.  But the problems were about to begin.  Our waiter took our drink orders fairly quickly, but walked away before we could order appetizers.  No problem, he'd be back soon with the drinks... right?  No, not True.  This took awhile as well, I'd guess around 10 minutes.  Long enough that by the time we got the drinks we were ready to order our entrees.  He finishes giving us our drinks and then, again, walks away.  Must have been going to get a notepad or something.  At this point, about fifteen minutes goes by with no contact from our waiter.  Finally I hear him at a table nearby talking to a small party.  Five minutes go by, he must be explaining the wine list.  Ten minutes, he's still talking to them.  I listen closely... they're talking about strip clubs!  I mention this to the people at our table and one of our party actually gets up, walks over to the waiter, and tells him that we're ready to order our food.  Never have I experienced this, but they were getting hungry!  Another five minutes or so goes by and he finally takes our food order.  Obviously we were inconveniencing him.  We felt this way after he took our drink orders, but now it was readily apparent.  We forego appetizers because, after waiting this long, our entrees will be out soon enough.  One of the bussers was kind enough to give us some pretzel appetizers on the house due to the wait, so that was good.  The wait to actually get our food was at least 30 minutes, maybe 45.  And when the food finally came out, one of the entrees was missing.  Whether the kitchen forgot to make it, or the waiter forgot to put the order in is unclear.  My money is on the latter.    We eat, while sharing our food with the odd-man-out, figuring his order would show up pretty quickly.  No... it was another 30 minutes before his food arrived.  He was considering just cancelling so we could leave since everyone was done eating, but then his food came out.  Of course, he didn't have a chance to cancel it since we didn't see the waiter in between the time he gave us our food and the time when the missing plate was ready.  The food itself was mediocre.  That's the best word to describe it.  No one at the table was impressed, especially surprising given how hungry they all were.  You would have thought they'd be ravenous, but everyone was kind of ho-hum about their meals.  We came in with the expectation of "eating food soon"; no high bar at all.  We left upset, some more than others.  I felt bad for convincing the group NOT to go to Shake Shack.  "No, we shouldn't eat fast food for dinner."  Hell, we probably would have eaten faster if we'd stayed at Wazuzu and endured the hour-long wait.    I should never feel emotionally distressed after a meal, which is how I felt after dining here.  The burden of this terrible dining experience is on me, and I've now lost the trust of these people I ate dinner with after pushing them to eat at this restaurant, something I feel I will not be able to restore.  My reputation is ruined amongst those in the group, since I'd never eaten with any of them before.  I will never be able to forgive the restaurant for this, much less our downright terrible waiter.  PS: I do have to give a shout-out to our busser Cris who was far more attentive than our waiter.  He was the high point of this dismal meal for sure.

yFlNG9zrYZjkc0InaFLD7Q.text: I dropped in for breakfast a couple of days ago , and what a regret . You would think being in such a nice resort , the food here would be good at least .  But it wasn't . It a pretty nice location and the decore is great but the food wasn't good at all !!! I mean come on ! What a disappointment ...

qovmH_zHVVGNMSEe-8WfSw.text: That was great experience on Thanksgiving eve. They offered thanksgiving menu 3 course meal which we choose. First course was beet salad or squash soup we took both. Salad came with too salted Brie cheese but soup was perfect. Second course was turkey with classic cranberry sauce and mashed potatoes. Everything was melting on the tongue. Dessert was apple crostata with ice cream. Well... crostata came with too thick crust but apples and ice cream inside was really good combo.  Interior in restaurant is really great. Everything looks modern and elegant. I definitely will be back.  Price was moderate $55 per person. We end up paying $160 with drinks, tip and taxes.

The clam chowder was one of the best we've had as well. And the fleur!!! It was so amazingly decadent. The restaurant itself is very gorgeous, worth every penny!

77cv1y5QUb5B0wUoHCskpA.text: We stayed in town this Christmas and decided to go to Jardin for a Christmas brunch. It was crowded but we never waited long to be served. My husband and I both agreed the food was perfect, not like normal breakfast food. It wasn't greasy and it wasn't over or under seasoned. It was perfect.  My daughter got the hot chocolate and loved it, there was nothing left. She also had the 3 egg breakfast, the bacon was crisp to perfection. My husband had the Maine  lobster Benedict and I went with the kale scramble with pain au chocolate( chocolate croissant).  Overall it was wonderful and all the fresh flowers were bea I would love to return and try dinner next!  We dined here again for dinner. The ambiance was very nice, the lighting was low and service just as good. All our food came out in a good amount of time and it was perfect. We all loved the truffle fries, we love truffle everything. There were three of us and together we could not finish the flower pot cake. It was so moist and delicious.

Our cocktails and food were delicious and they brought out a cute chocolate cupcake with candle and an edible happy birthday note. My sister loved it.

Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Edible flower pot dessert
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wlobQaRNR6G3z2OxIr43tg.text: Atmosphere was fabulous - service excellent and the food was as good as it gets in Vegas for breakfast. With so much to choose from as to where you want to eat your wake up meal of the day, this place is a nice upward run above the usual bill of fare in Vegas!

HzLM5_IAhYLEa3sq5nkAQQ.text: What a great way to start off our day!  Our server was absolutely incredible and recommended so many delicious plates. He was also was very conscious of any allergy concerns we may have. You have try the avocado toast it may have been the best I've ever had. The setting is beautiful and overlooks the pool. You can eat indoors or out. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast!

NaQpTayjXQqJW0iVTnujfw.text: I was looking for my old favorite restaurant Botero but it's been completely remodeled and replaced by Jardin.  I had the Lobster Benedict and it was OK. I can't say it's amazing because the lobster didn't taste fresh. It tastes like it's made from a frozen tail and not a fresh lobster. I would not order this again as it's below expectation for a $26 entree. Very little and low quality lobster meat  I much preferred the Crab Benedict at Terrace Point Cafe to the Lobster Benedict here. My dad only eats for fish and seafood and the only item on the menu was the grilled salmon. He was fine with it. You can also ask for it cooked rare or medium rare as opposed to having it fully cooked like other restaurants.   The pizza portions are huge and they taste great. The only thing is the topping is kind of skimpy for the prosciutto pizza.   I wish they have more lunch options, but the service here is outstanding.

jtOu5slewaHfvJTrUy3XWw.text: I enjoyed everything about this place. The customer service was excellent, the decor is beautiful and the food was delicious. You are greeted immediately by pleasant, well-dressed and polished staff. They confirm your name by cross referencing it with your hotel stay and address you by it during your entire experience.  The seating is lovely, bright colors, sparkling place settings and a fresh brilliantly colored single flower. I choose to sit inside however there is outdoor seating that highlights the beautiful water. My seat gave me an upfront view of the outdoors, beautiful flowers, luxurious seating and the colorful plant life. Gazing out the window was calming and relaxing. As I was seated the host neatly placed my napkin on my lap. I was immediately greeted by another staff member, again by my name who filled my water glass and took my drink order. Once I received my coffee the staff member offered to go over any questions I had about the menu and offer suggestions. I choose coffee to start and the Jardin Burger with fries.  Everything arrived quickly and hot. Before I received my order I was given complementary warm twisted soft butter pretzels with a spicy mustard. Delicious!. My burger was not only delicious it was a beautiful presentation on a wooden cutting board along with lettuce tomatoes and a colorful hot pepper. The fries were so-so nothing to speak about they were eight dollars a little pricey but OK what the heck I'm on vacation.   In all it was a great value, the lunch items are not extremely pricing. I enjoyed the quiet time I spent glaring out into the courtyard. Every restaurant or customer service person at the Encore offers superior customer service! I enjoyed everything about this dining experience if you ever have the opportunity I highly recommend dining at Jardin.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside dining

s9hpmT13_T_ZGt2DU5RV-w.text: Dinner not so hot but they do breakfast right!   Dinner: Mac and cheese bites were bland and gummy not even edible. The seafood pasta had very little seafood at all very disappointing.   The flavor was ok but for $35 for a plate of pasta I was expecting to see and taste the seafood.   Breakfast:  was good, the Jardin eggs benny was cooked perfectly and was very flavorful loved the country ham and the hollandaise sauce tasted like it was made from scratch and pretty flavorful. My wife had the steak and eggs and she thought the hash browns were amazing and steak cooked to perfection. The next day she had the croissant which was huge and tasted light flaky and delicious.   The service was very good, the staff was attentive and accommodating.   3/10 dinner 7/10 breakfast

o-kVOoUt3Kk2ksRrydZCDQ.text: Had the lobster benny. It had a tomato hollandaise that wasn't good and ruined the dish. They also removed the gorgeous floral display in the center. Now looks very plain. Not as good as I remembered from our last visit.

vilRkxBSrATyqR0_BxKZyg.text: Customer service was absolutely great! Food was delicious. Would definitely go back. 100% recommended for breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast

6XnD8Q83uG30mo8riaSsSw.text: Eating healthy in an "Alice in wonderland" setting. - Avocado/hummus/tomato toast: 3.5 stars - beautifully presented, but avocado on top of hummus was a bit odd and two mushy textures together is no bueno  - Lobsta benedict: 4.5 stars - perfectly poached egg atop of meaty lobsta. That hash brown cake was super crispy and delish!  - Shrimp quinoa salad: 4 stars - salad was fresh and the quinoa didn't overwhelm. Shrimp cooked well. - Fresh juice: 5 stars - so delicious and all fresh squeezed! - Vegetable soup: 3 stars - flavorful, but all the veggies were diced the same size, which I found odd  Overall, beautiful setting and my stummy left happy and feeling happy (not overstuffed)

j-6ErQl4gymwLEhLtQbcew.text: This was one of the most beautifully decorated restaurants I have seen in a while. Gorgeous giant centerpiece of flowers in the center of the restaurant. The Wynn always has beautiful flower displays. And the waitress was very attentive and sweet. We came for my birthday lunch mostly for the flower pot cake.  The food in all was good, nothing spectacular or anything to come back for but because of the cake, and service it was still a great experience.  We started off with a margarita pizza, it was good but soggy.  Then my friend had a salad and I had the salmon plate, again both good but nothing out of this world.  The flower pot cake is gorgeous, it's a chocolate cake with a little cherry filling I believe. Everything is edible including the flowers and white chocolate birthday card they give you with it if it is your birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y63T6egrHQlzrKfTaiC7hA.text: Very slow service when nearly empty. Draft made our food cold in 5 min. Great location and food is tasty. Otherwise terrible

Yl9ZkGId1BHJGqLc0M_jmA.text: Normally a first rate experience but this time the server was more interested in visiting with the other staff. Not once did I get a water refill, asked how my meal was, or had my dirty plates taken away. I practically had to beg for a dessert menu. For the prices they charge I expect much more timeliness and attentiveness. The mitigating factor was the food quality and presentation. Otherwise this trip would rate as a 1.

ntSVTz0wfVgddo7MkY7n6A.text: Very nice, relaxed spot with outdoor garden style dining. An excellent choice at anytime but also if you want to come in for a mid afternoon snack/light bite. Highly recommend the buffalo cauliflower, meat & cheese board and truffle fries. Really friendly service!

RBmiQu-RpK-uyRYKtzmTVQ.text: Hi expectations not met- Rey disappointing meal, prime rib 60% fat the remaining rubbery and no taste, my wife's dinner, reheated, dry pasta.  Do yourself a favor-don't dine here!

W8SppJro-zHbYPVJ_YvdDw.text: Went for a birthday dinner with 8 people.  The service was good.  Sangria was excellent.  The item everyone raved about was the green pizza.  The beet salad was on the tiny side but delicious.  The real miss was the flower pot cake.  Way too rich and chocolatey.  It's a beautiful setting though.

TD01U7bg_BU2S8uoPtjCJA.text: Came here after the pool party starving & we were craving burgers, chicken strips with fries. So the friendly concierge guy referred us to Jardin and we ordered from the bartender who was also very friendly and approachable. He told us that the burgers weren't on the menu but they could gladly make it for us.   For 3 burgers/fries & 1 order of chicken strips w/ fries it came out to $60. They were so delicious too. Def will be back.   They also have the most beautiful flower arrangements.

0vdkYQhuGmHowtINhm_sDA.text: Very nice brunch place. The inside area as well as the outside area by the pool are both good.  The truffle pizza was excellent !! The vegan cauliflower wrap is super too.

P_dAUJOu1kmkDFHWB45gmg.text: Tasting menu is awesome. Steak is soft, tender, juicy and chef works hard and do the best. Amazing garden salads.

B_xPvdqZzfj8ZnEDp06kFQ.text: Liked Botero,  where Jardin now is and liked Society Cafe, which Jardin has replaced,  but really liked Jardin.   This is a perfect all around upper scale casual, yet almost fine dining establishment. Service was superb, menu was varied and well priced and the new lighter decor was lovely.   Will gladly return when we get back to the Encore,  which is fairly frequently, since it's our favorite hotel in town.

Y6ce-p5f-bnQGUwe3u6FSw.text: I have to say this may have been the best dining experience I ever had.  My friend had reserved the table for us in the event of a huge crowd and I arrived 5 minutes later and already had water and waiter was all set to introduce himself. Shortly after taking our order he brought out complimentary pretzel sticks which I thought were unbelievably delicious.   The best part of the experience was the view. We had an outdoor table and it was right next to the pool giving a wonderful vibe.  The food was delivered 13 minutes after we ordered and was fantastic. The waiter always kept coming back to check on us and refill our water which was great because it was quite hot.  In short the experience was nothing short of perfect and I would be willing to dine there in future trips to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner for 2 was quite delicious
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nbtGbjSd9_1kd4r4bu0PpQ.text: Nice place for breakfast in Encore, but not as good as Tableau on the Wynn side. The choices were rather basic but well prepared. The bagel and lox were good except the tomatoes were sliced cherry tomatoes which were hard to keep on the bagel. The eggs and bacon were fine but the meal was expensive.

hTsW3iGrR0ief1KLXXw_vg.text: Maybe it's more like 3.5 but, it was just OK.  The OJ is not fresh squeezed at all.. in fact, for the whole Wynn/Encore property, there was a blatant disregard to fresh OJ. I'm all for paying $8 for OJ when it's truly fresh squeezed.. but when you give me a glass of sour, watered down crap, you're shitting on my whole day! My hubby felt the same about the coffee...both those items being the first sips of the whole day, you want it to be good and get you off to a great start. Go weak with it, you might as well throw water in my face and send me on my way. That's a bit dramatic, but we take our OJ and coffee seriously!  You look at a place like Jardin and, wow, what a stunning GORGEOUS scene. Fresh flowers boasting throughout, mirrors everywhere. You feel you're in for an amazing dining experience.  But, no.. no.. the experience IS the visual scene around you because the food is meh. The service was weird too..I couldn't keep track who was my waiter or busperson and I felt our busguy was more helpful than our waiter and our waiter was hella snooty.   I had the lobster benedict with hashbrowns (which is more of an herby potato brick) and my hubs has the pancakes. I liked the benedict OK, I had to ask for more hollandaise sauce, as they literally put a thimble-full on the eggs. I had a bite of the pancakes and they were just doughy, no fancy flavors..I didn't even taste vanilla or any other flavor enhancements that could be used to make pancakes amazing!  So there ya have it. If you're just wanting to grab a drink or take in a beautiful setting. Jardin is the place to do it! If you want an amazing breakfast within the property, try the Terrace Point Cafe.

v4QI0ylHd1-k6kovciRqNg.text: I don't understand the low stars, every time we come here for brunch ,the food is so fresh and full of flavor . They have lots of healthy fresh pressed juices and great cocktails . The service is amazing and very professional . Not to mention how lit up it is with fresh flowers and all the windows to enjoy the view of the pool . Yes , it busy so just make sure you make a reservation for brunch or breakfast .

tegxXNyjptHUdhcir2y5FA.text: We tried Jardin for breakfast and we weren't disappointed. The hostesses were friendly as they led us to the table. It was really nice in the restaurant but not over the top. There is a large case in the center with silk flowers and a ring on the ceiling above. It was pretty, but not elegant in my opinion.   The server came right over, got us water and coffee stat. Our orders were taken in a reasonable amount of time and our food was out in 10-15. It filled up shortly after we got in.   My chicken and waffles consisted of a large, breaded chicken tender and a piece of French toast with a Frosted Flakes type breaking and a sunny side egg in the middle. There was no waffle. I don't know why they call it chicken and waffles, but it was really good none-the-less. The French toast was very nice and flavorful. My hubby had eggs benedict  and said it was "pretty good."   Nice and simple and close to the room. You don't have to go out in 111 degree weather.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict. Must have been good, hubby finished before I poured my syrup.
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles, only its French toast with a sunny side egg in the middle. That being said, it was still delicious!

ZnnNQ8WoYnwCd3xrzLQSsQ.text: Love love  love this place. Went twice on our visit with the same waiter "Chuck" he's efficient , pleasant & handsome the food was exceptional and very fairly priced..  The food and ambiance is beautiful.

NAO_PQdTAC81onB_RGYP2w.text: Excellent spot for breakfast. I had an omelette and side of bacon. Service was great and ambiance was very nice. I thought the portion size would be small, but it was not at all. Hash brown potatoes are excellent, kind of rolled into a square or ball. I highly recommend coming here for breakfast or brunch. Coffee was excellent as well. It was not busy, but suggest a reservation. Also, the food is pricey, but should be expected given it is in Encore.

FlofsO_Zb4_BL1JOXQ32OQ.text: We are always looking for a new breakfast spot to try, being residents here in Awesome Las Vegas!  We decided to try Jardin out and were pleasantly surprised. My wife just loves this place and we have already been there twice over the past two weekends!   Each time I went we made reservations. The staff is very professional and polite. The center atrium is just so relaxing to look at. The food was incredible! I had the Nutella Hazelnut banana French Toast, which not only had great presentation but was delicious, as well! My 11 year old son had the lox and bagel,  which he found to be very tasty and my wife had the lobster benedict which she thought was outstanding. I was able to try the Cubano, which I thought was just ok. I ordered the Orange Lavender Mule - incredible... My wife tried it and it is now her favorite style of Mule out there on the strip.  Our second trip, I had the Grilled Cheese with tomato soup -Hands down one of the best grilled cheese I've ever had. The tomato soup tasted like a slightly rich marinara sauce was outstanding. Dipping the grilled chees into it - decadent. My son had the organic Salmon which he crushed and was extremely happy with. My wife had the Caesar salad with chicken which was really delicious!  We doo look forward to coming here again whether we have guest in town or not. It is a wonderful restaurant with great food, service and scenery. Highly recommend this place!

B0PjMqOzsgY6QMSJbTYWWw.text: A pleasant, but nothing special restaurant. Was relaxing, an important attribute in Vegas. Reminded me of a restaurant at a Disney resort. The best thing were the chicken meatballs, which were really tasty.

h-T4lnFVXCvqDWu8oMiMzg.text: We recently ate at this restaurant. Not only was it expensive, the portions were very small and the food was just OK. We were both left hungry after a meal that cost over $100 without any alcohol. Also, the server was nice but apparently the chef is very concerned with price. For example, my husband asked to substitute the cauliflower mash that came with his prime rib for some French fries. When we got the bill for an extra $9 for the fries and questioned it, the server said he had asked the chef and the chef said "no" to the substitution because it was cheaper to serve the tiny portion of cauliflower than a potato!! However, they didn't tell us until the bill came. I do not recommend this place.

Ouvv5r8Om7hOydWXVm2clQ.text: I threw myself a party before a concert at the Wynn Encore Theater. Had a Corn Bread Creme Brulee that was an amazing  experience. I wonder what life would be like if the waiter hadn't given me a tip on this dish. Hope it's not a once in a lifetime experience. Loved this place.

uSWmhfl0Nxt8twNpAypPvQ.text: The turkey burgers were a little burnt. The short rib was whatever. The tempeh dish is horrible. Arugula salad is fantastic. They need to work on the menu selection. Beautiful restaurant though

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F9teBU-mP6PWqwuJ-4ua5Q.text: I had the organic salmon and it was amazing. I've also had the jdori chicken and it's equally as delicious. We always eat at the bar and have a great experience. The dining room is lovely and so is the view. There is a Moscow Mule cart that comes around should you want one prepared table side. Dress nice when you come. Nice jeans work but hats and baggy sweats are a bad idea. So are basketball shorts.

zDkg_TjLZ7Dtr8gmixcBqA.text: New restaurant between the Encore and Wynn. They just opened on Friday, December 18, 2015!  The decor is very romantic in the evening, especially with a poolside view.  The cuisine is Italian and is very good. the portions are sizes perfectly if you order aa appetizer or side to share. If your group is larger than 2 you will have room for dessert.  That staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.  The wife and I had a nice romantic dinner at a window table overlooking the pool.  We started with the complimentary pretzel.bread and ordered the Margarita flatbread (like a thin crust personal pizza).  Then we had the Oven Baked Prawns and the Short Rib Ravioli.  Great tasting and just enough so that you feel satisfied without being stuffed. No room for dessert but the wife took pictures which I have posted.  Five stars!

Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert tray
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oven baked prawns

RKjGKh7JCEcFL00F_jkvPA.text: Best Maine Lobster Benedict!!! I've been here a few times already and staff was amazing! Came here for brunch with one of my girl friends and we sat outside, weather was just right, not too hot/cold. Plus we got to enjoy views of the Encore pool. Jardin means "garden" in French and this restaurant is suppose to make you feel like you just stepped in one. Lots of fresh, floral arrangements in the restaurant and a huge one right in the middle of it. We both got the Orange Lavendar moscow mule and lobster benedicts. The moscow mule was strong, but still blends well with the orange, which I liked! Keep it coming! And the lobster benedicts was just how a perfect lobster should taste like with just the right amount of buttery goodness! The staff is so accommodating here. On another occasion, I came and just missed breakfast service! The waiter told me he'll check for me because there still was some breakfast items in the kitchen. Sure enough, I still got to have my bacon, eggs, and potatoes! This place is a Wynner!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. maine losbter benedict - a must try!
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. orange lavendar moscow mule - yum!

4y30Ka73r_Rylazv5arOJA.text: So pleased with the service ! I have a hard time traveling due to my allergies. It's hard to find restaurants that take them seriously . They were so friendly and even presented it in foil so that my salmon didn't get any cross contamination. I'll be back the rest of my stay at the wynn. Thank you Scott, Chef Zannelli and Rick !

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BPw3xb4Znar6hT1DLa8_5Q.text: WOW!  Went there for dinner before the Moody Blues concert.  What an amazing meal!  I thought that we would be served a "Pre Fixe" meal of lesser quality- boy was I wrong.  Our reservation was not on the list, but despite that hiccup, the whole experience was extremely enjoyable.  The meal started with fresh-baked-warm-from-the-oven pretzel sticks served with mustard butter.  We had an appetizer next.  I had the beet salad which was good (had to look deep for the beets), my husband had the quinoa salad (huge portion), but the best appetizer was my friend's meatballs.  Four huge spicy chicken meatballs in a thick homemade sauce.  They serve this in an adorable cast iron skillet with a hunk of melted cheese in the middle.  Our main course was the filet- which we all had at our table.  OUTSTANDING!  It was cooked to perfection and soft as butter.  The dessert choice was a pear crostada or a small assortment of pastries.  GO FOR THE PASTRIES!  There were 4 servings of the best desserts I've had in a long time.  The chocolate "cake pop" was the most delicious.  There was a butterscotch pudding, a mango macaroon, and red velvet cupcake along with the cake pop.  The wine selection was fabulous and the glass we got with the prefixe meal was really good!  I would definitely go back- and would recommend this beautiful setting for any celebration.  The outside seating is spectacular at night!  Great place!!!

4WVkiG6dzLSyXC6BG8otLQ.text: Food is ok but service just horrible. I don't order a menu with wine pairing if the pairing wine arrive after I finish my course. So many other basic mistakes like that all dinner long...yes sorry you failed, won't come back here

tqZ_3UG_YiOjsgrInyet-A.text: Food here is total ripped off. I spent $30 bucks for sea scallop dish that came with only 3 scallops a little bigger than mine thumb. It's tasted normal. Luckily it came with some bread and a couple glasses to help filled up my stomach. If paid just for the decoration then it's ok otherwise should eat first before come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ea5__H5yXx-i4jMVn0eJZg.text: One word: Excellent! A lot of vegetarian choices, fresh juices and amazing staff! Love this place!

g8RciMFAo8OpMXOoTid0Bg.text: My family were staying at the Encore. Very good food and service was excellent went for breakfast. Had the Kale Scramble it was very tasty. I will eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale Scramble and Apple Chicken Sausage. Tasty.

0e0aRVdLoqYzonxXUBdEXA.text: This place was absolutely phenomenal from the service to the drinks to the food! Everything was wonderful! All The staff were just great friendly very welcoming! Our server Joshua was awesome best waiter we have ever had literally!! So accommodating he knew the menu extremely well helped us make out delicious selections. Please try the moscow  mule! This drink was heavenly tasting so light and fruity and refreshing and just strong enough! The food WOW everything we had from the appetizer to the entree to dessert just delicious chef was great! Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oven baked mac &amp; cheese and jidori chicken!

VzxoMY-2DvgJptjAWXq44w.text: Beautiful place. If you want to an amazing food in a high end restaurant, this is defiantly the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful place. If you want to have a delicious dinner in a high end restaurant, this is the place to go.

kSZttK0vqKuxgXMqaXOOtw.text: Food was OK, but unbelievably overpriced for breakfast. For the price, it should have been perfect and just wasn't. They forgot to bring out my brother-in-laws OJ. I ordered the lox benedict that was just way too overpowered by the avocado. Could have used more lox, less avocado. Everyone else enjoyed their food, but honestly, nothing that great.

4GlqtoZ2bC7DkIxB4gVwUg.text: Jardin,  Four of us had a royal breakfast here. We relished every bit of it, awesome. I had a couple of breakfasts here several years ago when Encore was first built. This time, third time, it was a charm. I had 2 glasses of fresh squeezed green juice. It was so refreshingly pleasing to my taste buds; I was tempted to have several more glasses. We pretty much randomly picked various dishes. All of the dishes were so tasty, wowing all 4 of us.  The waitress was cheerful, eager to serve, and actually listening and accommodating whatever whims we had. She even spread jam on the left-over bread that we wanted to take out, truly above and beyond.  We were seated right next to the centerpiece of "royal" bouquet, humongous and grandiose and still very elegant.  We paid $200 for 4 of us, a bit pricey, but we still felt real good; worth every penny it was.  Instead of the long lines at Wynn breakfast buffet, this is now officially our favorite poolside breakfast nook in Vegas.

9TVUjU0ehr6v-eM9L0b0PA.text: Came here for my Bday dinner and my friend told the host it was my Bday twice. She then also mentioned it to the waitress. Our waitress was kinda slow & didn't really check on us. When our dessert came, We expected a candle or something or some kind of Bday acknowledgement.... but nope... nothing...and of course we're not gonna ask for it. Food was mediocre and price was reasonable. The decor and ambience was nice. Just a lil disappointed with the service. Probably won't be back.

-CiFqVb06ZF_LhjUMcJvDQ.text: This is not $$. This place is ridiculously overpriced. My husband and I went there for lunch and ordered the following: cheeseburger and fries, steak salad and two iced teas. Our bill was $80. You are better off going to a buffet or CPK across the street at the mall.

p-AaHsFZfM3sjQbHkm3N7g.text: Lovely spot for brunch at Encore hotel.  Ambiance is great, exactly what you want before heading to the pool.  On Saturday, they had a Bloody Mary & Mimosa cart rolling around the restaurant, and it was fantastic!! Made to order, and the best Bloody Mary I've ever had!  Service was hit or miss.  On Saturday, we sat inside.  It took a while to get coffee refilled and the food took a while to come out.  On Sunday, we sat outside, and the waiter was fast and fantastic. The kitchen is where Jardin could use some improvement. I would skip anything with poached eggs unless you enjoy raw egg whites.  On Saturday, I ordered the Eggs Benedict. Hardly any of the white was cooked. I'm not sure how they even got the egg to maintain it's shape on the plate.  On Sunday, I ordered the lobster Benedict.  I noted upfront the issue from the day before, and still one of the eggs again came out with raw whites! I'm not asking them to master rocket science, just to cook the whites of an egg...!

tS8SzzBpoVxj4Lcjyz5NZA.text: We came here for brunch this past Sunday and ordered the Buttermilk Pancakes and BBQ Sandwich. Food tasted mediocre and there wasn't much of a selection. The Orange Lavender Moscow Mule tasted amazing. The waiter was very nice and attentive, and the restaurant had tasteful decor with a bright and relaxing view of the gardens. Sadly, the food didn't match up to the rest of the restaurant.

lpFnc95YjasDrvmUPDchtg.text: Ordered a lobster eggs Benedict and the egg wasn't even poached... It was more boiled than poached... The bloody Mary's here are below average and they don't have mimosas, or actually anything alcoholic that isn't a Bloody Mary. What brunch place doesn't have mimosas? Tiny Tabasco bottles are a plus

_JD6rpJ5Vb4BX2zEZRc7yg.text: The food here is excellent, but the service (at least at the bar), could use some help. I came in twice last Saturday, both before and after going to Encore Beach Club. I first came in around 1pm to meet a girlfriend, who had been waiting for me at the bar for a good 10-15 minutes, and she was still waiting to place her drink order. We ended up eventually ordering a drink and chatting for a bit before the pool. After leaving the pool we were hungry so we decided to go back to the bar to order some food. Like I said our food was great, but the service wasn't great, I'll just leave it at that. My guess is they were going through a shift change. Anyway my smoked salmon and beet salad was excellent and so were the french fries and broccolini. They also had some amazing gluten free bread, which I've never had before, but my friend is gluten free so I tried it and I absolutely loved it. I definitely want to eat here again, but I'll probably sit at a table next time.

R19LKIwHLaSc4a-18w_92w.text: Delicious. Got eggs classic Benedict. Loved the hash browns. Tasty. Worth it. The pancakes we got were okay I could have lived without ordering them

photos.caption: Photo of Jardin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful

4oTl6Y38lkAlklAs95v7hg.text: Just wonderful.  The food was exceptional!  The quality, the selection, the taste, I was so impressed.  And reasonable- for Vegas. Our waitress, Veronique, was excellent.  Do yourself a favor and skip the buffet and eat a wonderfully prepared healthy meal.  Don't skip the chocolate flower pot cake -amazing and beautiful ($18 but it feeds 4).  It was the best meal in Vegas I have had in years

FNjD0XMVUvHhxA9EvFzrig.text: My boyfriend and I are locals and made plans last minute to do a staycation for the weekend. We called the Wynn and was told that Jardin was the place that could accommodate our reservation time. The waiter was polite and efficient. Everything we ordered came out fast (almost too fast). The food was average at best. I would not recommend this restaurant to a friend

tnAUvwe2H5BaH5tG7yKJ2g.text: Hands down best breakfast anywhere on the Strip. This located in the Encore and it takes some effort to get there if you're not staying at the Wynn. My Wife and I stayed at Trump down the block though ate 75% of our meals at either the Wynn or Encore. Every meal eaten in either location was outstanding. The service at Jardin is not good and that is really too bad. I would venture to say it's bad. I hate having to wait for coffee refills and an absent server. The average breakfast tab will be $60 so for that price the service should be amazing. Food and view are excellent, service quite bad.
